loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a married woman with five children. She operates a retail business where she sells maize, cereals, and other cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a big cereal store within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 56 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Fely has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Fely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is 31 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Rena has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 55 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Melanie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, canned goods, etc. for her restaurant business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Injeliha

texts.en:
Injeliha is 55 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Injeliha has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Injeliha aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 77 years old, married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

Her economic activity is dairy and vegetable farming. She is applying for a Kiva loan to buy dairy feed and fertilizers to improve her farm production. This will increase her income, which she will use to buy water storage tanks for domestic and farming activities.

She is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed and vegetables to improve her farming production for increased income to buy water storage tanks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.name: Welyneth

texts.en:
Welyneth is a 28-year-old woman who runs a sari-sari store business in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She sell items like candies, chips, powder detergent, toiletries, seasoning and spices. With a six-year-old daughter, Welyneth can only dream of many ways to earn a living. She wants to make improvements, however she has limited funds at the moment.

Welyneth is asking for a loan to replenish her store with more stock, especially those that sell on a daily basis. She will use the loan to buy items like detergent, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, chips, candies and seasoning. She hopes that with the help of the loan she will be able to increase her income for her family. She also dreams of sending her child to school someday.

loans.use: to buy canned food detergent, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, chips, candies and seasoning

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 38-year-old businesswoman from Ajuy, Iloilo. Since 2000, she has had a business where she sells cell phone accessories, batteries, flashlights, DVDs and plastic cabinets. 

Her items sell well and she is in need of additional capital to buy more cell phone accessories. Because of this, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner MFI. The income generated will afford her a healthy diet and education of her five children ages one to eighteen. In the future, she would like to buy more items that she can sell to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories

loans.name: Adelide

texts.en: Adelide is a Kiva borrower. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, milk, flour, salt, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben is a married man with five children. He describes himself as responsible. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman with two children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future she will have a big cereal store. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Grupo La Gran Familia Group

texts.es:
Elisandra es una mujer con la visión de superación, tiene 23 años de edad es soltera con una linda familia de  una hija de 6 meses, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de san Antonio Suchitepéquez.
Elisandra (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde la comunidad de su hogar y esto le permite cuidar mejor de su hija y realizar otras actividades de su casa, con este negocio lleva ella cinco años. Elisandra es higiénica, con buenos hábitos para la preparación de sus tortillas y por esa razón cuenta con mucha clientela y con el  producto que ella posee ya no se da abasto, a raíz de esta necesidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de más materiales y seguir  preparando  tortillas para sus consumidores, con el préstamo ella comprara maíz y leña.
Su esperanza de vida es tener su propia casa para que ella y su hija vivan mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Elisandra is a woman with a vision of self-improvement.  She is 23 years old and single.  She and her 6-month-old daughter make up her beautiful family.  This lovely family lives in the community of San Antonio Suchitepéquez.

In order to bring in income and move her family forwards, Elisandra (pictured on the right-hand side of the photo) makes a living selling tortillas from the comfort of her home.   This allows her to better take care of her daughter and do other chores around the house.  She has been doing this business for 5 years.

Elisandra is hygienic, and her good tortilla-making habits have brought her many customers, to the point where her current supplies are not enough.   Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more materials and continue preparing tortillas for her customers.  She will use the loan to buy corn and firewood.  

Her hope in life is to have her own home so that she and her daughter can live a better life.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Ghulikhan

texts.en:
Ghulikhan, his wife and their four daughters live in Sorik village in the Aragatsotn region of Armenia. Starting in his youth, he became increasingly experienced as a farmer. His farm expanded, and he now has thirteen cows, eight calves, fifty sheep and sixty hens. He also grows wheat and sells it in the local markets. As the main breadwinner of the family Ghulikhan has to work hard every day to support them.

Ghulikhan has been approved for a 13,000 USD loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Ghulikhan will be using this loan to buy forage for feeding his livestock throughout the winter.

After years of tireless work Ghulikhan has been able to develop a farm that is profitable enough to cover monthly loan payments. He hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy forage for feeding his livestock throughout the winter.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer trabajadora, generosa y muy perseverante, con 26 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en una comunidad del caserío Chumango.
Maria con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa, desde hace cinco años decidió elegir una actividad que le permitiera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la actividad que dignamente realiza es la producción de banano y café, pues la zona donde ella vive es  muy fértil.  Para Maria trabajar en el campo no es ninguna dificultad es por ello que con el deseo de mejorar su producción de banano ha tomado la decisión de mejorar el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café pero lamentablemente no tiene los recursos necesarios por esa razón acude a un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra. Con esta inversión Maria espera obtener al final del año una mejor producción de café, para comprar más terreno e incrementar su cultivo.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking, generous, and very perseverant woman. At 26 years old, she lives along with her family in a community of the small village of Chumango.

Maria, with the desire to make an income and support her parents with the home expenses, at five years old decided to choose an activity that would allow her to improve her living conditions. The activity that she performs with dignity is the production of banana trees and coffee plants. The zone where she lives is very fertile. For Maria, working in the country is not a difficulty.

It is because of this that with a desire to improve her production of banana trees, she has taken the decision to improve the maintenance of her coffee crops. Unfortunately, she does not have the necessary resources. For this reason, she is turning to a loan to purchase fertilizers and to pay labor costs. With this investment, Maria hopes at the end of the year to obtain a better production of coffee, to purchase more land, and increase her crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor for the maintenance of coffee plants.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane says, "I have always wanted to own a biogas system but I could not afford to pay the total cost upfront. Now with this loan from Takamoto Biogas, I will be able to own a biogas system and reduce my reliance on firewood as a source of fuel." She says she is most proud of being a wonderful mother to her children. Biogas will enable her to keep caring for her family.

loans.use: to buy a biodigester for clean cooking and renewable energy.

loans.name: Rosemalen

texts.en:
Filipino children especially in rural areas find pleasure from simple things. They are not very familiar with high-tech gadgets, but they appreciate playing with other children through street games and unfussy toys.

Rosemalen wants to give simple joys to children; that is why she chose to venture into selling toys along the street near a national high school in Calumpang, General Santos City. It’s a prolific place for her business because students pass by her stall after school and they usually play along the street. Rosemalen has been running her business for 13 years already and it’s been a good source of additional income for her family’s daily sustenance and the education of her four children. It adds to her husband Ronnie’s income as contractor.

Rosemalen would like to add more selection of toys that will surely entice the buyers. She also contemplates adding candies and school supplies to her inventory. She is in need of PHP 30,000 supplementary capital to procure these. With additional supplies, she anticipates an increase in her sales and profit. In due time, she hopes to have a presentable stall for her business.

Rosemalen would like to see her children with stable jobs and secure families in the future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more toys, candies and school supplies to sell

loans.name: Wilder Amado

texts.es:
Wilder con 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Wilder se dedica a prestar servicio de cabinas de internet, mantenimiento de computadoras, tipeos, etc. Desde hace casi 02 años. Se solicita préstamo para comprar material para su negocio.El crédito a otorgarle le facilitará seguir obteniendo ingresos mensuales a su unidad familiar.

Wilder si cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo en nuestra institución financiera.
texts.en:
Wilder is 42-years-old and married.  He lives with his wife and children in the district of Zaña, Chiclayo province, department of 
Lambayeque, Peru.  The majority of people in the area make a living in farming, trade, or ranching.  

Wilder has made a living providing internet booth services and maintaining computers and word processors, among other things, for 2 years.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his business.  The loan will allow him to continue bringing in income every month for his family.  

Wilder has credit experience, and he is a new member in our financial institution.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his business.

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila, her husband and their two children live in Mastara village in the Aragatsotn region of Armenia. When she was very young she started farming, growing diverse crops including wheat and keeping livestock.

Lyudmila and her husband own a big farm, the family’s only source of income. There they raise cows, calves, sows, piglets and hens. She has applied for a 2,650 USD loan through Kiva's field partner SEF to buy wheat seeds for their field and forage for feeding their livestock during the winter.

As this is Lyudmila’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who don’t have access to credit products because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds for their field and forage for feeding their livestock during the winter.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
This 36-year-old entrepreneur, Charlyn, dreams of becoming the biggest dried-fish dealer in Mindanao someday. As of now, she gradually works toward this dream. She buys a large volume of dried fish and distributes it to several vendors in Calumpang, General Santos City. She also runs a variety store in front of her house as a supplementary source of income. Three helpers assist her in these businesses.

Now that it’s the rainy season in the Philippines, Charlyn wants to prepare for the upcoming days. She wants to have additional capital of PHP 60,000 to enhance her buying power when dried fish gets expensive. She will buy different varieties of dried fish in high volume which she can supply to several stores and vendors. This additional capital will keep her business running even during the rainy season. Its income will continually sustain their everyday needs and educational expenses of their children.

Charlyn and her husband, Jonar, aspire to buy a delivery truck for easy access to buyers and suppliers. Their goal is to make their business prosper, gain stability in the midst of stiff competition, complete their children’s education, and enjoy a better living condition someday.

Charlyn is a zealous member of CCT where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of dried fish in high volume

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives in Martvili district with her husband and daughter. The family is involved in agricultural activities. Specifically, they have two cows and a plot of agricultural land, where they grow fruit and vegetables. 

Maka has decided to expand the husbandry business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,600 GEL. With the received credit, Maka will purchase pigs and will expand her husbandry business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and expand her husbandry business.

loans.name: Grupo Chuamango Group

texts.es: Lucia (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) es una de las muchas personas que sus vidas sean visto muy beneficiadas con el apoyo de los créditos que han recibido en Adicla, Lucia con el préstamo pudo brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo de  banano y gracias a Dios pudo venderlos en su mercado regional, con su ganancia logro comprar una cuerda de terreno y su cultivo ha incrementado, con este avanece Lucia está muy  contenta, pero ella nuevamente tiene la necesidad de un préstamo y en esta ocasión lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, con esta inversión Lucia espera obtener una buena cosecha para que sus ingresos mejores y bridarle a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Lucia (the furthest on the left in the photograph) is one of many people who have benefited from the support of the loans they have received through Adicla. With her previous loan, Lucia was able to take care of her banana crop and, thanks to God, was able to sell her product in a regional market. With the profit she made, she managed to buy an acre of land and her harvest has increased.

Lucia is very happy with this progress, but she needs another loan, and this time she will buy fertilizer and pay for the labor costs of maintaining her coffee crop. With this investment, Lucia hopes to have a good harvest so that her income increases and she can give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the labor costs of maintaining her coffee crop.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Nyenyezi School, located in Garden’s Township of Lusaka, was officially registered in 2012 by Martha. Before then, Nyenyezi was being rented and run as a school under a different administrator. Due to poor management, the children and the school surroundings suffered greatly. When Martha noticed what was happening, she decided to reclaim the property and adopted the school and the already enrolled children under her close management.

This decision was led by Martha’s passion to help the children in the community she comes from. Her mission is to help the children realise a better future, and to be an inspiration, mentor and role model to them. Martha realises that the children at Nyenyezi School come from low-income homes and because of this, she only charges minimal fees that are used for the day-to-day running of the school.

Nyenyezi is a non-profit school whose vision is to equip children with the tools they need for a successful future through education and mentorship. Nyenyezi wishes to purchase iSchool ZEduPad tablets - educational tablets that have been pre-loaded with e-learning content - to aid in her efforts to provide the children at Nyenyezi School with quality education involving ICT.

loans.use: to purchase iSchool ZEduPad tablets - educational tablets that have been pre-loaded with e-learning content for use by the children in her school.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Catherine, 42 years old, married and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and learned more skills on enterprise development and financial management. This has enabled her to manage her enterprise more profitably.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fodder for her cows that will help improve the milk productivity. She intends to use the profits from the business to provide better education and medical care for her family.

Catherine appreciates Kiva and the lenders for the support and help and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her cows that will help improve the milk productivity.

loans.name: Mamathe.com Group

texts.en:
Ramaqele is a 67-year-old father of five children and grandfather of three children aged between 5 and 12 years old. His wife passed on a few years back, and he not only takes care of his children but also has to take care of his three young grandchildren and sick elderly sister who is 75 years old.

Ramaqele lives in a modern hut although it is not well ventilated, nor does it warm up well in winter. He works many hours to ensure there is enough food for his entire family. Some of his family go school and only help his elderly sister work in the field on Saturdays and Sundays to make a bit extra for the family. He and his eldest daughters have to wake up very early, between 3 a.m. and 4 a.m., during the week to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water and warming the house for all the children before they go to school.

Collecting firewood, setting up the fire and doing the actual cooking demands a lot of time. Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high; winters can get very cold and often people often have to start the fire inside their huts. Starting a fire releases smog and smoke which when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time can lead to lung diseases, eye problems and in the worst case to death. In these circumstances, life for people like Ramaqele has been very difficult.

Ramaqele has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, in order to be able to purchase clean cook stoves which provide him and 12 other people from his village, who are living in similar circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families and that does not require a lot of fuel, which is hard to find in Lesotho, nor expensive paraffin and gas. This stove can be started with the use of very little, readily available biomass like dry twigs and dry cow dung that do not require a long time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the homes.

This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones and a mini LED lamp. This is a life-improving package for these people. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates the element of toxic inhalation, house burning and has given them the freedom to have a better-lit home to see better in the evening while cooking. It also enables children to do their homework. For stove info please check www.africancleanenergy.com.

loans.use: to be able to pay for the ACE cook stove which will improve his life in terms of health, cost of fuel and the time he spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.en:
The members of the San Miguel group live in a small village where there is no electrification through power lines, so they had to use candles, oil lamps and lanterns after dark.

The most veteran member of this group is Simeon, standing third from the right in the picture. He and his neighbors had never had electricity at home before they installed third-generation solar home systems. Today, Simeon can listen to a radio connected to it and make many things in the evening due to the electric lighting provided by the system.

The loan is asked to fund those systems and will be paid back with the monthly fee for the first-year-of-operation maintenance services they pay.

loans.use: to pay for a photovoltaic system to install in his house.

loans.name: Macuil Group

texts.en:
Blanca, standing third from the left in the picture, is a mother of two children who has decided together with some neighbors, such as Florelia (in the pasted thumbnail), to improve their living conditions.
They have formed the Macuil group to have access to third generation solar home systems that can provide them with electric lighting and connection to some devices in the remote small village where they live.
The loan is requested to fund those systems and will be paid back with the monthly fee for first-year-of-operation maintenance services they pay.

loans.use: to pay for photovoltaic (solar electric) systems to install in their house.

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.en:
Jesus is 51 years old and lives in the municipality of Santa Barbara. Some years ago, his family was going through a difficult time due to the lack of money, so this man used what his father taught him a long time ago and started a raising of pigs business, something that allows him to provide for his family and give them a better quality of life.

Even so, the business faces some issues like it has big competition in its location. He wants to invest in his business so he has more to offer and can compete better. He expects that he can get more profits. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy a male pig that can reproduce so his business keeps growing.

Jesus dreams of having a big inventory in the future so his business can be more successful. He also would love to improve the conditions of his house so his family can live better. You can help Jesus to achieve all his objectives with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy a male pig that can reproduce so his business keeps growing.

loans.name: Lady Maricela

texts.en:
Lady is 29 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello. This woman has a big talent that only her family and close friends have had the opportunity to taste. Lady is a great cook who prepares delicious food, and one of her dreams is to keep studying and learn new techniques that she can use.

She has some economic issues that have prevented her from studying what she wants. She’s decided not only to study but to start her own cooking place, because for her it is a passion, and when someone works with passion everything turns out great. She’s asking for a loan so she can pay for her studies in confectionery.

Lady dreams of being a great cook and baker and having a successful and recognized business. You can help her study so she can start to accomplish all her dreams. A loan will allow her that.

loans.use: pay for her study in confectionery

loans.name: Gerardo Enrique

texts.en:
Gerardo is 50 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Escondido. He has a business that he started in 1985, which means that he’s been working on his farm, raising cattle for 30 years, more than half of his life. He started this because he and his family were having economic issues.

For the many years that he has been in business, the business has had some ups and downs because it can be unstable. He has decided to invest in it so he can improve his business and increase his sales. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy inputs like cows to have more to offer.

Gerardo has some problems with his house. He desires to make the repairs the house needs with the profits from his business. You can help Gerardo to accomplish his goals with the loan he’s asking for.

loans.use: buy inputs like cows to have more to offer

loans.name: Huarumbo Group

texts.en:
The Huarumbo Group is composed of eleven women and one man, Luis. He is a peasant with only primary studies who would like his younger children to achieve a higher schooling level than he.

The other members of the group live in similar situations. Together, they decided to form this group and install third-generation solar home systems in their homes in order to have basic electricity. This will improve the condition of their houses, facilitating improved conditions for the lives of their families. 

The loan will fund those systems, and will be paid back with the monthly fee for first-year-of-operation maintenance services they pay.

loans.use: to pay for photovoltaic (solar) systems to install in their houses.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima started her business in 2000 with her own working capital of $1,000.  She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have enough working capital to buy the items that people need. After some years she got the information about Tuba Rai Metin. She came to get the information and was very interested in it. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more needed items to keep in her store. She has been busy with her business and she is happy to do that. Her husband is very helpful in doing business. She lives in her simple house made of bricks and zinc for the roof. She wants to make her kiosk bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, aqua, candles, sugar, detergents, cigarettes, noodles, cooking oils, coffee, soap, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for photovoltaic (solar) systems to install in their house.

loans.name: Grupo Yoxaja 7 Mujres Group

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 41 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de 41 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de las edades entre 19 y 25 años, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad del caserío Yoxaja.
Catarina (la primera del lado izquierdo de la foto de blusa rosada) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos, y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la producción de café y banano, con esta actividad lleva ella quince años de realizarlo,  esta labor es digna  de admirarse pues son los dos productos de mayor fuente de ingresos para su país. Durante estos tiempos ella tiene su cultivo de café que ya es necesario brindarle su mantenimiento; por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra. Con este mantenimiento ella espera obtener una buena producción de café al final del año.
Su gran esperanza es construir dos casa de block para mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Catarina is a 41-year-old woman, and she is married with a lovely family. She has two children, ages 19 and 25. This dear family lives in a neighborhood in the small village of Yoxaja. With the desire to earn income and provide for her family, Catarina (the furthest on the left with the pink blouse in the photo) makes a living growing coffee beans and bananas. She has been doing this work for fifteen years. This type of work is admirable since these two products are the greatest sources of income for her country.

At this time, it's necessary to take care of her coffee crop. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for the cost of labor. With this care and maintenance, she hopes that her coffee crop will produce well at the end of the year.

Her biggest dream is to build two cinderblock houses so that her family is more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the labor costs of maintaining her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for a photovoltaic (solar) system to install in their house.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en: Albertina built her home a few years ago with her own working capital. Her house has been completed and now she has plans to add another room, but she does not have enough money to buy more materials. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital. She will use the money to buy more materials like sand, cement, brick, wood, zinc, iron, and paint. She is very hopeful that with this money she could finish adding her room.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, brick, wood, zinc, iron, paint and other materials.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita con 49 años de edad de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material adobe, junto a su cónyuge y un hijo independiente, en el distrito de Buenos Aires-provincia de Morropon, departamento de Piura,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura , ganadería y comercio cuenta,

Anita se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo de granja y res además de comercializar animales menores, su negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio. Anita realiza esta actividad hace 3 años, contando con experiencia y teniendo clientela fija.El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en el mejoramiento de casa, y compra de insumos para incrementar negocio. la compra le ayudará tener un mejor modo de vida ya que se mejorara su calidad de vida.

Anita es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, teniendo un buen comportamiento en sus pagos, y siendo socio exclusivo.
texts.en:
Anita, at the age of 49, is in a free union relationship. She lives in her own house made of adobe along with her partner and an independent son in the district of Buenos Aires, the province of Morropon, the department of Piura, and the country of Peru. The residents of this area work mainly in agriculture, livestock raising, and commerce.

Anita sells meat from free-range chicken and beef, in addition to selling small animals. Her business is located in her home. Anita has been doing this business for three years, having experience and regular customers. The purpose of the loan will be to invest in the improvement of her house and buy supplies to expand her business.

The purchase will help her to have a better way of life, since her quality of life will improve.

Anita is a recurring client of Edpyme Alternativa, having good performance in her payments and being a unique member.

loans.use: to invest in improving her house and to buy supplies to expand her business. The purchase will help her to have a better way of life, since her quality of life will improve.

loans.name: Leonidas De Jesus

texts.en:
Leonidas is a 52-year-old-married man who lives in the municipality of Ciudad Bolivar. He has a son who is 17 years old and who he loves very much. He’s a responsible and hardworking man who has owned a business since 2004, one of the most traditional in Colombia. He grows high quality coffee.

The price of coffee has changed a lot in the last months, something that has affected its production. Even so, Leonidas wants to push forward his business by investing in it so the profits increase and the growing gets bigger. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy inputs like fertilizers and poison, to pay for the workforce and to pay employees.

Leonidas loves his job and his family; they are both very important to him, so he dreams of giving his best to them. He expects someday to see his business very successful and his family very happy, and you can be part of this story by loaning and helping this man.

loans.use: to buy inputs like fertilizers and poison, to pay the workforce and to pay employees.

loans.name: Francisco Miguel

texts.en:
Francisco is 32 years old and lives in the municipality of Montería. He has two children; a son who is eight years old and a daughter who is six years old. They are Francisco’s reason to live and work hard. His family is crossing a rough patch economically speaking, so he has decided to start his own business in order to improve this situation.

He’s going to start a cabinetmaking business, something he learned thanks to a friend and is very talented at. Right now he doesn’t have the money he needs to be able to begin it. He’s asking for a loan so he can start his cabinetmaking business and buy a polishing table, tools, wood and a cutting machine.

Francisco dreams of paying for a good education for his children so they can grow up as smart, capable and good people. You can help Francisco to achieve all of his dreams and goals with this loan.

loans.use: to start his cabinetmaking business and buy a polishing table, tools, wood and a cutting machine.

loans.name: Dalida Luz

texts.en:
Dalida is a 57-year-old-married woman who lives in the municipality of Sincelejo. She has seven children, so she has a bigger responsibility for her big family. For 10 years she’s been running a business that she started for her economic needs and learned thanks to her parents. She raises cattle and pigs seven days a week.

In order to improve the quality of life of her family and make her business bigger, she wants to increase her clients so her sales also improve. This way the business can last in time. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy pigs to raise to increase the inputs.

Dalida has many dreams. With her business she expects in the future that she can offer jobs. That way not only would her business improve but she could also do something for people who need a job. She would love to improve her house so that her family would live better. You can help Dalida with the loan she needs and support her goals.

loans.use: buy pigs to raise to increase the inputs.

loans.name: Cristian De Jesus

texts.en:
Cristian is 29 years old and lives in the municipality of San Antonio de Palmito. He has two sons with his girlfriend, whom he loves very much, and for whom he works really hard. For around eight years he’s been working in his own business, raising pigs, which allows him to provide for his family.

The inputs for raising pigs can be really expensive, and they also need a lot of care so they grow up healthy and with good quality. He has some economic problems, so in order to improve his sales and increase his clients, he wants to invest in his business. He is asking for a loan so he can buy more pigs to increase his inputs.

Cristian has some problems with the house he lives in because it needs some repairs. He hopes that he can accomplish the repairs with the profits from his business. A loan will get Cristian so much closer to achieve his dreams; help him now.

loans.use: buy more pigs to increase his inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 30 fish.

loans.name: Vandith

texts.en:
Vandith is a 19-year-old single student who is from the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. His father is a motor mechanic and his mother earns the main income from farming.

Vandith is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in engineering in his first year. He has decided to take out a loan because he is short of the money to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year. This loan will help him in earning a bachelor’s degree successfully. After graduation, he dreams of having a proper job with a reasonable salary and he also wants to save money to build his own house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.en:
Carlos is a 42-year-old-married man who lives in the municipality of Sonson. He has three children; two sons and one daughter. His family is really united and loves each other very much. Carlos has been running his own business for 20 years, which has allowed him to provide for his family. He inherited a farm where he grows coffee; something his father taught him when he was a little boy.

In order to improve his business and have more profits, he wants to invest in his business, because he dreams of making it successful and recognized. He has a really traditional business in Colombia so he wants to take it to another level, improving the quality of his products. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy fertilizers, fungicides and insecticides.

Carlos dreams of seeing his business last in time, as well as having the opportunity of improving the conditions of his house. Help Carlos to achieve all his goals; a loan will get him a lot closer.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, fungicides and insecticides

loans.name: Grupo Yoxaja Mujeres Group

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer soltera de 31 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad denominada Caserío Yoxaja.
Catarina para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la producción de banano y café, ella tiene la dicha de vivir en una zona muy fértil que produce las mejores cosechas de banano y café, con esta actividad lleva ella siete años de realizarlo. Catarina con mucho entusiasmo tiene en sus tierras cultivadas unas cuerdas de café que en estos días ya necesitan de su mantenimiento y ella ya no cuenta con el efectivo necesario para comprar sus fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, con su gran liderazgo que posee Catarina es representante del Grupo Yoxaja Mujeres  que ahora solicita un préstamo para cubrir esta necesidad.
Su gran anhelo es incrementar su cultivo y portar por el préstamo para lograr una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Catarina is a single 31-year-old woman. She lives with her parents and siblings in the neighborhood of Caserío Yoxaja. To earn income and provide for her family, Catarina makes a living growing banana and coffee beans. She is happy to live in a very fertile area that produces the best banana and coffee harvests. She has been doing this work for seven years.

Catarina is enthusiastic, and she currently has several tracts of land planted with coffee that are now in need of maintenance. She doesn't have the money necessary to buy fertilizer and pay for the cost of labor. Demonstrating her great leadership quality, Catarina is the representative of the Grupo Yoxaja Mujeres that is requesting a loan to cover this cost.

Her greatest desire is to be increase her cultivation in order to achieve a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the labor costs to take care of her coffee crop.

loans.name: Yuliana Liney

texts.en:
Yuliana is 26 years old and lives in the municipality of Caceres. She has a little son who only is five years old and is the motor of Yualiana’s life; why she works so hard and dreams big. Last year she decided to start her own business; a place where she sells different products, especially clothes and shoes.

She wants to improve the quality of life of her family, especially her daughter’s. She knows that she needs to invest in her business because her objective is to increase her sales. She´s asking for a loan so she can remodel her salesroom and buy inputs like clothes and shoes.

Yuliana dreams of buying a house for her family, so her daughter can grow up in a safe place with a good quality of life. Help Yuliana with the loan she needs so she can change her life and improve her business.

loans.use: to remodel her salesroom and to buy inputs like clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng, 33, is living in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of two children, one of whom is a schoolchild and the other is under the age of school. The main source of her family’s income is from growing rice. In addition, she has been raising pigs to earn more income.

She has been involved in her job for 10 years. For some years, her businesses did not grow well as the pigs got sick and the crop was destroyed by insects. This is the first loan for Eng with VisionFund and she will spend her loan to buy more pigs to raise for sale in order to expand her business. She hopes this first loan will enable her to grow a good quality of pigs so she can sell them for a good profit and allow her to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise for sale in order to expand her business so as to gain more profits to keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Grupo Las Palilic Group

texts.es:
Manuela es una gran madre de familia con 33 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 1 y 16 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuela (es el primero del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica desde hace cinco años  como ambulante a la compra y venta de ropa típica de su región, pero  para mejorar sus ingresos  se dedica  también a prestar sus servicios de fletes a la gente de su comunidad que necesita movilizarse por vivir en lugares aledañas. Manuela con el gran deseo de mejorar sus servicios hacia los clientes a tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías de ropa típica como; fajas, cortes y güipiles, esto con el afán de satisfacer mejor las necesidades de su familia.
Su gran esperanza de vida, es construir un local para poder tener un mejor lugar donde vender mejor.
texts.en:
Manuela is a great mother to her family, and she is 33 years old. She is single with a lovely family of five children between the ages of 1 and 16 years old. This humble family lives in a neighborhood of Sololá. To earn income and provide for her family, Manuela (the furthest on the left in the photograph) has made a living buying and selling clothing that is typical in her region for 5 years. To improve her earnings, she also makes a living offering freight services to the people in her community who need to get around because they live in the surrounding areas.

With an aim to improve the services she offers to her customers, Manuela has decided to request a loan to buy more merchandise such as belts, regional dresses and blouses. She also desires to better provide for her family.

Her greatest hope in life is to build a store in order to be able to have a better place to sell her products from and to sell more.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her clothing business such as belts, regional dresses and blouses.

loans.name: Fernando José

texts.es: Fernando es un emprendedor de 55 años que identificó una  oportunidad de negocio para ofrecer sus servicios en el sector del transporte de pasajeros ejercido a través de los Motocarro, que son vehículos compactos de tres ruedas que por falta de medios de transporte en algunos municipios de la costa caribe colombiana ha tenido un gran crecimiento en los últimos años. El  ofrece a los propietarios y/o conductores de este tipo de vehículos el servicio de lavado sencillo y lavado general, procesos que hace a mano. Fernando proyecta incorporar algo de tecnología a su servicio para lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el fin de obtener los recursos para comprar una bomba que optimice su servicio. Su meta es fortalecer su negocio con el incremento progresivo de su clientela lo cual le generarán mayores ingresos y por lo tanto le ayudará a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fernando is an entrepreneur of 55 who identified a business opportunity: offering his services in the passenger transportation sector that uses motocars, which are compact vehicles with three wheels, which, because of the lack of means of transportation in some townships of the Colombian Caribbean coast, have had great growth in recent years. He offers the owners and/or drivers of this type of vehicle simple and general washing services, processes that he does by hand.

Fernando plans to incorporate some technology in his service, for which he is negotiating his first Kiva loan with Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with the goal of obtaining the resources to buy a pump that will optimize his service. His goal is to strengthen his business with the progressive increase in his customers, which will generate greater income for him and thus help him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a pump

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene la dicha de ser una gran persona, pues ha logrado que su familia tenga lo necesario, Miguel tiene 47 años de edad es casado, cuenta que con el préstamo logro comprar un terreno donde ahora construirá su casa que siempre ha sido su más grande sueño, antes de haber tenido acceso al crédito Miguel había luchado mucho para obtener su terreno pero no le fue posible hasta que logro optar por su crédito. Miguel ahora tiene la dicha de construir su hogar pero su gran dificultad es no tener el dinero suficiente para poder comprar los materiales necesarios por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de: arena, piedrín, block. Miguel tiene todas sus esperanzas puestas en el crédito para que su construcción sea posible es muy importante que el cuente con el préstamo.
texts.en:
Miguel has the good fortune of being a great person. He has managed to provide all the necessities for his family. Miguel is 47 years old and he is married. With his previous loan, he managed to buy some land where now he will build his home, which has always been his greatest dream. Before having access to a loan, Miguel had struggled a lot to get the land but it wasn't possible for him until he received the loan.

Miguel now has the good fortune to be at the point where he is building his home but his greatest difficulty is lack of money sufficient to be able to buy the necessary building materials. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy sand, stone, and cinderblock. Miguel has placed all of his hopes in this loan.

In order for his construction to be possible, it's very important that he is able to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the construction of his home.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun is 65 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Lun and her husband have been involved in animal husbandry and cultivation for more than 15 years. Together, they can earn about $16 each day.

Lun would like to improve her family’s finances, so she needs a loan to buy cows to breed for calves to sell. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy cows and earn more income when the cows are able to produce calves. In the future, Lun is going to save money to expand her business, so she will be able to build a new proper house.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Lorena Yamile

texts.es: Lorena es una emprendedora de 33 años residente en Malambo un municipio del Atlántico en donde es conocida por sus habitantes como una mujer con una gran calidez humana, ella es madre soltera de dos niños menores de edad y después de trabajar por muchos años como empleada del sector comercial, decidió independizarse para dedicar más tiempo a la atención de su hogar; hace dos años organizo en su vivienda un almacén donde vende a vecinos y transeúntes artículos misceláneos como útiles escolares, accesorios, papelería, refrescos entre otros. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo recursos que invertirá en ropa, cosméticos, papelería, y accesorios para diversificar la oferta de su negocio. Su sueño de prosperidad es fortalecer su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena is a 33 year-old entrepreneur who lives in Malambo, a municipality in Atlantico. She is known by people in the town as a warm and kind person. She is a single mother of two young children. After working for many years as an employee in a business, she decided to work independently in order to dedicate more time to her home. Two years ago, she opened a store in her home where she sells miscellaneous items such as school supplies, accessories, stationary items, and soft drinks, among other things, to neighbors and passersby. 

She is currently requesting her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to invest in clothing, cosmetics, stationary items, and accessories so she can diversify what she offers in her business. Her dream of prosperity is to strengthen her business and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, stationary supplies, and accessories.

loans.name: Sin Group

texts.en:
Sin is a 41-year-old married rice farmer with seven grownup children. She lives in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia.

She has earned her main income from cultivating rice since 1994. Her husband is a 45-year-old who works as an employee in a rubber plantation, and her two children attend school. Sin and her husband can make approximately USD 5.86 per day.

Sin, who is pictured first from the right as a group leader, would like to request a loan as a group of five members, and she will use her portion to buy lumber to renovate her house. This loan will help her have enough money to renovate her house and have a proper house to live in.

In the future, she is going to expand her rice farming, build a ground-floor room, and support her children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy lumber to renovate her house

loans.name: Theavy

texts.en:
A local farmer living in a small house located in Kampong Cham province, Theavy is 41 years old and she has three dependent children who are all in school. To make a living, she has been growing cassava and rice for 23 years. The price of cassava is decreasing because it was destroyed by insects.

This is Theavy’s sixth loan cycle with VisionFund and she could afford to buy enough household consumption for her family through her previous loans.

This new loan she will manage to pay school fees for her younger brother, who pursues the bachelor's degree major in human resource management at a university. She hopes to keep her brother in school until he has a good job after his graduation.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her younger brother, who pursues the bachelor's degree major in human resource management.

loans.name: Teav's Group

texts.en:
Teav is 33 years old, living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district. She is the mother of two dependent children, who are schoolchildren. Growing rice has been the primary source of her income for 10 years. She has been catching fish to make supplement income. Her daily income is around 12 USD per day, and she is able to save about 7 USD each day after offsetting her expenses.

In this group of three, Teav is the leader. This is the first loan for her with VisionFund. As group leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, which are expected to increase crop productivity. She hopes that this loan will help her to produce good outputs so she can earn additional income to support her children’s studying and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, which are expected to increase crop productivity so she can earn additional income to support her children’s studying.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sandra Jael

texts.es:
Sandra, vive con su núcleo familiar formado por sus hijos de 19, 17 y 5 años de edad, y su esposo de 45 años de edad, su actividad económica es atender una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, trabaja todos los días y la fundo hace 2 años un su casa.
Comprará granos básicos, bebidas, sal, boquitas, pan, etc., para fortalecer su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, considera que le dará la oportunidad de mantener las ventas, ofrecer productos a precios bajos y tener nuevos ingresos.
Los proyectos son que su negocio crezca y darles a sus hijos el apoyo necesario para que puedan estudiar en la universidad y ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her family, made up of her 19, 17, and 5 year-old children and her 45 year-old husband. Her business is a store that sells items of daily need. She works every day. She started the store 2 years ago in her house.

She will buy basic grains, drinks, salt, snacks, bread, etc. in order to strengthen her business and satisfy her customers’ needs. She believes she will be able to continue her sales, offer her products at low prices, and have new income.

Her plans are to grow her business and give her children the support they need to study at university and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, salt, snacks, bread, etc. in order to strengthen her business and satisfy her customers’ needs.

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en:
Noeurn, 52, is a farmer living in the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province and she is a mother of five children, three of whom are still depending on her.

Growing cassava has been the primary source of her family’s income for 20 years. She can earn more income via working for others for a fee as well. For Noeurn, she can earn income of about 12 USD to support her family’s living condition.

Lacking working capital to support her farming, she decided to get a new loan with VisionFund which is the third loan for her. She has a better house to stay in from her past loans.

Now, she is going to use this new loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow her cassava well and produce good outputs. She hopes that this third loan will help her to get more yields to make additional income so that she can improve her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow her cassava well and produce good outputs.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a woman who is very interested in business. Even though she is married, she is not overly dependent on the husband to be responsible for her family, because she is always busy with her business.

Now she requests a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital to buy more goods such as sugar, milk, cooking oil, soap, biscuits, noodles, notebooks, cigarettes, and rice, as well as soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

She plans to open a bigger business in the future. She opened her business for the first time a few years ago with her own working capital. She is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, cooking oil, soap, biscuits, noodles, notebooks, cigarettes, and rice, as well as soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée qui vit avec un enfant à charge. Résidant à Tokoin, Afi est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant les quartiers environnant .Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Afi sollicite ce crédit pour commander le tas de friperies en vue de gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a married woman with one dependent child. She lives in Tokoin and works reselling used clothing. She stocks up at the market twice a month and resells as an itinerant vendor in the nearby neighborhoods. 

In order to keep a large stock and maximize her profits by being able to meet her clients' expectations, Afi is applying this loan to buy a bale of used clothing. Her goal is to increase her earnings in order to help her husband with everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various of yarns and other tools required.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
An internet café is beneficial to most Filipinos who cannot afford a monthly internet subscription. They can pay per hour or per minute of internet rental and they can still connect with their social network. Shiela, 30 years old, knows this need.

That’s why she decided to put up an internet café beside her house in Polomolok, South Cotabato. She can help those students who need to research their school assignments, those families with members abroad who long to see each other through Skype, and also those bored individuals who want to play online games.

But no matter how in demand Shiela’s business is, she will also experience loss if she does not give importance to its maintenance. As of now, some of her CPUs are deteriorating and she has to upgrade them. She will also buy an additional computer so she can cater to more internet users.

She needs PHP 15,000 for this purpose. A new computer and upgraded units will ensure a more efficient business operation, thus giving her steady income to support her family’s needs and children’s educational expenses.

Shiela is married to Arman, a welder. They help each other in providing for their two small children. It’s their desire to see them finish their schooling and acquire stable jobs someday.

Shiela is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to procure an additional computer and pay for the upgrading of old units.

loans.name: Huch

texts.en:
A local resident living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province, Huch is a 60-year-old and she has eight children. To make a living, she has grown rice for 42 years. She can get additional income via working as a paid worker.

Recently, her crop was destroyed by insects, so she could not gain high yields as before. This is Huch’s first time loan with VisionFund. She will manage her entire loan to buy a cow, used to help her in plowing farmland.

She hopes to get high yields and reduce the cost of plowing land so she can earn a good income to upgrade her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy a cow, used to help her in plowing farmland to reduce the cost of plowing land so she can earn a good income to upgrade her family’s living condition.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas y pollos para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gallinas entre otros.
texts.en: The associate belongs to the Comuzone I communal bank. The associate continues working in her business raising small animals like hens and chickens for the customers who request them. The associate is an earnest and responsible person. The associate is thankful for the loan conferred and is committed to paying the established installments. The associate wishes to be able to continue working so that she can keep supporting her family in this way.

loans.use: to buy hens, among others.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina’s aspiration. She’s not only concerned about herself but wishes to succeed together with others. She operates a store of school supplies with photocopying services located inside a commercial center in Polomolok, South Cotabato.

She employs one helper in her store. She also owns a tricycle which is being rented by her driver neighbor. Her husband Rommel, on the other hand, is working as a nurse in a local hospital. They have children who are studying in college and high school.

Marina wants to further enhance her business. Many students are requesting printing and scanning services; hence she plans to procure a printer-scanner to serve their needs. She will also buy more school supplies to fill the empty shelves of her store.

She is requesting financial assistance worth PHP 20,000 to meet this purpose. Eventually her goal is to put up several branches of her store in different towns and hire some unemployed youths as cashier, operator, or merchandiser.

Marina dreams to bestow a successful business on her children after finishing their college education. She’s a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more school supplies to sell and to procure a printer-scanner to enhance the services to customers.

loans.name: Kolab's Group

texts.en:
Kolab resides in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. She is a 38-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are in school and another of whom is too young to get in school.

Nowadays, she weaves mats to support her living condition. Moreover, she works as a paid worker to get additional income. These businesses have been with her for four years. She has a lot of competition from sellers so she cannot earn as good income as before.

This is Kolab’s first loan cycle with VisionFund. As a group leader of three, she will use her loan portion to renovate her old house to provide her family a better standard of living. She hopes her family members are healthy and especially her children.

loans.use: to renovate their old house to provide her family a better standard of living and  to put her children in a safe place.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Pheng's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Pheng is a widow woman who has two children, one of whom is in school and needs her to support the studies.

To support her family’s living condition, she has grown rice for 28 years. Meanwhile, her child is working at a garment factory to earn more income as well. Her business earns about 9 USD per day. After offsetting her expenses, she can save around 5 USD each day.

Lacking working capital, she decided to get a loan from VisionFund. This is her first loan. As a group leader of two, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow her crop well.

She hopes to get more yields as well as her income to upgrade her standard of living and enable her to keep supporting her child’s studying.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow her crop well so as to increase her crop yield to get more income to support her child's study.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Tania Rosa

texts.es: Tania es una emprendedora Barranquillera de 39 años muy conocida en el barrio donde reside al sur del municipio, ella es madre de dos niños menores de edad y por la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar con los gasto de su hogar, decidió iniciar un negocio desde su casa; hace 25 años se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo los días viernes, sábado y domingo, en los hogares de esta localidad por tradición los incluyen en su canasta familiar, además los costeños son felices degustando un buen pedazo de chicharrón con bollo, picadas, de cerdo, embutidos  elaborados con carne de cerdo en trozos y condimentada con sal y especias, arroz de cerdo, entre otros platillo típicos de esta región. En la actualidad el consumo de carne de cerdo se ha incrementado, debido a la divulgación sobre los beneficios de comer esta carne y de las proteínas que brinda, es por ello que Tania tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en un mayor volumen de carne de cerdo y tener cobertura total de la demanda existente. Su meta para el futuro es adquirir una carpa y cambiar sus enseres para exhibir las carnes e incrementar progresivamente sus ventas y utilidades.
texts.en: Tania is a 39 year-old entrepreneur from Barranquilla. She is well-known in the neighborhood where she lives, in the south of the municipality. She is the mother of two children. Because of the need to generate income for the household expenses, she decided to start a business in her house. For 25 years she has sold pork on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. The people in the area have a tradition of including it in their diet. They also enjoy a good piece of chicharron with bread, foods made from chopped pork, sausages and cold cuts made from pork and seasoned with salt and spices, rice with pork, and other foods that are typical of the region. The consumption of pork has increased, due to new information about the benefits of eating this meat and the proteins it provides. Because of this, Tania is requesting her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so that she can invest in a larger amount of pork and cover the existing demand. Her goal for the future is to buy a tent and change her set-up to exhibit the pork and gradually increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of pork.

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en:
Martinha has built her house already, She built her house with her capital. Now she has a plan to complete her house, but the money is not enough to buy more materials for her house to be completed, and she has a plan to plaster and to paint her house.

So she is requesting a loan of $1,500.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete her house. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more material such as sand, cement, ceramics, cement tile, paint, a hand brush, a brush roller, and other materials to use.

She is very happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her, because with this loan, she hopes she can complete the plaster.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, ceramics, cement tile, paint, a hand brush, a brush roller, and other materials to use.

loans.name: Benedita

texts.en:
Benedita has built her house, but the money is not enough to buy more materials for her house to be completed. She has a plan to plaster and to paint her house, so she is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete her house.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more materials such as sand, cement, ceramics, cement tile, paint, a hand brush, a brush roller and other materials to use.

She is very happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her, because with this loan she can be complete her house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, ceramics, cement tile, paint, a hand brush, a brush roller and other materials to use.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a kiosk, and she is very busy with her business. She is earning a good income from this business and she lives near the main road, so every day, many people come to buy from her kiosk; she is still happy to do her business.

Olga has been involved in business activities since a few years ago; she started with her own working capital. When Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan for her, she said with this loan she will improve her management for her business to run a bigger business in the future.

She is taking this loan because she wants to use it to buy more sardines, hand/body lotion, slippers, noodles, cigarettes, eggs, biscuits, candles, salts, cooking oils, aqua, sugar, and soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy sardines, hand/body lotion, slippers, noodles, cigarettes, eggs, biscuits, candles, salts, cooking oils, aqua, sugar, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has been involved in business activities since 2001. She started with her own working capital of $400.

She has a kiosk in front of her house, and she is taking the loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use it to buy additional supplies with the loan, including shampoo, detergents, sugar, noodles, sardines, biscuits, cooking oils, cigarettes, aqua, ketchup, sauces and other things to sell.

She is very happy when the Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan for her, because she can use this loan to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, detergents, sugar, noodles, sardines, biscuits, cooking oils, cigarettes, aqua, ketchup, sauces and other things to sell.

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
A young mother of a young child lives in Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, and she is 24 years old. Chhorn has been growing rice and making sugar palm and sugar-palm juice to support her family’s living for six years. Her daily income is about $11 USD per day.

The crop has not grown well, which has earned her lower income recently.

She has never been with VisionFund before, and this is the first time for her to request this Kiva loan. She will use her entire loan to buy a ladder for climbing the sugar palm tree and some bamboo containers for palm juice. She hopes to earn good income so that she has enough ability to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy a ladder for climbing the sugar palm tree and some bamboo containers for palm juice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Soleap's Group

texts.en:
Soleap’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Soleap works as a farmer, and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Maria Jeannethe

texts.es:
María, tiene venta de comida, pupusas y bebidas, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 13, 8 y 2 años de edad, el negocio lo tiene en una zona muy favorable para las ventas, abre a las seis de la mañana y lo cierra a las cuatro de la tarde, en ocasiones atiende a sus clientes a horas más tardes para satisfacer sus necesidades y mayores ingresos.
El crédito le será de utilidad para comprar bebidas, pan, huevos, aceite, arroz, frijoles, etc., tendrá materia prima para seguir elaborando los platillos que ofrece a sus clientes, la finalidad es mantener la afluencia de los clientes y estabilizar sus ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones son variar más el menú y mantener el apoyo a su familia.
texts.en:
María sells food such as pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and soft drinks. She lives with her husband and their three children aged 13, 8, and 2. Her business is located in good area for sales. It is open from 6 am and closes at 4 pm, although occasionally María works later to serve her customers and to earn more money.

The loan will be used to buy drinks, bread, eggs, oil, rice, beans etc., all of which are the basic ingredients for the dishes she makes. María's goal is to keep her customers coming and to maintain a steady income. She would like to vary her menu and to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: buy drinks and bread, and ingredients for the food she makes such as eggs, oil, rice, beans etc.

loans.name: Malelu

texts.en:
Malelu is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a butchery. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. She hopes that in the future, she will have stable business.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Wazeeran

texts.en:
It was hard for Wazeeran to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Wazeeran is 62 years old and is a married woman. She is a mother of 3 children.

Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

Wazeeran has gained great confidence in the business as she has learnt how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira is 34 yeas old and is a married woman. She works doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

She dreams of a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Faith, a very hardworking, energetic and honest mum who is 37 years of age. She lives in the rich highlands of Chuka with her husband and 2 children.
