Faith has been practicing farming for the past 7 years and, through those years, she has been able to support her family. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk, and crop farming.

The Chuka area is populated and has a ready market for poultry products. However, Faith's biggest challenge is lack of funds, which is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy poultry.

Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya and you don’t need to be a large scale farmer to benefit from it. Through the loan, Faith will be able to sell eggs, meat and poultry feathers to the already existing market. The demand for chicken is always high, being such a popular meal for many people as can be proved when you visit fast food joints in her area.

Faith has been facing challenges accessing finances but she feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make her dream come true. Faith chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loans is low and is on a reducing basis. Faith underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, learning that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions.

Through the loan, Faith's income will increase and her life will permanently change, leading to better living conditions for her family and a positive impact on the community.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Financial constraints alongside the want for a better life and good quality education for her 2 children are only a few but valuable factors that encouraged Irshad to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.

Irshad is 45 years old; she is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as a risk-taker. He operates a food cafe. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in an area with many customers and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phin's Group

texts.en:
Phin’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Phin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sophy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a hard-working lady. Meeting her everyday expenditures compelled her to initiate her own business of milk selling.

She is 37 years old and is a married woman. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.

Nasreen ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures.

Therefore, Nasreen has requested for 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers so she can provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Sophia is a 49-year-old mother of six children who resides in Battambang province. Selling fish and growing rice have been the main sources of her family’s income for twelve years and working on other people's farm for fee is an additional source of income for her when she has free time.

Lack of working capital to support her business is the main challenge for her. For this reason, she is now leading a group of two to take Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy more varieties of fish to fulfill her customers' demands and increase sales.

This is the fourth loan cycle for her while the other one in her group is the third cycle. Sopha has a better and more comfortable house to live in due to those past loans. She is actually very hopeful with this new loan portion that she will increase her daily income and it will enable her to buy more plots of farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fish to fulfill her customers' demands and increase sales.

loans.name: Vech's Group

texts.en:
Vech’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Vech makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hak's Group

texts.en:
Hak’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Hak makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en:
Sophat’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sophat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer and taxi driver to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as ambitious.

He operates a laundry business. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy a new washing machine. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy a new washing machine.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a zealous member of CCT Credit Cooperative for almost seven years, Carmelita gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories about their life and business. She herself has also encouraged her group, her family and her community in Polomolok, South Cotabato by being a good entrepreneur.

Carmelita runs this variety store in front of her house. To improve the competitiveness of her store, she ventures into buying and selling of diesel and gasoline. The nearest gasoline station in their area is several kilometers away. Many vehicle owners and PUV (public utility vehicle) drivers find it impractical to drive that far just to refill their gas tank. Thus Carmelita thought of a way to earn higher profit while helping the drivers. She buys gallons of diesel and gasoline then retails it per liter. It brings positive impact to her business and continuously sustains her and her grandchildren’s needs.

Carmelita is a widow who takes care of her grandchildren while her children are working abroad. She knows that work abroad is just temporary, so she still tries to improve her business. She aspires to have additional capital amounting to PHP 20,000 to buy more supplies for her store such as grocery items, beverages and rice. She will also allot supplementary capital for buying and selling of diesel and gasoline. Your kind generosity will surely be a great blessing to her.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her store such as grocery items, beverages and rice, gallons of gasoline and diesel to sell in retail.

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea, 34, is a married mother of three children, two of whom are in school while the other one is too young to attend school. She is a cassava and rice farmer living in Kampong Cham province and she has been involved in these businesses for seventeen years. Recently, her cassava has grown not well because of drought and destruction by insects.

This is the first loan cycle for her group which consists of two members, with VisionFund. As a group leader, she is willing to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for the labor fee so she can grow her crop well. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the labor fee so she can grow her crop well.

loans.name: Leum's Group

texts.en:
Leum’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Leum makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Borey's Group

texts.en:
Borey’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Borey makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and chicken to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Adjowoa

texts.fr: Agée de 49 ans, Adjowoa est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomè avec quatre enfants à charge. Adjowoa est une femme qui se force pour travailler et avoir des revenus. De ce fait, Adjowoa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché des produits alimentaires qu’elle revend dans sa boutique à la devanture de son domicile. Adjowoa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs, des bols de farines de manioc et des bidons d’huile afin de bien vendre puis gagner plus de revenus et répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et pouvoir aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants à la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Aged 49, Adjowoa is a married woman who lives in Adidogomè with her four dependent children.

She commits herself to working and to earning a living. To do this, she procures, three times a month from the market, food products which she then resells from her shop at the front of her home.

Adjowoa is seeking this loan to make an order for sacs of corn, bowls of cassava flour, and drums of oil in order to make good sales and earn more.

[With these earnings], she can respond favorably to her customers' needs. She can also support her husband in paying their children's school fees for the coming year.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of corn, 24 bowls of cassava flour, and two drums of oil.

loans.name: Dopé  Justine

texts.fr: Mère de quatre enfants, Dopé est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Dopé est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui travaille énormément pour gagner ses revenus. Dopé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Dopé demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois; ce qui lui permettra d’avoir plus de recettes et pouvoir faire face aux charges de la famille et aider son mari à préparer au mieux la rentrée scolaire de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
A mother of four children, Dopé is a 37-year-old, married woman who lives in Adidogomé. She sells charcoal, and she works hard to earn a living.

Dopé procures her stock twice a month from a market and makes her resales in front of her home.

She is seeking this loan to make an order of sacs of charcoal. This will allow her to increase her revenue and cover her family's expenses. She will also be able to help her husband in sending their children back to school.

loans.use: to buy 17 sacs of charcoal.

loans.name: Mawouto

texts.fr: Mawouto est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec trois enfants à charge. Mawouto est une revendeuse de chaussures qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile puis en parcourant les quartiers environnnant. Pour financer son achat, Mawouto nécessite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de chaussures afin de bien vendre puis réaliser plus de bénéfices et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Mawouto is a married woman, who lives in Adidogomé with her three dependent children.

She works selling shoes that she procures three times a month from a market. She makes her resales from her home and by traveling around to surrounding neighborhoods.

Mawouto needs this loan to finance the purchase of dozens of shoes. This [purchase] will lead to an increase in sales and profits, which will go towards supporting her husband to cover the family's expenses. Earnings will also support their children's education.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozen pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de ropa para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas entre otros.
texts.en:
This member is part of the "Comuzone I" communal bank. She continues to work at her business buying and selling clothes to customers who look for these items.

The borrower is a responsible and persevering person. She is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments. This loan allows the borrower to move forward with her family.

The borrower is applying for a loan in order to buy coats and more.

loans.use: to buy coats and more.

loans.name: Egnonam

texts.fr: Egnonam est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Mère de six enfants, Egnonam est une revendeuse des produits alimentaires qu’elle s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Egnonam compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Egnonam is a 39-year-old, married woman who lives in Adidogomé. She is the mother of six children.

Egnonam works selling food products that she procures twice a month from a market. She is seeking this loan to make an order for sacs of rice and drums of oil.

With the profits that result, Egnonam plans to improve her point of sale, help her family develop, and support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy four sacs of rice and three drums of oil.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 29 ans résidante à Adidogomé. Mère de trois enfants, Afi est une revendeuse des chaussures qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier pour gagner son revenu. Afi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de chaussures.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Afi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi is 29 years old, married, and lives in Adidogomé. She has three children.

Afi works selling shoes that she procures twice a month from a market. Resales are made at different locations. She is seeking this loan to make an order for more pairs of shoes.

With the earnings that result, Afi plans to improve her point of sale, help her family develop, and help her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy 34 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Cristelia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Cristelia es propietaria de una tienda y tortillería, actividades que desarrolla todo el día, su esposo le apoya con la tienda y ella se encarga de la tortillería, vive con su pareja y su hijo de un año de edad, no tiene parientes en el extranjero.
Ha decidido solicitar un crédito para comprar arroz, bebidas, pastas, pan, bolsas, maíz, cal, azúcar, etc., para fortalecer la tienda y la tortillería, la inversión le permitirá tener un negocio más competente en el mercado para atender a sus clientes.
Su sueño es remodelar la vivienda y compartir con su familia un lugar más agradable.
texts.en:
Cristelia owns a shop and tortilla stall. She works at these businesses all day. Her husband supports her at the shop, while she takes care of the tortilla stand. Cristelia lives with her partner and one-year-old son. Cristelia has no relatives living abroad.

Cristelia has decided to apply for a loan in order to buy rice, drinks, pasta, bread, bags, corn, lime, sugar and more to strengthen her shop and tortilla business. This investment will allow Cristelia to have a stronger business on the market in order to serve her customers.

Cristelia's dream is to renovate her house and live with her family in a more pleasant home.

loans.use: to buy rice, drinks, pasta, bread, bags, corn, lime, sugar and more to strengthen her shop and tortilla business.

loans.name: Agbenyega

texts.fr: Agbenyega est une femme mariée âgée de 52 ans qui vit avec son enfant à charge à Adidogomé. Agbenyega est une revendeuse de condiments qui achète ses marchandises une fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Agbenyega sollicite l’octroi de ce prêt pour commander des paniers de tomates fraîches et des oignons en vue de gagner des bénéfices pour aider son mari à bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de son enfant.
texts.en:
Agbenyega is a 52-year-old married woman who lives with her one dependent child in Adidogomé.

She works selling condiments that she buys once a month at the market. She makes her resales out of a small shed at her home and by traveling around to the surrounding neighborhoods.

Agbenyega is seeking this loan to make an order for trays of fresh tomatoes and onions. She hopes to earn profits that will help her husband to better ensure their child's education.

loans.use: to buy six trays of fresh tomatoes and 10 trays of onions.

loans.name: Béthel

texts.fr: Béthel est une femme âgée de 53 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Béthel est une marchande de produits alimentaires  qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et en circulant dans les quartiers environnant. Béthel désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de sacs de riz et de cartons de spaghettis en vue de tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Béthel is 53 years old and lives in Adidogomé. She is married and has four children.

Béthel sells food products that she procures twice a month from a market. Resales are made in front of her home and by traveling around the surrounding areas.

Béthel is seeking this loan to finance a purchase of sacs of rice and cartons of spaghetti. She hopes to earn more profits, which will go towards taking care of her family.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of rice and two cartons of spaghetti.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec trois enfants à charge. Agée de 47 ans, Akouvi revend de colliers en perles pour subvenir à ses besoins. Pour s’approvisionner, Alouvi se rend deux fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce crédit pour commander des unités de cordes des perles en vue de gagner des bénéfices et d’aider son mari à supporter ses charges quotidiennes de la famille et de bien prendre soin de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 47 years old, married, and lives in Adidogomé with her three dependent children.

She sells pearl necklaces to support her needs.

To procure her stock, Akouvi visits a market twice a month. She is seeking this loan to order necklaces.

Her goal is to earn profits that will help her husband cover the family's everyday expenses and take good care of their children.

loans.use: to buy 10 pearl necklaces.

loans.name: Amivi  Enyonam

texts.fr: Amivi est une femme mariée qui vit  à Adidogomè avec deux enfants à sa charge. Agée de 55 ans, Amivi est une marchande de produits cosmétiques qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar au bord de route. Amivi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de parfums, de mèches et de défrisants en vue de bien vendre et de tirer un maximum de profit afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et améliorer leurs conditions de vie quotidienne.
texts.en:
Amivi is 55 years old, married, and lives in Adidogomè with her two dependent children.

She sells cosmetics which she procures three times a month from a market. Resales are made from a kiosk on the side of the road.

Amivi is seeking this loan to make an order to perfumes, hair extensions, and hair straightener, which will lead to better sales and profits.

Profits will help her to support her children's needs and improve their everyday living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 20 dozen hair extensions, 10 dozen hair straighteners, and two dozen perfumes.

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es:
Milagro esta agradecida por los créditos que se le han otorgado, su negocio de venta de pupusas y antojitos se ha mantenido y le han generado nuevos ingresos con los que ha podido cancelar sus deudas y fundar una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, hasta el momento no presenta dificultades de salud o económicas.
Para seguir mejorando ella hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar aceite, harina, gaseosas, golosinas, huevos, gas propano, entre otros productos nuevos para ofrecer a sus clientes, tiene la esperanza de tener nuevos ingresos.
texts.en:
Milagro is grateful for the loans given to her. Her business selling "pupusas" (tortillas stuffed with cheese and meat or beans) and snacks is still going, and is generating a higher income that has allowed Milagro to pay off her debts. Milagro has also been able to open a grocery store. Thusfar she has had no health or financial problems.

In order to continue improving, Milagro is applying for another loan that she will use to buy oil, flour, fizzy drinks, sweets, eggs, propane gas and other new products to sell to customers. Milagro hopes to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy oil, flour, fizzy drinks, sweets, eggs, propane gas and other new products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Tanti

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Tanti est une femme âgée de 43 ans résidant à Adidogomè. Tanti  est une revendeuse de la farine du maïs, du mil et des condiments qui achète ses marchandises une fois par mois au marché et les revendent en parcourant les quartiers environnant pour gagner son revenu. Tanti sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs et de mil en vue d’acquérir un important stock et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en:
Married and a mother of four children, Tanti is 43 years old and lives in Adidogomé.

Tanti works selling corn flour, millet, and condiments that she buys from the market once a month. She makes her resales by traveling around the surrounding areas.

Tanti is seeking this loan to make an order of bowls of corn and millet. She hopes to increase her stock and maximize her profit, so that she can help her husband with their children's education and the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy 50 bowls of corn and 50 bowls of millet.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Don Manuel tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su comunidad. Solicita un préstamo de mil doscientos dólares ($1,200), para la compra de materiales de construcción, esto con el propósito de realizar mejoras necesarias en su tienda y ofrecer más comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Manuel has a grocery shop in his community. He is applying for a loan of $1200 in order to buy building materials and carry out repairs in his shop. He can thus provide his customers with a more comfortable space to shop.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to carry out repairs.

loans.name: Ana Elsy

texts.es:
Ana, es casada, ella tiene 39 años de edad y su esposo tiene 45 años de edad, tiene dos hijos de 22 y 5 años de edad, la familia comparte la misma vivienda; Ana colabora en los gastos de su hogar aportando ingresos provenientes de ofrecer el servicio de sastre, el oficio lo aprendió de su esposo y lo realiza desde hace muchos años atrás.
Invertirá el capital en la compra de dos máquinas de coser y en pagar la reparación de las que ya tiene, le ayudara a mejorar el equipo de trabajo para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, espera ganar popularidad, elaborar las prendas de vestir con mayor calidad y seguir trabajando.
Sus aspiraciones son tener un negocio más amplio y dar a su familia un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old and married. Her husband is 45 years old. Ana has two children; the eldest is 22 years old, the youngest is five years old. The family lives together. Ana helps cover household expenses from her income as a seamstress. She learned this trade from her husband and has been doing it for a number of years.

Ana will use this loan to buy two sewing machines, and to repair the machines she already has; this loan will help to improve her equipment in order to offer her customers good service. Ana hopes that her business will be more popular and that she can make higher quality clothes and continue working.

Ana aspires to having a larger business and giving her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines, and to repair the machines she already has; this loan will help to improve her equipment in order to offer her customers good service.

loans.name: José Stella

texts.fr:
A 27 ans, elle est mariée, son mari fait de la collecte des produits locaux. Le couple a 3 enfants  (8 ans , 5 ans et 2 ans) dont deux scolarisés. Les deux ainés sont en classe de 9ème et 10ème  dans une école privée.
José Stella vend des légumes  aux consommateurs depuis 2007. Elle n’a pas cessé de développer cette activité en diversifiant les produits.  L’un de ses points forts est que son mari  fait de la collecte des produits  dans les régions avoisinantes. Le prêt servira à acheter des légumes : moellons, pomme de terre, gros oignon dans l’objectif de diversifier les produits vendus t de disposer un stock suffisant pour satisfaire les clients en quantité et qualité.
L’objectif est de pouvoir étendre l’activité et d’approvisionner les détaillants sur le marché en ces produits. Le couple vit dans une maison louée. L’extension de l’activité de vente de légumes leur permettra de réaliser  leur rêve : la construction  de leur propre maison.
texts.en:
José Stella is 27 years old and married. Her husband works to collect local products. The couple has three children, who are 8, 5, and 2 years old. The two eldest children are in private school, in the 9th and 10th class, respectively.

José Stella has been selling vegetables since 2007. She has not stopped developing this business and [continues] to diversify her products.

One of her assets is that her husband collects products from surrounding areas.

This loan will serve to buy vegetables, such as pumpkins, potatoes, and large onions. The goal is to diversify the products she sells and to have a sufficient stock to satisfy her customers in both quantity and quality.

[Another] goal is to expand her business to supply retailers at the market with these products.

The couple lives in a house that they rent. The expansion of José Stella's business will allow them to realize their dream of building their own home.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, such as pumpkins, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, and corn at wholesale to start her business of selling clothes.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Doña Irma se dedica a la actividad de engorde de cerdos. Solicita un préstamo de mil quinientos dólares ($1,500), este dinero lo usará para la compra de credos y alimentación para los mismos. Esto le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y aumentar los ingresos familiares generados de esta actividad.
texts.en: Irma works at a business fattening pigs. She asks for a loan of one thousand five hundred dollars ($1,500), she will use this money to purchase pigs and feed for them. This will allow her to increase her sales and augment her the family income generated by this work.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Doña Edith es una mujer muy trabajadora. Solicita un préstamo de dos mil dólares ($2,000), para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permita ampliar y realizar reparaciones necesarias en su vivienda, esto le permitirá crear espacios en los cuales podrá compartir de forma más cómoda y segura con su familia.
texts.en:
Edith is a very hard-working woman.

She is requesting a loan of two thousand dollars to buy construction materials, which will allow her to extend and carry out needed repairs to her home. This will allow her to create space, which she can share with her family in a more comfortable and secure way.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairs to her home.

loans.name: Marìa Transito

texts.es: Tránsito dinámica y emprendedora, de estado civil divorciada, tiene 43 años de edad, con seis hijos, el último hijo, David de quince años  estudia y le ayuda en el trabajo. Desde hace nueve años atrás ella inicio a vender productos nutricionales y alimenticios ya que gracias a estos productos pudo curarse de su enfermedad, es así como todos los días a partir de las seis de la mañana ella vende sus productos a deportistas, estudiantes, trabajadores y todo el que pase por su local. Transito necesita el dinero para comprar más productos nutricionales y bienes, que le ayudaran en su trabajo permitiéndole así agrandar su negocio y obtener más dinero con eso apoyar a sus hijos, ya que su idea es dejarles a ellos para que perdure a través del tiempo.
texts.en: Tránsito is dynamic and enterprising, divorced, 43 years old, with six children. Her last son, David, 15 years old, is going to school and helps with the work. Nine years ago, she began to sell nutritional products and foods since thanks to these products she was able to cure herself of her illness. In this way, every day from six in the morning, she sells her products to athletes, students, workers, and everyone who passes through her shop. Tránsito needs the money to purchase more nutritional products and goods, which will help her in her work allowing her to expand her business and get more money, and with this to support her children, since her idea is to leave it to them so that it lasts over time.

loans.use: to purchase nutritional products and goods for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Fernando

texts.es: Carlos un hombre tranquilo y trabajador,  tiene 53 años, de estado civil divorciado, con cinco hijos  que viven con él, dos de ellos  estudian  en colegios gratuitos estatales Carlos de catorce y Nancy de doce, sus otras tres hijas tienen negocios parecidos al de su padre que les ha enseñado a ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente, Carlos empezó a trabajar cuando quedo huérfano de madre a sus  quince años con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio como vendedor  ambulante de productos como: copos de nieve los fines de semana soleados en los parques, chochos , caramelos y frutas a la salida de las escuelas como lo hace hasta hoy, ha podido satisfacer las principales necesidades de su hogar. El necesita el dinero para poder comprar más productos y un coche de madera que le facilite movilizar sus ventas por las calles, obtener más ingresos para que sus hijos sigan estudiando y tengan más oportunidades de superación en la vida.
texts.en: Carlos is a peaceful and hard-working man. He is 53 years old, divorced, with five children who live with him. Two of them study in free government schools, Carlos who is fourteen and Nancy who is twelve. His other three daughters have businesses similar to their father's, who taught them to earn their daily bread with the sweat of their brow. Carlos began to work when he was left without his mother at fifteen years old. With a lot of efforts and sacrifice as a street vendor of products such as snow cones on the sunny weekends in the parks, candies, caramels, and fruits at school exits, as he does even today, he has been able to satisfy the primary needs of his household. He needs the money to be able to purchase more products and a wooden cart which will help him move his sales through the streets and get more income so that his children continue studying and have more opportunities to improve themselves in life.

loans.use: to purchase a wooden cart and products to sell as a street vendor.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis es un joven muy trabajador. Solicita un préstamo de trescientos dólares ($300), para la compra de una motoguadaña que le permita realizar su trabajo de cortar el césped de una forma más eficiente y ofrecerle a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Lo cual le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a very hard-working young man.

He is requesting a loan of three hundred dollars ($ 300) to buy a string trimmer, which will allow him to carry out his work of cutting grass in a more efficient way and offer an better service to his clients. This will allow him to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a string trimmer.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Transito

texts.es: Guadalupe de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de elotes desde hace 8 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando piso ceramico pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de cemento, ceramica, arena y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 43 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has been earning a living for eight years by selling sweet corn. Whatever she makes from her sales she uses to cover some household expenses.

She wants to improve her home by putting tiles on the floor but, due to not having sufficient funds, she is requesting this loan to buy cement, tiles, sand, and to pay for labor. This way she can have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy cement, tiles, sand, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
María, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas; ella vive con sus dos hijas, una le ayuda con los oficios del hogar y la otra hace viajes con el carro y su yerno.

María, tiene un molino desde hace más de 15 años y tiene una tienda desde hace 10 años y también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, su trabajo lo realiza desde su vivienda y su horario es de 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde todos los días.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar granos básicos, detergentes, café, pan y de esa manera surtir más su tienda. 

El sueño de María, es hacer más grande su negocio y mejorar el puesto donde está su molino.
texts.en:
María, 54 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade. She is a single mother and has two daughters. She lives with her two daughters, one helps her with the household tasks and the other makes trips with the car and her son-in-law.

María has had a mill for over 15 years and has had a store for 10 years and also works selling beauty products through catalogs. She does her work in her house and her schedule is from 7:00 in the morning to 6:00 at night every day.

She needs the loan to purchase basic grains, detergents, coffee, and bread, and in this way to stock her store more.

María's dream is to make her business bigger and improve the stall where her mill is.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, detergents, coffee, and bread, and in this way stock her store more.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.es:
La socia Victoriana  se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, zanahorias, cebollas y zapallos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoriana is earning a living with her business of selling vegetables. She is a hard-working woman, who wants to improve her financial situation through this business and support her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions, and pumpkins.

She is happy about the loan and committed to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions, and pumpkins.

loans.name: Luchadores De La Vida Group

texts.es:
Un hombre trabajador, honesto, responsable y optimista  es Ángel  de 27 años de edad, es casado con un hijo de tres años de edad, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de  Santa Lucia Utatlán Sololá.
Ángel (el primero del lado izquierdo de la foto) ama y protege mucho a su familia y para que tengan lo necesario trabaja como sastre, elaborando pantalones y diferentes atuendos que sus clientes le soliciten, con esta actividad el lleva más de ocho años de ejercerlo, y lo hace desde la comunidad de su hogar, para Ángel el apoyo de su esposa es indispensable por esa razón ella trabaja elaborando blusas típicas.
Ángel con el deseo de seguir mejorando su negocio y satisface mejor las necesidades de los clientes, junto  a su esposa han tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más telas para la elaboración de pantalones. Su gran esperanza es conseguir el crédito para incrementar  sus materiales y así ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
A hard-working, honest, responsible and optimistic man -- this is Ángel, 27 years old. He is married with a three-year-old son. This lovely family lives in a community of Santa Lucia Utatlán Sololá.

Ángel (the first on the left in the photo) loves and protects his family very much and so that they have what they need, he works as a tailor, making pants and different clothing that his customers request. He has been doing this work for over eight years, and he does it from his home community. For Ángel, his wife's support is indispensable, and for this reason she works making traditional blouses.

Ángel, with the desire to continue improving his business and satisfy his customers' needs better, has decided with his wife to ask for a loan to purchase more fabric to make pants. His great hope is to get the loan to increase his materials and, so, to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make pants.

loans.name: Ndarikana Group

texts.fr: M’Kalimira est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Ndarikana», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 31 ans, mère de 3 enfants dont 1 scolarisé et 2 sont encore gosses Elle est vendeuse des arachides sur la rue de la ville depuis 3 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en deux sacs d’arachides. Elle commença son business  avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en: M’Kalimira is a trader, president of the credit group "Ndarikana", client of the IMF Hekima, married, 31 years old, mother of three children, one of whom is at school and two who are still small infants. She has been selling peanuts on the city streets for three years. She is going to purchase two bags of peanuts. She began her business with funds received by her husband. She wishes to buy a patch of land, send her children to school and provide for them. In the end, she thanks Hekima for the support given to the non-bankable business people. We wish to point out that some clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of peanuts.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores como pollos y cuyes,la socia continua vendiendo sus animales a sus clientes que le solicitan , la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos entre otros.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the communal bank COMUZONE I and continues to be committed to her business of raising small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs.

She continues selling animals to her clients, who place orders, and she is a responsible and earnest person. She is grateful for the loan that was granted and she is committed to fulfilling the repayments and with that provide for her family.

Alejandrina is applying for a loan in order to buy chickens and other stock.

loans.use: to buy chickens and other stock.

loans.name: Utulivu A Group

texts.fr: Bisente est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Utulivu A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 35 ans, mère de 7 enfants dont 5 scolarisés et 2 sont encore gosses Elle est  vendeuse des denrées alimentaires à son domicile dans une avenue de la  ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en cinq sacs de maïs. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de sa mère. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Bisente is a trader, member of the credit group "Utulivu A", client of IMF Hekima, married, 35 years old, mother of 7 children, 5 of whom are in school and 2 of whom are still young infants. She has been selling comestibles from her home in a city avenue for 5 years. She is going to purchase five bags of corn. She began her business with the funds received by her mother. She wishes to buy a patch of land, send her children to school and provide for them. In the end, she thanks Hekima for the support given to the non-bankable business people.

loans.use: to purchase five bags of corn.

loans.name: Utulivu B Group

texts.fr: Kapitula est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Utulivu B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 42 ans, mère d’un enfant scolarisé. Elle est vendeuse de la boisson à son domicile dans une avenue animée de la  ville depuis 14 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en cinq caisses de Primus. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Kapitula is a trader, member of the credit group "Utulivu B", client of IMF Hekima, married, 42 years old, mother of one child in school. She has been selling alcohol from her home in a lively city street for 14 years. She is going to purchase five boxes of Primus. She began her business with the funds received by her husband. She wishes to buy a patch of land, send her children to school and provide for them. In the end, she thanks Hekima for the support given to the non-bankable business people.

loans.use: to purchase five boxes of Primus.

loans.name: Bokk Ndeye Tilene Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré le quatre juin 2010. C'est un groupe composé de dix neuf femmes qui remboursent leurs prêts sans difficultés. Madame DENISE TACKLE qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de trente neuf ans et mère de deux filles. Elle s'active dans la vente d'habits et de chaussures depuis plus de dix ans. Elle va renforcer son activité avec le prêt sollicité. Les bénéfices vont servir à subvenir à ses besoins et à épargner.
texts.en: "Le banc villageois" which is part of this group was launched on the fourth of June, 2014. The group is made up of 19 women who pay back their loans without difficulty. Madame Denise Tackle who is on the right-hand side of the photo raising her hand, is the group's representative. She is married, 39 years old and mother of two daughters. She has been active in clothing and shoe sales for more than ten years. She is going to support her business with the requested loan. The profits will be used to fulfill her needs and to save up.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: La socia Valentina  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de  verduras, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,  el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de  verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar  cebollas,pepinos, zapallos y zanahorias.
texts.en:
Valentina continues to devote herself to the business of selling vegetables. She wants to get ahead through this business. Her dream is to expand her business of selling vegetables.

She is requesting the loan to buy onions, cucumbers, squash, and carrots.

loans.use: to buy onions, cucumbers, squash, and carrots.

loans.name: Avelina Margot

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia sigue con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, colonias, pefumes entre otros, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Comuzone communal bank. She continues with her business of selling beauty products like creams, colognes, and perfumes, among others. She continues selling her merchandise to her customers who request it. She is a responsible person. She has been in the business for a good amount of time. It is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. It is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She is grateful for the loan that was granted, and she pledges to makes her established payments. She is requesting the loan to buy perfume and other items.

loans.use: to buy perfume and other items.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia Nancy  se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas, blusas y pantalones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nancy devotes herself to the business of selling clothes. She is a hard-working woman who wants to get ahead through this business.

She is requesting the loan to buy jackets, blouses, and pants. She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy jackets, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia Margot  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos  como maiz, trigo entre otros, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margot continues selling grains such as corn and wheat, among others. With her business Margot wants to improve her life. She dreams of growing her grain sales business. She is requesting a loan to buy corn, barley and wheat.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make all her payments.

loans.use: buy corn, barley and wheat.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest.

Geoffrey operates a farm where he grows maize and beans. He has been involved in this business for eight years. Geoffrey's business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport.

Geoffrey will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable him increase production. His business goal is to buy a tractor within five years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to enable him to increase production.

loans.name: Felse

texts.en:
Felse and her family live in the town of Calape in Bohol, Philippines. She is a 37-year-old married woman and has five children ages 18, 17, 16, 11 and four years old. Her husband works hard as a laborer while Felse is engaged in mat weaving. She has been doing this for 10 years to earn a living, and to help her husband in providing for the needs of their children.

She is asking a loan to buy materials in making mat such as “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) and dye (to add colors to the mat). In the future, Felse is determined to uplift their livelihood and to be able to give good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy buri and dye

loans.name: Liesly

texts.en:
Liesly is a 26-year-old married wonman. She owns and operates a grocery store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste to members of her local community. She earns 12,000 PHP each month.

Liesly joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to improve her ability to engage in these business activities. Liesly is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase additional products to sell such as deodorant, soap, milk and other items. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as deodorant, soap, milk and other items

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 57-year-old married woman living in Salimpuno, Panaon with her family.

Lolita has managed her own general store for over ten years to earn a living. She sustained the family's daily expenditures from her income and supported her children's education.

Lolita recently joined GDMPC and took a loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She works to expand her business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en:
Arcely is a 45-year-old married woman. She settled Salimpuno, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines together with her three children. Over the past ten years, Arcely was able to put up a retail store that absolutely met the market's demands in their village. Currently, the business is still doing well and it gives them a better income to cover the family's daily expenses.

Arcely joined GDMPC to have an easy access to financial services. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy more grocery goods to sell. Arcely expects an increase in sales to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children. She describes herself as reliable. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy stocks of ingredients for preparing food and materials to repair business premise. Her business goal is to own a hotel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Musyoki

texts.en: Musyoki is a married man. He has 3 children. He operates a retail business where he sells tyres. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tyres.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tyres

loans.name: Nonxay Group

texts.en:
Tui is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.

Tui and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Tui and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.

Tui and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. After totalling up the costs, Tui and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so that they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as ambitious.

He operates a retail business where he sells bread, sugar, sweets, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His primary customers are loyal. He will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, sweets, flour and other items.

This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were successfully repaid.

He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, sweets, flour and other items.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man, and he has three children. He describes himself to be honest.

Julius operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Julius will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy water storage containers to enable him to expand his business.

His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is Julius' second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy water storage containers

loans.name: Devaki

texts.en:
Devaki is 50 years old. She is married and has three children.

Many years ago, she established her produce and vegetable sales business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy pesticides and seeds.

In the future, Devaki plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie has been running a piggery business. She has been doing this for more than 15 years to make a living.

She joined Gata Daku MPC and has recently borrowed a loan to buy feeds for her piglets.

She hopes that out of this loan, she would be able to generate additional income to have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her piglets.

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a married man, and he has one child. He describes himself to be honest.

Eric operates a retail business where he makes jikos (charcoal stoves) to sell. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in the seasons.

Eric will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy materials for making jikos. He hopes that in the future he will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy materials for making jikos

loans.name: Rajabu

texts.en:
Rajabu is 42 years old, married and has a child who is at school. For four years now, he has been running a business selling phone accessories. He starts working from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is his fifth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy shop accessories. Rajabu has paid back the previous loans successfully. With the profit he made, Rajabu bought a piece of land and covered school fees.

In the coming years, he would like to build a nice house for his family, together with growing his shop business more.

Rajabu will be accountable for paying back this loan, which he will use to buy accessories for his shop to resell.

loans.use: to buy accessories for his shop to resell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be humble.

She operates a retail shop where she sells detergents, flour, sugar, milk, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business.

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour, rice and other items.

loans.name: Muchiri

texts.en:
Muchiri is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be determined and strong.

He operates a retail shop where he sells auto spare parts. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are motorists. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of goods.

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spare parts. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spare parts.

loans.name: Fabius

texts.en:
Fabius is a married man. He describes himself as outgoing.

He is a cobbler and also sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy shoe repair materials.

His business goal is to have a big shoe store within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy shoe repair materials

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself to be focused and hardworking.

He operates a welding business. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rain, which affects business.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy a welding machine and other accessories. His business goal is to have a big workshop within five years.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine and other accessories

loans.name: Harry

texts.en:
Harry is a married man. He describes himself to be outgoing.

Harry operates a retail business where he sells books, staples, masking tape, pens and other stationery. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a competitive place, and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more stock of stationery. His business goal is to have a big store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of stationery.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest.

Jane operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a competitive place, and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 99,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes and clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Esta

texts.en:
Esta is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be patient.

Esta operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, carrots, and cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, carrots and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions, carrots and other items.

loans.name: Linnet

texts.en:
Linnet is a married woman with 10 children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a posho mill where she sells flour. She has been involved in this business for 6 years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more flour to resell. Her business goal is to have a big milling firm within 5 years.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. All of her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more flour for resale.

loans.name: Marcela Teresa

texts.es: Marcela es una joven emprendedora de 22 años, dedicada a organizar y decorar eventos sociales entre ellos  bodas, banquetes, fiestas Infantiles y fiestas de temporada. Ella estudió organización de eventos y como parte de su preparación realizó un estudio de mercado con unas compañeras, cuya conclusión las llevó a identificar una demanda insatisfecha lo que la motivó a iniciar su negocio que ya tiene dos años de funcionamiento con muy buenos resultados; sus clientes son en su mayoría madres y jóvenes y dentro de sus servicios se encuentran el montaje y decoración de mesas y silletería, suministro de dulces, repostería, decoración y alquiler de cristalería, servicios que ofrece a través de las redes sociales. Marcela tramita actualmente su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual planea invertir en la compra de insumos para la decoración, utensilios y silletería. Su visión para el futuro es organizar un local de exhibición de sus servicios y personalmente conformar una familia.
texts.en:
Marcela is a young 22 year old entrepreneur who earns a living through organizing and setting up social events including weddings, banquets, parties and seasonal celebrations.

She studied events organisation and as part of her course she conducted a market survey with some classmates which concluded with them identifying an unmet demand in the market. This motivated her to start her business which has already been operating for two years with very good results. Her customers are mostly mothers and young people and within her services she offers the setting up and decoration of tables and seating, supply of sweets, pastries, decoration and the rental of glassware. The services are offered through social networks.

Marcela is currently applying for her first Kiva loan, with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and plans to invest it in the buying of materials for decoration, utensils and seating.

Her vision for the future is to organize a local exhibition of her services and to start her own family.

loans.use: to buy materials for decoration, utensils and seating.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation during the rainy season.

She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to open another stall.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Tujumuike A Group

texts.en:
Muhidini is a businessman who was born 1974. He runs a business selling second hand clothes, a business he has been with for two years now. He starts in the market at 9am and works to 6:30 pm daily. He is able to realize a good profit each month. He is not married, but is a father of one schooling child.

Muhidini is requesting his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania for the purpose of growing his business stock. He will use the loan to buy more second hand clothes to attract more people.

He will share this loan with his group, Tujumuike A, consisting of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Muhidini dreams to improve his business with a greater variety of clothes.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes (new stock) to attract more people.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a female Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be humble.

Mary operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es: Lucía es una joven muy emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Solicita un préstamo de mil dólares ($1,000), dinero que usará para la compra de productos, de esta forma aumentará su inventario y logrará incrementar su volumen de ventas.
texts.en: Lucía is a young entrepreneur who works selling beauty products. She is requesting a loan of one thousand dollars ($1,000),money that she will use to buy products. In this way she will increase her inventory and manage to increase her volume of sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Iloilo and other provinces in the Visayas region of the Philippines are undergoing continuous rehabilitation from the wrath of Typhoon Haiyan two years ago. Businesses are regaining their stability and entrepreneurs are renewing their strength.

Delia, 43, is one of the entrepreneurs who rose above the difficult situation after the typhoon. She successfully revived her variety store business. Little by little, she resumed the buying and selling of usual commodities like toiletries, canned goods, snacks items, and beverages. Similarly, her husband, Larry, continues to make a living with his job as an electrician. Their two children are already working as of now.

Delia wants to develop her business further to attain her dream of renovating their house. She wants to make it sturdy and secure to prepare for typhoons and other calamities.

She has applied for a PHP 30,000 loan to buy additional dry goods, grocery items, and cases of beverages. She anticipates an increase in her sales and profit from these additional supplies.

She hopes that all of their income generating ventures will pave the way for a more comfortable life for her family in the future.

Delia is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods, grocery items, and cases of beverages

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a wholesale business.

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand to a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Melenia

texts.en:
Melenia is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and basins. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a convenient place, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be humble.

She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more cows. Her business goal is to own a ranch within five years.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add more cows.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells bread, sugar, milk, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be a risk-taker. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, sugar, soda, milk, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 25 years.

Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, soap, flour and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, soap, flour and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, el se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos y tambien a la crianza de aves de corral(gallinas y patos) se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su madre y sus cuatro hermanos, el esta solicitanso un credito para la compra de semillas, ferilizantes, herbicidas, foliares, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: The youth who has his face pixelated in the photo is 23 years old and lives in a high risk area. He works growing basic grains and he also raises poultry (chickens and ducks). He has worked at these activities for a number of years and with what he obtains from his sales he manages to pay some of the household expenses. This young man lives in his own house with his mother and four siblings. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, foliar spray, etc. to be able to continue with his crops and have greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, foliar spray, etc.

loans.name: Josefina Abigail

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE I”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Josefina Abigail; la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de productos naturales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “COMUZONE I” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Josefina Abigail, who continues to work in her business selling natural products. She is a responsible and persevering person. She continues to sell her merchandise to her clients when they request them, this being the manner she gets her family ahead.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payment of her installments.

She is requesting the loan to buy natural products amongst others.

loans.use: to buy natural products amongst others.

loans.name: Tujumuike B Group

texts.en:
Salum, a 40-year-old man, is married and has three schooling kids. He has been a businessman running a second-hand clothes business. He has also been a driver for 15 years now. Salum starts working from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. per working day and is able to realize a very good profit.

From Tujijenge, this is his sixth credit request to be apportioned among Tujumuike B, a four-member group who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He used the previous credits, paid back in full, to buy five bags (Marobota) of second-hand clothes.

With the profit he earned, he managed to cover family life costs (school fees, medical expenses, meals costs) and bought a piece of land where he expect to build. In the coming years, Salum would like to own his own car.

He will use this credit to buy second-hand clothes with new stock to attract more people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes with new stock to attract more people.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a married man. He has two children. He operates a business where he sells cows. He has been involved in this business for 16 years. His business is located in an area with demand for livestock, and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more livestock.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is a married man. He has eight children. He describes himself to be ambitious.
