He operates a retail business where he sells tomatoes, bananas and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and cereals. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his family's living standards.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and cereals.

loans.name: Azizi

texts.en:
Azizi is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be competent.

Azizi operates a retail business where he sells salt, sugar, flour, rice, cooking fat and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Azizi will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of salt, sugar, flour, rice and other items.

His business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will create employment.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of salt, sugar, flour, rice and other items.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be trustworthy.

Karisa operates a retail business where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a populated place, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Karisa will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of milk.

He hopes that in the future, he will expand business. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is a widow from Koghb village of the Tavush region. She lives with her son and mother-in-law. Despite her retired age, Seda's mother-in-law is a big support for her in agribusiness. They keep livestock of two cows, two calves and two pigs. They also cultivate wheat and grow plums and walnuts.

With the purpose to further grow her agribusiness, Seda has applied for this loan. She needs to purchase a truck needed on the farm for transporting the gathered harvest to local markets.

As this is Seda's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for a truck needed on the farm for transporting the gathered harvest to local markets.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a Kiva borrower. She has five children. She describes herself to be reliable.

Julia operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a cereals store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Anna Florence Eugenie

texts.fr:
Anna est une mère de famille travailleuse et débrouillarde de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari est maçon. Le couple a trois enfants dont les deux premiers ont déjà leurs propres jobs et le dernier suit actuellement une formation professionnelle. 
Anna exerce une activité d'élevage de poulet de chair depuis 1981, mais elle avait dû suspendre en 2010 car le poulailler était ravagé par le cyclone. Elle demande un prêt donc pour redémarrer l'activité. Elle a déjà contacté ses anciens clients et trouve aussi des nouveaux. A part le poulet de chair, elle exploite aussi une boucherie des abats.
L'objectif de Anna c'est de pouvoir développer et étendre l’élevage et  avoir et exploiter plusieurs fermes un jour.
texts.en:
Anna is a hard-working and resourceful 46-year-old mother. She is married to a bricklayer. They have three children together; the first two already have their own jobs and their youngest is currently receiving professional training.

Anna has been raising chickens since 1981, but she had to stop in 2010 because her chicken coop was ravaged by the cyclone. She is requesting this loan to start up this activity once more. She has already contacted her former customers and is also finding new ones. As well as her chicken venture, she also sells various offals.

Anna's goal is to be able to develop and grow her livestock raising ventures and to one day have several farms to exploit.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and the necessary goods to raise them.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
The sea and this motor boat are the sources of livelihood for Alma and her husband, Ronel, a fisherman. Alma sells different varieties of fish that her husband catches. Usually she also buys fish and seafood from other fishermen. They live in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo together with their children.

The motor of Alma’s boat is slowly deteriorating due to long use. In times that it’s in trouble, her husband cannot go out fishing and their income diminishes. Alma aspires for a continuous livelihood so she applies for PHP 10,000 loan that she can use to buy a new motor for her boat. She will also allocate some money to buy additional fish and seafood. She hopes to increase her income so she can sustain her family’s growing expenses. Later, she plans to buy another motor boat which she can rent out to her neighbors.

Alma dreams to see her children earn a college diploma. She also wants them to have a stable career in the future. She is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a new motor for her fishing boat as well as additional fish and seafood.

loans.name: Bedford

texts.en: Bedford is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as innovative. He operates a dairy farm where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy animal feed. He hopes that in the future, he will expand the business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Martinha

texts.en: Martinha is married and lives in Atsabe. Every day she sees women dependent on their husbands.  One day she thought to help her husband so he could feel less responsible in the household. She opened her business. She has been working in various business activities for a few years.  With working capital of $100.00, she makes the best on it. She started with a small store but is requesting a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital.  With the money, she will buy additional items to keep in her store including sugar, coffee, aqua, cigarettes, detergents, cooking oils, soft drinks, and other things to sell. She will improve her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, aqua, cigarettes, detergents, cooking oils, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man with 6 children, and describes himself to be honest.  For 5 years he has operated a carpentry business making furniture.  His primary customers are locals. 

Francis will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy timber to make furniture.  This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.  His previous loan was repaid successfully.			

In the future he hopes to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy timber to make furniture.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is 42 years old and lives in Valencia, Bohol, in the Philippines.  She uses her time wisely by engaging in multiple businesses such as raising hogs, selling electronic prepaid phone cards for mobile users, and selling barbecue in the evening.  

Maryjane requested a loan to buy prepaid phone cards, soy sauce, meat, cooking oil, seasoning, feed, and clothes to sell.  She plans to continue expanding her business so that someday her husband, who works in another country, can come home.

loans.use: to buy prepaid phone cards, soy sauce, meat, cooking oil, seasoning, feed, and clothes to sell

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans, Abla est une femme mariée sans enfant vivant à Adidogomé.  Pour soutenir sa famille, Abla vend des mèches et tissages dans son salon de coiffure et s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Abla réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Abla sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités de tissus et des douzaines de mèches afin d’agrandir son stock et pouvoir bien vendre afin d’aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
36-year-old Alba is a married woman with no children who lives in Adidogomé. In order to support her family, Alba sells weaves and hair extensions out of her hair salon. She gets her supplies four times per month from market. Alba is making a good profit in this venture.

In order to satisfy her customers, Alba is requesting this loan to purchase weaves and hair extensions. By doing this, she will be able to increase her stock and have more wares to sell. She will then be able to help her husband pay for their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase nine weaves and three dozen hair extensions.

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: Angèle est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec sept enfants à charge. Angèle est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois  fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Angèle nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois petits et grands modèles en vue de bien vendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice afin de soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Angèle is a married mother to seven children who lives in Adidogomé. She earns a living through selling wood charcoal which she purchases three times per month from market and resells out of her own home.

Angèle is requesting this loan to purchase sacks of wood charcoal so she has more stock to sell and can make a larger profit. By doing this, she will be able to support her husband with their family's daily expenses and ensure that her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase 40 sacks of small and large-size wood charcoal.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, de 57 años de edad, está casada, vive con su esposo, sus dos hijos y tres nietos.

Marina, tiene más de 25 años de ser profesora, ella da clases en una escuela de su pueblo, educar a los niños ha sido su vocación desde siempre, es por eso que disfruta su trabajo.- Pero a parte de dar clases, atiende un pequeño negocio de venta de frutas en su casa, ella las vende congeladas y con chocolate.- 

Marina, necesita el préstamo para poder comprar un pequeño congelador para su venta de frutas, ella lo necesita especialmente para congelar las frutas y tenerlas en un lugar adecuado. 

Los planes de Marina son, que para su jubilación su negocio sea lo que le ayude a seguir adelante y poder disfrutar de su familia.
texts.en:
Marina is 57 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, her two children and three grandchildren.

Marina has been a teacher for more than 25 years. She teaches classes in a school in her community. Educating children has always been her vocation and she enjoys her work. But besides giving classes she takes care of a small business selling fruit at her house. She sells them frozen and with chocolate.

Marina needs a loan to be able to buy a small freezer for her fruit sales. She needs it especially to freeze the fruit and have a proper place to keep them.

Marina's plan is when she retires her business will be what helps her to get ahead and be able to enjoy being with her family.

loans.use: to buy a small freezer for her fruit sales.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia Yovana se dedica al negocio de venta de frenos para carros,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de frenos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar frenos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yovana works at the business of selling brakes for cars. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the brake selling business. She asking for the loan to buy brakes.

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy brakes.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a married man with 7 children and describes himself as humble.  For 7 years he has operated a retail business selling pens, printing paper, and other stationery.  His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

Samwel will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy additional stock of stationery.  This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and his previous loan was repaid successfully.		

He hopes to be prosperous in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of stationery.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman who has 5 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a pharmacy. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of medicine. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family's standard of living. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine.

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en:
Bendita has been involved in business activity since 2000, with her own working capital of $1,000. She was also one of the entrepreneurs, and her business is selling cows. Her husband is an agriculturalist, so he was very supportive of selling cows.

Bendita now is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with their capital to buy more cows. She wants to change her business to a big one. She was very happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin because she can increase her income in the future. She is very hopeful that with this loan she can improve her management.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Wakorintho Group

texts.en:
Habiba is in her early 60s and is married with two children, who are grown up. She has been running a genge duka (food stall) for four years now. She works from 6:00 am to 9:30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Habiba's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to increase stock in the genge and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She used the profit to reinvest in the business, repay loan, take care of her family, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to replenish the out-of-stock items in the genge. She dreams of expanding her genge.

Habiba will share this loan with her group Wakorintho, which has four members who will hold one another accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the genge store.

loans.name: Ana Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I ,la socia  Ana Graciela ,la socia continua con el negocio de ventas de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de plátanos entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the COMUZONE I communal bank. Her name is Ana Graciela. She continues with her fruit selling business. She has had the business for some time and it is going well for her, thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She is a responsible and hardworking woman, and this is how she gets her family ahead.

She is asking for the loan to buy plantains, among other things.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy plantains and more.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has three children.

She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, kale, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stocks of tomatoes, kale, onions and other vegetables.

She hopes that in the future, she will expand business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tomatoes, kale, onions and other vegetables.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has two children.

She operates a farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy animal feeds that will enhance milk production.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds

loans.name: Eteri

texts.en:
Eteri is 58 years old and widowed. She lives alone in Telavi district.

Eteri is unemployed and wants to start her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4,000 USD to start up a new business.

With the received credit, Eteri will open a bakery and will purchase all the needed materials for baking Georgian bread.

Eteri is very motivated and hopes that the business will be profitable. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a bakery

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
A few years ago, Domingas started a business with her $ 400.00 of own working capital. She has a retail kiosk in front of her house and she now asking for a loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin, to buy additional supplies including cooking oil, sugar, soaps, water, salt, candies and other things to sell.

She was very happy when the Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her because she can use this loan to improve her business. Dominga wants use this loan to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, soaps, water, salts, candies and other things to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Oecusse. She has a shop for her business. She is selling bags, tailored yarn, hand / body lotion, candy, belts, Pepsodent, sandals, blustery oil and other things. So many people come to buy it.

Maria has been involved in business activities since 2001. She started with her own working capital of $500. She is earning a good income from selling, so she is still happy to do her business.

She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to add more items to her shop, including shoes, bags and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags, sandals, tailored yarn, shoes and other things to sell.

loans.name: María

texts.es: Maria como muchas mujeres de su comunidad, todos los días se esmeran para obtener sus ingresos y prosperar en la vida, ella cuenta que gracias al crédito pudo comprar las medicinas de su mamá y ella se encuentra mucho mejor ahora, por esa razón agradece a los inversionistas de kiva por la gran ayuda que le brindaron. Maria nuevamente tiene la necesidad de un crédito pero en esta ocasión para invertirlo en su negocio de comida, pues con lo higiénico y responsable que es para la preparación de las comidas, Maria  tiene mucha clientela y sus trastos ya no se dan abasto por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios, enseres y productos de preparación rápida para su negocio. Con esta inversión ella espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Su esperanza de vida es construir una casa más amplia para la mayor comodidad de su hogar.
texts.en: Maria, like many women of her community, strives every day to obtain income and proper in life. She says that thanks to the loan she was able to buy medicine for her mother and she is much better now. For that she is thankful to the Kiva investors for the big help they gave her. Maria again has the need of a loan but on this occasion it is to invest in her food business. Being as hygienic and responsible as she is in preparing food, Maria has a lot of customers and what she has is not enough. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy utensils, fixtures and products for quick preparation for her business. With this business, she hopes to meet the needs of her customers. Her hope in life is to build a bigger house so that her home will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy utensils, fixtures, and food products for her business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel lives in Atsabe, and she is a businesswoman. She got involved in business activities a few years ago with her own working capital, and she makes her best on it. She has a very high interest in doing business.

She has a small store. She hopes to open a bigger store, but her capital is not enough. She is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use this loan to buy more items to keep in her store, including candies, hand / body lotion, cooking oils, shampoo, gum, toothbrushes and other things to sell.

She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy candies, hand / body lotion, cooking oils, shampoo, gum, toothbrushes and other things to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Arnulfo

texts.es: Oscar de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la pesac artesanal y con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas es como ha podido salir adelente, el quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de repellar y afinar las paredes pero como no tiene de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas materiales de construccion y asi poder tener una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Oscar, 31, lives in his own house with his mother.

For several years now he has been working building "Pesac" crafts. He has been able to get ahead through the profits from his sales.

He would like to improve his home by finishing to plaster the walls.

Since he does not have enough capital he is requesting a loan to buy more construction materials and in this way have a nicer home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be smart.

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, salt, cooking oil, and other household items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, bread, flour, and other items.

His business goal is to have a large business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a healthy, dependable family.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, bread, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Stephanya Paola

texts.es: Stephanya  es una joven emprendedora de 22 años residente en el municipio de Malambo en el Atlántico, ella es madre de un niño de 3 años y se encuentra dedicada a la comercialización de ropa exterior para damas caballeros y niños, actividad que le brinda la oportunidad de contribuir económicamente, pero al mismo tiempo desempeñar los papeles de esposa, madre y ama de casa. Sus clientes son vecinos y amigos a quienes visita periódicamente para propiciar las ventas. Ella está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que invertirá en Jeans y camisetas para tener un inventario suficiente y aprovechar la demanda que genera las festividades de fin de año. Su meta es fortalecer su negocio y obtener utilidades que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Stephanya is an enterprising young woman of 22 years old. She is a resident of the municipality of Malamba in the Atlantic. She is mother of a 3-year-old child. She makes a living selling clothing for men, women, and children. This occupation gives her the opportunity to contribute financially, but at the same time fill the roles of wife, mother, and homemaker. Her customers are neighbors and friends who she visits regularly to promote sales.

She is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest this loan in jeans and t-shirts in order to have a sufficient inventory and to make the most of the demand generated by year-end festivities. Her goal is to strengthen her business and to obtain income that will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in jeans and t-shirts.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a female Kiva borrower. She has 4 children. She describes herself as responsible.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

Pamela will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be prayerful.

He operates a farm where he grows vegetables and other crops. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of water for irrigation.

He will use the KES 45,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a Kiva borrower. She has 4 children and describes herself as honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells cows and goats. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. It is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

Chizi will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more cows and goats. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more cows and goats.

loans.name: Regolinda

texts.en:
Regolinda is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is a businesswoman, and her husband is very supportive of her doing business. She is doing this business because she is earning a good income from this business. Every day many people come to buy in her kiosk, so she is still happy to do her business.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy some items such as rice, sugar, notebooks, candles, glue, noodles, biscuits, sardines, hand/body products, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

Regolinda has been involved in business activities since a few years ago. She started with her own working capital. She has a kiosk, and she also sells gasoline.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, notebooks, candles, glue, noodles, biscuits, sardines, hand/body products, soft drinks and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a married man. He has eight children.

He operates a hardware business where he sells iron sheets, cement, pipes, and other items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of hardware items. He hopes that in the future, he will own a company.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hardware items.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 54 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province of Cambodia.

Mom and her husband have been fattening animals for more than fifteen years. Two of her children work as factory workers, and another one attends school. Together, they can earn approximately $31 per day.

Now, Mom would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 to buy cows to breed and sell for a profit. This loan helps her to make more profit for her family, as well as make her family’s lives better.

In the future, she is going to expand her business, build a new proper house, and support her youngest child to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy cows to breed and sell for a profit.

loans.name: Sofia Yrene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de chompas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
Sofia belongs to the communal bank "Comuzone I". She continues to make a living selling sweaters. She has been engaged in this business for some time which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She is a responsible person. She wants to be able to continue working and in this way to continue supporting her family.

Sofia is grateful for the loan and commits to making the installment payments. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of sweaters, among other things.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, among other things.

loans.name: Macximilla

texts.en:
Macximilla is a married woman. She has 8 children and describes herself as honest.

She operates a poultry farm where she keeps chickens and has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are regulars.

Macximilla will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more chickens. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

She will use the anticipated profits to put up a poultry house.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a 30-year-old food kiosk operator and green grocer in the Changamwe suburb of Mombasa. She is a mother of three who has been in this business for the past year and is doing well.

This is the second loan Zawadi has taken to finance her business. She repaid the first loan successfully. She will use this loan to purchase wheat and maize flour, milk, sugar, tea leaves, beans, and cooking fat. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to own a modern cafe in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and maize flour, milk, sugar, tea leaves, beans, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is from Meghri town where she lives with her parents and two daughters.
Gohar is a tailor by profession and works in local tailoring factory in Meghri town. Besides her main job, she has also been engaged in agribusiness for many years. Gohar, with the help of her parents, keep livestock of two cows, calves, 20 sheep and 12 colonies of bees. The honey Gohar and her family get is highly demanded in the local market. This is the reason she has applied for this loan: Gohar wants to purchase 13 colonies of bees.

This is Gohar's second loan. Because of financial hardships, Gohar wasn't able to pay her first loan on time and created a bad credit history. But after years of tireless work, she has been able to find a good job and owns a farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments.

Now, Gohar has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for 13 colonies of bees

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a marrried woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for cooking food. Her business goal is to have a big hotel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for cooking food

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Venancio

texts.en:
Venancio is 24 years old. He is single and works hard to support his family as a teacher. Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of his sister's education.

This loan of $ 800 will allow Venancio to help his sister with costs associated with University. He will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. In the future, Venancio hopes that his children are all well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya lives in Gandzaqar village with her big and nice family. The whole family is engaged in a farming business. They currently keep livestock of 5 cows, 9 calves, a pig, 3 piglets, and 30 hens. In the family's own yard, they also cultivate corn, haricot, and potatoes.

Because their family barn is old and needs some construction work before the winter, Amaya has applied for this loan. She plans to pay for renovation of the barn and purchase forage for feeding the livestock.

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who previously didn't have access to credit products because they have no credit history.

Amalya and her family hope to receive lenders' support and sustain their farming business further.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn and purchase forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Kanunwa

texts.en:
Kanunwa is a married man. He has 4 children and describes himself as polite. He operates a farm where he grows vegetables, and other crops. He has been involved in this business for 30 years. It is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be water for irrigation.

He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to supply farm products in large scale within 5 years.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 57-year-old farmer in Mariakani, Kenya. She is a mother of four who has been in agribusiness for the last twenty-five years and is doing well.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for her farm, and will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan.

She hopes to own a large farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman. She has 8 children and describes herself as prayerful. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 7 years and it is located in a good area. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals and vegetables.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused.

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows cabbages, onions, and tea. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy animal feed and agro chemicals.

She hopes that in the future, she will have better breeds of dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and agro chemicals.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Kiva borrower. He has three children. He describes himself to be reliable.

He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, maize, rice, cooking oil, and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, bread, and other items.

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables, fruits. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela is from Agarak town where she lives with her husband and son. Anzhela is in the agricultural business raising livestock of 6 cows. Anzhela' husband is an army officer and their son also works, so Anzhela is the only one who takes cares of agriculture.

She has requested this loan to purchase 400 chickens, food for feeding the livestock and to cover transportation costs. Anzhela hopes to develop her agribusiness and get more income for her family. This is her second loan.

Because of financial hardships, Anzhela wasn't able to pay her first loan on time and created a bad credit history. But after years of tireless work, she has been able to own a farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Now, Anzhela has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for 400 chickens, food for feeding the livestock and to cover transportation costs.

loans.name: María Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 64 años de edad, está casada, vive con su esposo, tuvo 3 hijos, pero solo una de sus hijas vive con ella, porque todos los demás son mayores de edad y tiene sus propias familias, su esposo es comerciante y vende cocos en el parque de su comunidad. 

Silvia, siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de frescos de horchata en el parque de su pueblo, ella tiene más de 25 años de dedicarse a ese negocio y en el pueblo todos la conocen. 

Silvia, necesita el préstamo para mejorar su negocio y comprar insumos para elaborar los frescos. 

Silvia, planea seguir trabajando y así en su vejez vivir tranquila con su esposo en su casa y sin ninguna preocupación.
texts.en:
Silvia is 64 years old, married, and lives with her husband. She has three children, but only one of her daughters lives with her. All of the others are older and have their own families. Her husband is a merchant and sells coconuts in the park of their community.

Silvia has always been dedicated to the sale of drinks made of tiger nuts and sugar in her town's park. She has been engaged in this business for more than 25 years, and everyone in her town knows her.

Silvia needs this loan to improve her business and to buy ingredients to make the drinks.

She plans to continue working so that in her old age, she can live peacefully with her husband in their home without any worry.

loans.use: to improve her business and buy ingredients to make drinks.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
A $1,500.00 is offered to Carmelita to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day, because she lives near many people.

She will buy some additional supplies with this loan including , noodles, cigarettes, lighters, aqua, tea, candy, shampoo, biscuits, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She has been involved in business activities a few years, started with her own working capital. She feels comfortable running her business because she is helping her husband be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future, with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, lighters, water, tea, candy, shampoo, biscuits, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 43 years old, not married and has got one son and one daughter who are at school. Despite being alone (not married), she supports her life with a poultry activity, a business she has been with for four years now. Fatuma starts working from 8 am to 8 pm per working day and is able to make a fair profit per month.

From Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her fifth credit request, which she will use to buy chicks for her poultry business to raise and resell. With the previous loans, paid back in full, Fatuma improved her business, raised the number of chicks and managed to feed them so smoothly. In the coming years, she would like to improve her business more and raise extra income for her family. She managed to receive extra income which she used to cover school fees and family meal costs.

Fatuma is so happy and thankful for everyone who supports her business and life. She will be accountable for paying her loan as per schedule.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her poultry business to raise and resell.

loans.name: Joege Cesar

texts.es:
El socio se dedica al negocio de gasfitero,el socio hace trabajos como arreglos de baños,arreglos de pilas entre otros,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de gasfitero.El socio solicita el credito para comprar herramientas y yeso para los arreglos.


El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Joege makes a living as a plumber. He does work such as bathroom and sink repairs among other things. He has been engaged in this business for several years and it is going very well. His dream is to expand his plumber business.

He is requesting a loan to buy tools and plaster for repairs. He is happy about the loan and commits to making his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy tools and plaster for repairs.

loans.name: Melizza Mariott

texts.es:
La socia Melizza Marriott  continua trabajando como docente del nivel inicial, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a trabajar el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de materiales didácticos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Melizza Marriott continues working as an elementary school teacher. She has been engaged in this work for some time, and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day. She is a responsible and diligent person. She wants to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of educational materials. She is grateful for the loan and commits to making her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy educational materials.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells table mats, towels, and bed sheets. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

Her business goal is to expand business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of table mats, towels, and bed sheets.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David(46) is married and a father to 2 children; a girl and a boy. 
He makes wooden pallets used for packaging produce when transporting, or for storage. The business has grown over the last 3 years from a small carpentry stand behind his house, to having 3 employees working from the company's own yard.
 
He is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a truck. "We have contracts with big companies who want lots of pallets every week. Transporting the pallets is my biggest challenge because of the costs involved." says David. His margins are spread thin owing to logistical expenses and thus he believes that having a truck will greatly reduce the costs as well as improve the efficiency of delivering. 

David is a testament to the adage that "hard work pays". He has progressed from humble beginnings working odd jobs, to owning his own successful business. "I like telling people in my area that you can come from dust and become a success."

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with two children. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for six years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Kimlong Group

texts.en:
Kimlong’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Kimlong makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support his family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be wise.

Joseph operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and also grows vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 30 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be pests that invade his crops and cow diseases.

Joseph will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. His business goal is to have over 10 dairy cows within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a large scale farmer.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his farming business.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Del Hogar Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Reyna Eisabel tiene 64 años de edad, ella es socia del grupo "Las Triunfadoras del Hogar" que está integrado por seis socios, todos ellos pequeños comerciantes que poco a poco han ido creciendo en sus negocios.
Desde aproximadamente 13 años la Sra. Reyna Eisabel se dedica a la preparación y venta de menú cuando se lo solicitan, ésta actividad le ha permitido colaborar con el pago de los gastos familiares y tener un poco de independencia económica. Paralelamente a  ésta actividad ella es dueña y administra un auto que presta servicio de taxi. Le gustaría más adelante adquirir otro auto para ponerlo a trabajar y así crear su flota de taxis.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de su menú y otra parte lo invertirá en el mantenimiento del carro que presta servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
Reyna Eisabel is 64 years old, and is a member of the group "Las Triunfadoras del Hogar". The group is made up of six members, all of whom are small businesspeople who have grown their businesses little by little.

From about the age of 13, Reyna Eisabel has worked preparing and selling meals when requested. This work has allowed her to contribute to the household expenses and have a little financial independence.

Alongside this job she is also a landlady and manages a car which she lands out for taxi service. She would like to later acquire another car to put to work and so create a fleet of taxis.

The loan will be used to purchase ingredients for preparing meals and the rest will be used to maintain the car used for taxi service.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make and sell lunches and maintain a car used for taxi service.

loans.name: Kimanga Group

texts.en:
Omari is in his early 40s and is single with no child. He has been running two projects, selling clothes and a butcher shop for two years now. He works from 06am to 07pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Omari's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the meat stock, started selling clothes and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.

He used the profit to reinvest in business, to repay loan, to take care of himself and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to increase meat in his butcher shop and to increase clothing stock to sell. He dreams of expanding his business to be big.

Omari will share this with his loan group Kimanga which has three members who will hold each other accountable form paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase meat in his butcher shop and to increase clothing stock to sell.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a 44-year-old retail shop trader at Changamwe, Kenya. He is a father of three who has been in this business for the last three years doing well.

This is his first borrowing to finance his business. He will use the money to purchase sugar, tea leaves, cooking fat, maize and wheat flour and their anticipated profit to repay his loan. He hopes to own a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea leaves, cooking fat, maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia Veronica  se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia lleva los productos de belleza a diferentes lugares y amigos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Veronica works selling beauty products. She sells lipstick, creams, and perfume. She is a hardworking woman who through the means of this job is getting her children ahead. She sells the products to different places and to friends. She is requesting the loan to buy more creams, lipsticks and perfumes.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a married woman with three children. She operates a farm where she grows rice. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enhance production.

She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a farm where she sells milk and has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low milk prices.

Anne will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. Her business goal is to own many dairy cows within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Pedrina

texts.es: Doña Maria de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de tortillas y gracias a ese trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda terminando de construir su casa pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no lo le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion y asi poder tener ya su vivienda construida.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old and lives in a house she owns with her daughter. She has worked for many years selling tortillas. This work has allowed her to pay for her household expenses.

She wants to improve her home by finishing construction on her house, but what she earns is not enough to do it. This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials so she can have her home finished.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with has five children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a butchery where he sells meat.

He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: A 26 ans, Ami est jeune femme mariée qui vit avec ses deux enfants à charge et son mari à Adidogomè. Bien consciente de son état de vulnérabilité, Ami vend des produits de beauté et exerce un boulot d’esthéticienne de verni dans les quartiers environnant. Ami achète ses produits au marché une fois par mois et gagne ainsi son revenu. Ami désire ce prêt pour commander des tas de vernis petits et grand modèles puis des nettoyeur de verni  afin de satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients et maximiser son profit pour pouvoir couvrir ses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par sa famille et améliorer ainsi leur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Ami is twenty-six years old. The young woman is married and lives with her two dependent children and her husband in Adidogomè.

Well aware of her vulnerable position, Ami sells cosmetics and works as a manicurist in neighboring areas. Ami purchases her products once a month, at the market. This is how she earns her revenues.

Ami wants this loan to order many small- and large-size bottles of polish and polish remover. This is to meet her clients' needs and maximize her profits, so that she can cover the daily expenses incurred by her family. She will thus improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase thirty small bottles of nail polish, twenty large-size bottles of polish, and 20 bottles of polish remover.

loans.name: Veronica Yaneth

texts.es:
Verónica, de 31 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2 hijos y ambos trabajan para suplir las necesidades de su casa. 

Verónica, se dedica a la venta de frutas preparadas y a la venta de hot-dogs, ella vende sus productos  en los eventos deportivos que realizan en su pueblo, ella tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio, ya que su madre se dedico a eso también.

Verónica, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como, salchichas, frutas, pan, bebidas, entre otros porque se acerca los torneos deportivos en su pueblo y ella quiere provechar la afluencia de aficionados para vender sus productos.

Veronica, sueña con que sus hijos estudien en una buena escuela, para evitar que se involucren en cosas malas.- Ella sueña tambien con colocar un local de comida rápida, para poder vender más y ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
Veronica is 31 years old, married, and has two children; both are working to meet the needs of their home.

Veronica makes a living selling prepared fruit and hot dogs. She sells her products at sporting events in her town. She has dedicated herself to this business for 10 years. Her mother was devoted to the same work.

Veronica needs the loan in order to buy supplies like sausage, fruit, bread, and drinks among other things because her town's sporting tournaments are approaching and she wants to take advantage of the influx of fans in order to sell her products.

Veronica dreams of her children attending a good school in order to avoid getting involved in bad things. She also dreams of setting up a fast food place so that she can sell more and become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sausage, fruit, bread, and drinks among others.

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
Memory is a 34-year-old single mother of three boys. She is part of a women's group that makes and sells upholstery.

The group was formed two years ago by Memory and her neighbors who all wanted to improve the livelihoods of their families. The business has enjoyed stable growth over time and is now servicing well established furniture retailers.

Memory wants a loan from Kiva to buy more material. The loan will help her make more padding and pillows and thus increase the revenue.

"In five years time I hope to see our business having its own warehouse and employing lots of women," says Memory.

loans.use: to buy material.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Agée de 30 ans, Akou est une femme mariée vivant avec ses trois enfants à charge à Adidogomé. Pour soutenir sa famille, Akou vend des cuire dent et s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Akou réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, elle désire ce prêt pour commander des planches de cuire dent afin de bien vendre et favoriser l’émergence de son commerce et aider son mari à couvrir les charges de son foyer.
texts.en:
Akou is thirty years old. She is a married woman living with her three dependent children in Adidogomé.

To support her family, Akou sells toothpicks. She procures her supplies once a month at the market.

Akou makes her profits in this business and, to meet her clients' needs completely, she wants this loan to order parcels of toothpicks. This will allow her to sell well and help her business grow, so that she can help her husband pay for the household's expenses.

loans.use: purchase one parcel of toothpicks.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be jovial. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, sweets, flour, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation.

Mercy will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of sweets, cereals, flour, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sweets, cereals, flour, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Juana Clorinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia Clorinda alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  al negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de cerámica, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cerámicas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank COMUZONE I. The member, Clorinda, alternates her daily activities. She makes a living selling crafts. Clorinda dedicates herself to buying and selling ceramics.

She has had this job for some time. It is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work each day. She wishes to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

Clorinda is grateful for the loan and promises to complete the repayments. She is asking for the loan in order to buy ceramics.

loans.use: to buy ceramics.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a marrried man. He has four children. He describes himself to be responsible. He operates a carpentry shop where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a favourable area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more carpentry materials. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more carpentry materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with six children. She describes herself as determined.

Grace operates a retail business where she sells clothes, and has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothing. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maggie

texts.en:
Maggie is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as hardworking.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, sweets, soap and other items, and has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals.

Maggie will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, bread and other items.

She hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, bread and other items.

loans.name: Juan Carlos Junior

texts.es: Juan Carlos es un emprendedor de 19 años dedicado a la comercialización de productos especiales para la nutrición entre ellos batidos a base de proteínas, bebidas herbales, complejos multivitamínico y tés, ventas que propicia a través de visitas a su clientela conformada por familiares, amigos y referidos. Él planea seguir fortaleciendo su actividad comercial con la organización de un punto de desayunos con los productos de su oferta, a través de charlas nutricionales orientando a sus clientes, para lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que invertirá en la compra de un inventario significativo de malteadas y tés que requiere para poner en funcionamiento su proyecto. Su visión es continuar fortaleciendo su negocio y generar utilidades que le permitan ahorrar para adquirir su vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 19 year old entrepreneur who sells specialized nutrition products, including protein shakes, herbal beverages, multivitamins, and teas. He makes his sales on visits to his customers, who are family members, friends, and referrals. He plants to continue growing his business by organizing breakfasts with the products he offers and hosting nutrition discussions for his customers.

In order to do this, he is requesting his first Kiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest his loan in the purchase of a large inventory of shakes and teas that he needs to put his project into action. His vision is to continue growing his business and generate income that will allow him to save to buy his own home.

loans.use: to purchase a large inventory of shakes and teas.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée de 29 ans qui vit à Adidogomè. Mère de trois enfants, Akossiwa est une revendeuse des tubercules d’ignames. Akossiwa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour atteindre ses objectifs. Pour commander des calebasses d’ignames, Akossiwa nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement en vue de bien vendre et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants en payant les frais scolaire dès la rentrée à venir.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a 29-year-old woman living in Adidogomè. She is a mother of three and a retailer of yam's tubers.

Akossiwa procures her supplies twice monthly from the market. She retails in front of her house to meet her objectives.

Akossiwa needs these funds to order calabashes of yams. Financing her purchases will help her sell well and generate a good profit margin. She will thus be able to provide for her children and pay for their school expenses as early as the upcoming back-to-school season.

loans.use: to buy three calabashes' worth of yams.

loans.name: André

texts.fr:
André est un homme âgé de 47 ans. Il est marié et élève quatre enfants. C’est un paysan qui cultive toute sorte de légume et un éleveur de porcs et de volailles et cela depuis 30 ans.
Cela fait maintenant 5 ans qu’il est emprunteur chez Vahatra. Les d’avant lui ont permis d’augmenter le capital utilisé pour la culture et l’élevage et qui a permis une nette amélioration de sa vie et celle de sa famille. Avec ce prêt, André compte acheter 2 porcs, des semences de pomme de terre et des engrais.
Son objectif est la réussite scolaire de ses enfants ainsi que la construction d’une maison familiale.
texts.en:
André is a 47-year-old man. He is married and raises four children. He is a farmer who grows all kinds of vegetables and breeds pigs and chicken. He has been doing so for thirty years.

He has been a Vahatra borrower for five years now. Previous loans allowed him to increase the capital he uses for farming vegetables and animal husbandry. This made possible a clear improvement in his and his family's lives. With this loan, André is planning on purchasing two pigs, potato seeds, and fertilizer.

His goal is his children's educational success and building a house for his family.

loans.use: buy two pigs to fatten, potato seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment to work in his shop, specifically a compressor, a polisher and paint for autos.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Ayoko est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge. Ayoko est âgée de 33 ans et habite à Baguida où elle exerce son activité de revendeuse de céréales et divers. Ayoko s’approvisionne de ses marchandises quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Ayoko sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs et des bols de farine de manioc  afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de sa famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Ayoko is a married woman with four dependent children. She is thirty-three years old and lives in Baguida, where she has a business retailing cereals and various products.

Ayoko procures her merchandise four times a month at the market. She resells in a shed in front of her house.

Ayoko is requesting this loan to order bags of corn and bowls of tapioca flour. This will allow her to generate greater profits and help her husband provide for their family and improve the children's daily living conditions.

loans.use: buy one bag of corn and eighty-five bowls of tapioca flour.

loans.name: Selestine

texts.en:
Selestine is a Kiva borrower with two children. She operates a retail business selling Omena fish. She has been involved in this business for three years and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fish.

She hopes that in the future she will have a stable business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Omena fish.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia Cristina, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  al negocio de venta de carnes en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes entre otros
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the communal bank Comuzone I. Cristina's daily activities involve earning her living through her business selling meat in one of the markets in the town of Cusco. Cristina spends a long time on her business, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She wishes to be able to keep working so that she can keep supporting her family this way.

Cristina is grateful for the loan and has committed to meet her monthly repayments.

She is asking for the loan to buy meat and other products.

loans.use: to buy meat and other products.

loans.name: Patricia Abigail

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal COMUZONE I, la socia Patricia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  al negocio de venta de artesanía ,la socia vende lo que son joyas en plata como aretes, collares entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aretes entre otros.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the community bank COMUZONE I. She alternates her daily activities with making her living in the business of selling handicrafts. She sells silver jewelry such as earrings and necklaces, among others. She takes good care of her business, which is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She wants to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to meet her payment due dates. She is requesting a loan to buy earrings, among other things.

loans.use: to buy earrings, among other things.

loans.name: Hernila

texts.en:
The city of Bacolod in Negros Occidental is a prime business district because many schools, offices, malls and workplaces are located in the area. This is the reason why Hernila’s photocopying business flourishes. Her post is located beside a law office which is very advantageous for her. Later on, she decided to accept typing jobs as she is also adept at it. Then, she started selling coffee and snack items to clients who were waiting for the finished documents. Indeed, she really knows how to gauge the needs of customers and she is willing to go the extra mile to meet them. 

Hernila is a widow who has been exploring many ways in order to support the needs and education of her children. Now, her youngest son is already in college. Two to three years from now, she will be relieved of huge educational expenses and she can focus on improving her business further. For the time being, she is requesting supplementary capital of PHP 25,000 to pay for the maintenance of the Xerox machine. She also plans to sell office supplies and she needs a display cabinet for these. This additional capital will surely boost her income and savings.

Hernila is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of a Xerox machine; buy a display cabinet, and office supplies.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a retail business selling flour, bread, soap sugar, and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, bread, soap, sugar and other items. Her goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, bread, soap, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothing. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of clothing. Her business goal is to be an importer of clothes within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, 56 years old, is a mother of four. She is divorced and although her children are all grown up, she still has to work to support three relatives left in her care.

She is a tailor and works as part of group that makes and sells upholstery. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric material, specifically silk for making curtains. This loan will allow her to make more curtains and therefore to sell more.

loans.use: to buy fabric material.

loans.name: Dave

texts.en:
Dave is a villager from the northern part of the country and a mother of 13 children!

She's been raising livestock and doing agricultural activities for the past five years. The loan she is requesting will be used to dig a well for watering her plantations.

On the land that she and her husband own, they have planted orchards for fruit such as apples, and grapevines. Every year she plants corn for the animals and veggies to sell in the farmer's market. In addition to agriculture, she has two dairy cows, some sheep and two sows.

Dave and her husband are in their early retirement and their pension is a very small amount, so the agricultural activity supplements their small income. None of their children live with them to help financially as in most rural traditional families.

"Me and my husband are very poor and have no other income except for our small retirement pension that is not even enough for our monthly medication requirements. Thus, agricultural activity is good financially, but very hard on our exhausted and malnutritioned bodies," said Dave to the loan officer.

loans.use: to pay for digging a well that will be used for watering the plantations.

loans.name: Maria Daysi

texts.es: Maria de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboracion de  antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, etc. su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un credito para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maíz, plátanos y todos los ingredientes para su elaboración y así poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her three children.

She makes and sells snacks such as french fries, fried yucca, empanadas, etc., and her business is located not far from where she lives. Thanks to her business she is able to cover the household expenses.
