Maria is asking for a loan so she can buy the things she uses to make her snacks such as oil, potatoes, corn, plantains, and all the other ingredients she needs. This will allow her to continue to maintain her household and keep up with any expenses she may have.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn, plantains, and all the other ingredients.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a business where she cooks mandazi, cakes and other pastries. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in the price of ingredients. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy a large oven and a deep freezer.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to advertise her business.

loans.use: to buy a large oven and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is pictured in the photograph with his daughter. His vulnerable ethnic family is very poor and needs your financial help through this loan of 50,000 ALL in order to make some improvements to their poorly built home where very young children live.

loans.use: to improve the living conditions of his home; he is vulnerable, ethnic, and very poor.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is in her early 30s, is single and has one child who is still in school. She has been running several businesses for ten years now, for example a grocery store and selling fabrics and shoes. She works from 2pm to 10pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Joseline’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her grocery stock, and started selling fabrics and shoes. She has paid back all of her loans successfully. She is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for supporting their group, which is doing great.

She used profits to pay school fees and repay her loan. She also bought an M-pesa line for doing business, installed electricity in her house and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy more grocery drinks and up-to-date fabrics and shoes.

She dreams of owning a clothing company.

loans.use: to buy grocery drinks and up-to-date fabrics and shoes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a Kiva borrower who has 5 children.

She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes lack of rain as her biggest business challenge because it reduces the availability of animal feeds.

She will use the 90,000 KES loan to buy more cows. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a freezer for milk storage.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Grupo Buenos Vecinos Group

texts.es:
Jose (el primero del lado izquierdo de la fotografía)  es un joven de 18 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Santa Cruz La Laguna de Sololá.
Jose a pesar de ser muy joven  pero por la situación económica de su familia, él trabaja como agricultor sembrando una variedad de hortalizas y jocotes una fruta que su comunidad produce, como agricultor el lleva 10 años, pues comenzó desde muy pequeño con esta actividad, y ahora ya tiene mucha experiencia. Jose con el deseo de obtener este año una mejor cosecha de café ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y darle su mantenimiento necesario. Con esta inversión el espera cosechar la mejor producción de café. Su más grande sueño es seguir estudiando para contar con una empresa agrícola.
texts.en:
José (the first on the left of the photograph) is a young man at 18 years of age. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings in a community of Santa Cruz La Laguna de Sololá.

Due to the financial situation of his family, José, despite being very young, works as a farmer planting a variety of vegetables and "jocote", a fruit that his community produces. He has spent 10 years as a farmer because he started this work when he was very young and now has a lot of experience.

With the desire of getting a better coffee harvest this year, José has decided to request a loan in order to buy fertilizers and provide necessary maintenance. With this investment he hopes to harvest the best production of coffee. His greatest dream is to continue studying in order to have an agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maintaining his coffee.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as honest.

He operates a welding business where he makes metallic doors and windows and also offers other welding services. His primary customers are locals. He will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of welding materials.

His business goal is to have a big business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of welding materials

loans.name: Las Perlitas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS PERLITAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Margot ella es soltera y tiene 31 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo entre otros, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

Este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.

La socia que esta tapado con un circulo su rostro no saco este tipo de credito que se llama Credi Yapa.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These associates are members of the communal bank "Las Perlitas". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province and department of Cusco.

One member is Margot, who is 31 years old and single. Margot works in her business selling dry grains such as corn and wheat amongst other items. This member wants to be successful through her business. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman, who dreams of expanding her grain-selling business. She is asking for a loan to buy corn, barley and wheat.

This loan is part of a line of credit from the Arariwa Association (Asociación Arariwa). Its name is Credi Yapa and this line of credit is awarded to borrowers with a good credit history, and Las Perlitas meets the criteria.

The member whose face is covered with a circle did not take out one of the Credi Yapa loans.

The other members of the group earn their living through the sale of cereals, selling clothes, a grocery shop, and a restaurant.

Margot is grateful to those who are part of her dream in this way and she promises to make her repayments according to the terms.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley and wheat.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has 5 children. She operates a farm where she grows rice.

Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes inadequate working capital as her biggest business challenge.

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs plus labor costs. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs, plus labor.

loans.name: Fatime

texts.en:
Fatime and her husband are villagers in their early years of retirement.

They both receive a pension that doesn't even cover their monthly medical expenses, as per their statement.

Fatime practices agricultural activities and she has land where she plants feed for the animals such as corn, wheat and fodder which she sells to other villagers with animals. She also plants potatoes, beans and onions which she sells, in dried form, to whole buyers.

In addition, Fatime has two sheep and uses the milk and baby sheep for their personal consumption. The cow that she wants to add now will mainly be used to increase the income; she plans on selling the whole raw milk to the local farmer's market. She also plans to sell the baby calf that will be one year old.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Desideria

texts.es: Desideria de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de articulos escolares y ropa interior desde hace 5 años, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solevntar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Desideria is 62 years old.  She lives in her own house with her daughter.  She has worked selling school supplies and undergarments for the past five years.  Her business is located close to where she lives, and it possesses many customers.  With what she makes in her sales, she is able to pay some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale to be able to continue with her sales and thus to have better economic income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise wholesale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her late 40s, is a divorcee with three children. One of the children is still in school and the others are grown up. She has been selling secondhand clothes for three years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Rose’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing the secondhand clothes stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees and loan repayments, build a house of five rooms for renting and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy classic secondhand clothes. She dreams of being an international business woman.

Rose will make sure she pays back her loan within the scheduled loan period.

loans.use: to buy  classic secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Don Leonardo se dedica a la actividad de ganadería para producción de leche. Solicita un préstamo de quinientos dólares ($500), para la compra de una vaca que le permitirá aumentar su hato lechero y de esta manera incrementar su volumen de producción y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don Leonardo works a cattle farm to produce milk.

He is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a cow that will allow him to increase his dairy herd, and in this way increase his volume of production and increase his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: El Molinito Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Pascuala ella es soltera y tiene 42 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende platanos, naranjas y manzanas , la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos y uvas . 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de ferreteria.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These associates belong to the communal bank "El Molinito II". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province and state of Cusco.

One of the members is Pascuala. She is 42 years old, single with two children. This member works in her business selling fruit by taking them to different places. She sells bananas, oranges and apples. She has spent many years in this business and it is doing very well. Pascuala's dream is to have a shop where she can sell her fruits. She is asking for a loan to buy oranges, bananas and grapes.

Pascuala is happy about the loan and she promises to make regular repayments.

The member whose photo is stuck onto the group picture, had her photo taken after the meeting because she asked to be excused due to work.

The other members earn a living by; selling sweets, selling clothes, a grocery store and a hardware store.

Pascuala is grateful to those who are part of her dream in this way, and she promises to make her repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas and grapes.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with 7 children. She describes herself as honest.

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 15 years, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the 55,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase more cows.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is 48 years old and lives in the Martvili district, in Georgia, with his parents.  The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 cows and a plot of agricultural land, where they grow some fruits and vegetables. 

Roman decided to expand the husbandry business and requested a loan.  The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to obtain a loan of 1,000 GEL.  With the received credit he will purchase piglets and will expand his husbandry business.  Roman is very motivated and hopes that the business will be profitable.  He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and expand his husbandry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un joven muy optimista con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, él tiene 22 años de edad, soltero y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Santa Catarina Palopó, Sololá.
Juan como muchos jóvenes todos los días se esmera para prosperar en la vida, él cuenta que gracias al crédito pudo comprar sus mostacillas y logro cubrir mejor la demanda de su negocio, a Dios gracias con ello sus ingresos mejoraron, pero él no es un joven conformista por esa razón nuevamente solicita un préstamo para la compra de más mostacilla y realizar más atuendos con ese producto.
Su gran sueño es incrementar su negocio y satisfacer mejor a sus clientes, pero también desea construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Juan is a very optimistic young man with big aspirations in life. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings in a community of Santa Catarina Palopó, Sololá.

Juan, like many young people, strives every day to prosper in life. He says that thanks to the loan he was able to buy beads and managed to better cover the demand of his business and, thank God, with this his income improved. But he is not a complacent young man and for this reason he is again requesting a loan in order to buy more beads and make more outfits with this product.

His great dream is to expand his business and better satisfy his customers, but he also wishes to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy beads.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, dicha actividad la realiza recorriendo las calles principales de su municipio, además buscando la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida, quiere iniciar la venta de ropa, ya que en estas épocas las venta de ropa aumentos. María cuenta con vivienda propia desde hace 21 años, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con un lugar propio y acogedor en el cual vivir. María desea iniciar con la venta de ropa pero además desea mantener su venta de medicamentos, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en medicamentos y variedad de ropa para mantener su venta de medicamentos e iniciar venta de ropa y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Con el crédito anterior María logro invertir en la venta de medicamentos por lo que se siente muy agradecida.
texts.en:
María is a hard-working woman who earns a living through selling medications. Her work is done around the main streets of her town. She is also seeking ways to improve her quality of life so she wants to begin selling clothes, as, at the moment, clothing sales are on the rise.

María has had her own home for 21 years, and so she is happy to have her own, welcoming place in which to live. María wants to start selling clothes but she also wants to keep selling medications. This is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in medications and an assortment of clothing. In this way she hopes to improve her financial income.

With her previous loan, María managed to invest in medications to sell, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to invest in medications and a variety of clothing to keep selling medication and to start selling clothes.

loans.name: María Amparo

texts.es: Doña María Amparo es una mujer muy esforzada que se dedica a la venta de diversos artículos de uso doméstico. Ella solicita un préstamo de mil dólares ( $1,000), para la compra de mercadería, esto con el propósito de ofrecer más variedad de artículos a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: Doña María Amparo is a very strong woman who makes a living selling various household products.  She is requesting a loan of a thousand dollars ($1,000) to buy merchandise with the goal of offering a greater variety of items to her customers and increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sale of household products.

loans.name: Rayson

texts.en:
Rayson is a married man with 1 child, and describes himself to be energetic.  For 4 years he has operated a carpentry business making furniture.  His primary customers are locals. 

Rayson will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more timber for making furniture.  This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  His previous loan was repaid successfully.  He will use the anticipated profits to purchase more carpentry machines.	

Rayson's business goal is to own a timber yard within 5 years.  He hopes to achieve a better standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Saimon

texts.en:
Saimon is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be active. He operates a food café and has been involved in this business for 4 years.

His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

Saimon's business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Pades Duteraninkunga Group

texts.en:
This group loan comes to an under-served community. The President of Pades Duteraninkunga (standing above the kneeling group), Claudette is 41 years old and married with five children aged 9-19. For the past five years, Claudette has formulated a local milk drink, which she sells to her community. While Claudette sells the beverage at the market, she also delivers to neighbors and receives them in her home. All of Claudette's business is run out of her home, which limits the amount of space for her family of seven.

While her beverage is enjoyed throughout the community, Claudette would like to expand her inventory and market. In order to do so, she has requested this loan from Kiva through Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of sorghum and a cow so that she can reduce the cost to make her locally-beloved beverage. With the extra income, she hopes this loan will improve her family's status and will allow her to purchase medical insurance for her family. As she continues to create additional profits, Claudette hopes that she will be able to move her operations outside of her home.

While Claudette was elected President of the group, the other members are just as deserving of business-expanding loans. Many of the other members also sell items such as clothing, drinks and food in the market as well as in their neighborhoods. Most of the members hope to use profits for school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sorghum to make a local drink to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel con 47 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con su esposa, en casa propia, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Manuel se dedica a la actividad de producción y venta de pan, desde hace más de 2 años de antigüedad.Solicita préstamo para la compra de insumos para la producción de pan. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ha tenido 2 préstamos con nuestra institución, el último fue de S/.3,000.00 soles a 12 meses y lo a cancelado puntualmente.
texts.en:
Manuel is 47 years old.  He lives with his wife in his own house in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in Perú.  He has many good personal references and works for the residents in the area.  The inhabitants of this place mostly work in agriculture, trade, and livestock.

Manuel has worked in the production and selling of bread for more that two years.  He is requesting a loan to buy input for bread making.  In this way he can make his business grow, obtain more income, and to able to improve his quality of life.
 
He has had two loans with our institution.  The last one was for  3,000 soles for 12 months, and he paid it off punctually.

loans.use: To buy more input for bread making.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a married man with three children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, juices, flour, basins and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years.

His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

His business goal is to be able to import products for sell within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man with three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells tyres and other spare auto parts. He has been involved in this business for four years.

His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KRS 60,000 loan to buy more stock of auto part spares. His business goal is to start selling cars within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spare auto parts.

loans.name: Bledar

texts.en:
Bledar is 34, married, and a soon to be father.

He lives in the very rural central Albania. Their family's only source of income is agriculture; they sell corn, beans and cherry fruits to whole buyers in large quantities.

Bledar has only 3 dynym of agricultural land where he has 60 cherry orchards and corn and beans planted on the rest. He also plows the land and offers other agricultural services, with two horses.

As the picture suggests, his family is very poor and they would very much appreciate any financial help through this loan. "Our baby is coming soon and living under such conditions will be hard on a newborn child. It's very cold and moldy inside and the roof is leaking," said his wife, who did not want to be pictured, to the loan officer.

loans.use: to make some basic improvements to his poorly built family house

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 60 years old. He lives in Batumi district with his wife and son. Levan works at local school and gets small monthly income.

He wants to start taxi business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1600 GEL.

With the received credit Levan will purchase a car and will start taxi business. He will serve locals as a taxi driver and will be able to generate income. Levan awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start taxi business.

loans.name: Ekomefeemo 6 Group

texts.en:
The Ekomefeemo 6 Group is in its fifth loan cycle with ID Ghana. It is in the city of Accra, Teshie, an urban poor area of the capital of the country. They are very fighting and sacrificing women who are into local food joints, doughnuts, cutlery sets and smoked fish.

Mantekai is one of the members who makes a living by cooking local dishes and selling them to customers. She sells banku (cooked corn and cassava paste) and stew, rice and stew, ampese (cooked yam or plantain) and stew. In this way she makes a living in a dignified and honest way. Through her sacrifice she is helping people that she wants to and for those who struggle.

She is requesting this loan to buy yams, plantains, corn, cassava paste and vegetables to prepare the local dishes and sell them to customers. In this way she is able to continue with her efforts as she has been. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to be someone in life and improve her small enterprise.

loans.use: to buy yams, plantains, corn, cassava paste and vegetables to prepare the local dishes and sell them to customers.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el cliente posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor como: sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their son. He has a shop which has been located in his place of residence for several years.

With the earnings that he makes, he has been able to pay off some of his housing expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale, such as: soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, and other items. This will enable him to improve his income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread and other items.

loans.name: Doris Jovita

texts.es:
La socia Doris Jovita  se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una persona emprendedora y luchadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pescado,limon y camotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Doris Jovita, works a business selling food.  She is an entrepreneurial and hardworking person who, through this business, is able to get her family ahead.  

Doris Jovita is requesting the loan to buy products for cooking such as fish, lemon, and sweet potatoes. 

Doris Jovita is happy for the loan, and she promises to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy products for cooking such as fish, lemon, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Ilulu Group

texts.en:
Mary is in her early thirties and is married with three children. One of her children is still small while the other two are in school.

She has been selling milk for three years now. She works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mary's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy feed for her cattle to make more milk to sell to more customers. She dreams of buying more cattle and selling milk at whole sale prices.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group Ilulu which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle in order to make more milk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es: Rosa de 43 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de mondongo, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 8 años, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la clienta solicita nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas mondongo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 43, lives with her family and makes a living buying and selling tripe. The business has been located in her home for 8 years. With the profit she earns, she manages to cover the expenses that come up at home.

She is again asking for a loan in order to buy more tripe at wholesale price so that she can continue her sales and thus have a better economic income.

loans.use: to buy more tripe.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es: Benito se dedica a la actividad de ganadería. Solicita un préstamo de dos mil cien dólares ($2,100), dinero que usará para la compra de ganado, esto le permitirá aumentar su volumen de producción y de esta manera incrementar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Benito works a job with livestock.

He is requesting a loan of $2,100, money that he will use to buy cattle.  This will allow him to increase his production volume, and in this way increase the sales of his business.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 4 years.

Kadzo's business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the rainy season, which affects business. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Shomari

texts.en:
Shomari is a married woman with two children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regulars. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase an electric sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Busisiwe

texts.en:
Busisiwe, 26, is young and eager to grow and earn a living. She learned how to sew from her grandmother. She joined a group of ladies from her area and together they formed an upholstery and tailoring business. She is the youngest member of the group and is equally the most ambitious one.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy material. The loan will assist the business in making more products thus meeting demand and increasing revenue.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, the woman appearing in the photo, is thirty years old, married and blessed with five children. She runs a kiosk selling foodstuffs to earn a living.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2013. Since then, she has received training on enterprise development and financial planning, which has equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise.

Beatrice is borrowing from Kiva to buy more stock that will help boost the business. She hopes her business will thrive, thus producing more income to use to educate her children. Beatrice is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy more stock of foodstuffs that will lead to more income from improved sales.

loans.name: Shanthi And Group

texts.en:
Shanthi is 28 years old and lives with her family of four in the Tiruchirappalli district of Tamil Nadu. Both her children are below the age of 12. She works as a daily wage labourer on agricultural fields to sustain her family, in addition to managing the household chores.

She wants her family to lead a comfortable life. They currently live in a house which does not have a durable roof. Shanthi wants to purchase raw materials to upgrade her house and purchase a new roof.

Shanthi leads a group of 5 women. The other members come from similar backgrounds and they need funds to upgrade their respective houses. They have come together to apply for a group loan of Rs. 100,000. The loan will help these families access basic housing facilities and lead comfortable lives.

loans.use: to purchase a roof and upgrade her house.

loans.name: Khanum

texts.en:
Khanum is from Mayisyan village where she lives with her mother-in-law, husband and daughter. Khanum's and her family's only occupation is in farming business. They keep a livestock of two cows, four calves, and cultivate potatoes.

Khanum asks this loan to purchase a cow and feed for the livestock. This is important for their farm to boost income gathered from it. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make for a number of difficulties for people developing their businesses in the Shirak region.

Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Khanum's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region to help them access the market and earn a living.

Khanum and her whole family hope to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 44-year old mother of two children aged 18 and 14. Sadly, her husband passed away leaving her as the breadwinner. She works hard to ensure that her children stay in school and have what they need.

She formed a company together with other like-minded and strong-willed women. They do upholstery and tailoring, selling their products and services across Soweto as well as in Johannesburg CBD.

She is requesting a loan to buy more material. "There is lots of demand but we don't have enough material to finish the work," she says. The loan will help her meet demand and therefore improve revenue.

She is full of joy, carrying an infectious smile while talking of a bright future for her and her children. "I hope to grow the business into a warehouse employing lots of women from the townships," says an outspoken Lydia.

loans.use: to buy material.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stocks such as cooking oil, sugar, rice, noodles, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Twizerane Group

texts.en:
Clementine is 30 years old and married with 2 children, ages 8 and 12. She is the president of the group Twizeran. In the picture she is holding the book in her hand.

Clementine runs a business selling beans, sweet potatoes and bananas at the market. She has been in this business for 1 year. She requested this loan through Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of beans, sweet potatoes and bananas to sell.

Clementine says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family status, allowing her to pay school fees for her children and increase her business level. In the future, she would like to get livestock (such as goats and chickens) to help her earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of beans, sweet potatoes and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Lydiah, twenty nine years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2013. Lydiah farms maize and beans, and she also rears sheep.

With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to run her enterprise better and more profitably than before. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and animal feeds.

This will increase her farm production thus meet the demand for cereals and milk. She hopes to earn more income which will go a long way in supporting her family's basic needs and medical care. Lydiah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and animal feeds.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The woman appearing in the photo is Nancy. She is 30 years old, married and blessed with two children.

After joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa she received training on business and financial management. Nancy started a clothes selling business which has enabled her to provide education and food for her children.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more clothes for sale. She looks forward to improved income that will ensure continued support for her family. Nancy appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the help and has promised to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes that will boost her business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Joy, 30 years old, married with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 and had undergone training on enterprise and financial management.

She used the skills gained to open a food shop where she gets her daily income. She is therefore borrowing a loan to add stock to her business. This will lead to more sales hence increased income.

She will be in a position to educate her children and provide better balanced diet and shelter. Joy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Simon is a retailer operating on a busy street in town, and he has been in that business since 2009 to earn a living. He lives in the city outskirts where he sells to people from different walks of life.

He solely depends on the shop to take care of his family's needs and pay tuition for the children. He dreams of expanding his business, however, he is limited by inadequate financial resources. He has asked for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy sugar, rice, corn flour and soda for selling. Simon's ambition is of owning a bigger wholesale business in town.

loans.use: add stock of sugar, rice, corn flour and soda.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
At 72, Gertrude can be forgiven for wanting to relax and quietly while her days away but this is not the case! She is the gatekeeper, meaning that she is the first one to open the store where she and her business partners work.

She is the oldest member of a group of ladies who started a tailoring and upholstery business two years ago. The business has helped Gertrude stay active and busy and is also her only source of livelihood. She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a new sewing kit and to buy material. She is tasked with repairing torn or worn-out products; hence the need for a new sewing kit. The materials will be used to make more products, thus improving Gertrude's income even as she supports one relative.

loans.use: to buy a sewing kit and material.

loans.name: Alvinah

texts.en:
Alvinah, 56, is a married mother of two boys. Eight years ago, after being laid-off, she started a construction company that has grown impressively over the years. She oversees the company's operations and hires people on a temporary basis whenever she wins a project.

Owing to this steady growth, the business now needs an office. She is requesting for a loan to buy office furniture, primarily: 2 tables, 3 executive chairs, 2 PCs, a printer and stationery. This loan will help her set up an office and thus be available to clients on a more official basis. "We are getting bypassed by big contracts, especially from the government, because we don't have an office. This loan will help us get an office, thus get more business from big institutions." says Alvinah.

loans.use: To buy office furniture and equipment

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 46 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. Margaret joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH-EA) in 2014 to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development training.

She is involved in the buying and selling of sisal robes. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more robes, hence adding to her stock for increased income. This will enable her provide better food and clothing to her children.

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more robes to add to her stock

loans.name: Goretti

texts.en: Goretti is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a favourable area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia Maria se sigue dedicando al trabajo en una joyeria,la socia es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de joyeria .La socia solicita el credito para comprar joyas como aretes,collares y pulseras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria continues working in a jewelry business. She is an enterprising and hard-working person. It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.

Her dream is to expand her jewelry business.

She is requesting the loan to buy jewelry like earrings, necklaces, and bracelets. She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy jewelry like earrings, necklaces, and bracelets.

loans.name: El Grupo Dinamico Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Pilar Yanet,tiene 46 años de edad, ella forma parte del grupo de nombre "El Grupo Dinámico" que está integrado por cinco socios que a pesar de las muchas dificultades que han tenido como grupo debido a la falta de responsabilidad de algunos integrantes ellos han podido salir adelante, actualmente ya cuentan con socios responsables y puntuales con los compromisos de pago.
La Sra. Pilar Yanet trabajaba anteriormente como confeccionista de forma dependiente, actualmente y gracias a los préstamos recibidos anteriormente ha podido juntar un capital el cual lo ha invertido en la compra de prendas de vestir al por mayor el cual ofrece a sus conocidos creándose así un trabajo independiente donde ella puede manejar sus tiempos. Le ha ido muy bien en poco tiempo a podido obtener ganancia y recuperar capital, el mismo que vuelve a invertir.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros para la venta.
texts.en:
Pilar Yanet is 46 years old. She is part of the group named El Grupo Dinámico [The Dynamic Group], which is made up of five members that, despite the many difficulties that they have had as a group due to the lack of accountability of some members, have been able to move forward. They currently have responsible members that are punctual with their repayment commitments.

Pilar Yanet used to work as an employee at a clothing retailer. Now, thanks to the loans she has previously received, she has collected capital which she has used to buy clothing at wholesale that she sells to her acquaintances. This way she has an independent occupation where she can manage her schedule. It has gone very well for her, and in little time she was able to obtain profits and recuperate her capital, which she then reinvests.

The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of men's and women's clothing to sell.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from Gyumri town, Shirak region. He lives with his aunt and brother but because of many financial hardships, his brother left the country as a migrant worker with the hope of finding a well-paid job.

Artur is involved in cattle breeding. He keeps livestock of five cows, nine calves, eight sheep, three sows and seventy hens. Aiming to enlarge his livestock, Artur is asking for this loan. He needs to purchase two pigs and forage for feeding the livestock.

Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make for a number of difficulties for people developing their businesses in the Shirak region. Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Artur's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for two pigs and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Juan Carlos se sigue dedicando al negocio de confección de muebles, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de confeccion de muebles. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar melanina y pinturas para los muebles.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Juan Carlos continues working his furniture-production business. The member, through this business, wishes to put his family forward and progress. His dream is to grow his furniture-production business. He requests a loan to buy melamine and paints for the furniture.

The member is happy because of the loan and promises to fulfill the payment obligations of his dues.

loans.use: to buy melamine and paint for the furniture.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Doña Maritza se desempeña en su propia tienda de abarrotes. Solicita un préstamo de seiscientos dólares ($600), para la compra de productos que le permitan incrementar su volumen de inventario y de esta manera incrementar los ingresos familiares y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Maritza runs her own grocery store. She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy products that will allow her to increase the size of her inventory, and in this way increase her family's income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 47-year-old retail shop trader at Changamwe, Kenya. She is a mother of two whose spouse provides additional income and has been in this business for the last four years doing well.

This is her first borrowing to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase sugar, milk, tea leaves, washing soap, wheat and maize flour, and the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, tea leaves, washing soap, wheat and maize flour.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a marrried man. He has eight children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a poultry farm where he keeps chickens. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy materials to build a chicken house. He hopes that in the future he will be successful.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a chicken house

loans.name: Nak Group

texts.en:
Nak is a 34-year-old married rice farmer with three children, and she resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Two of her children attend school and another one is a construction worker. To support her living, she has grown rice for 17 years. Her husband is also a 36-year-old rice farmer as well. Together, the family can earn approximately USD 9 per day.

Nak is pictured first from the right. She is the group leader and would like to request a loan as part of the group of four members. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for farming. This loan helps her to increase her income as well as her family's standard of living. In the future, she is going to buy more farmland, build a new proper house, and support her children to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, galvanized metal, nails, wire and vegetables to build a stall and restock her business.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Doña Martina se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas y bebidas propias de la región. Ella solicita un préstamo de doscientos cincuenta dólares ($250), dinero que usará la compra de productos necesarios para la elaboración de dichas comidas. Esto le permitirá atender mayor cantidad de clientes y aumentar los ingresos provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en: Martina cooks and sells meals and beverages typical of the region. She is seeking a loan of $250, which she will use to buy products necessary for making the meals. This will allow her to serve more customers and increase the income generated by this work.

loans.use: to buy products for cooking meals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Gladis Arminda

texts.es: Gladis de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 7 años, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda contruyendo las paredes pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales de contruccion y poder tener una vivienda mas digna.
texts.en:
Gladis is 41 years old. She lives in her own home with her family. She has been working selling tortillas for the past 7 years. With her earnings, she is able to meet various household expenses. 

She would like to improve her housing by constructing walls. Because she does not have enough capital she is requesting a loan for the purchase of building materials, which will allow her to have more decent housing.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a 26-year-old nursery school proprietor at Changamwe, Mombasa. She is a single mother of two who has been operating this since January 2015.

This is her first loan to expand her business. She will use the money to renovate her classrooms and use the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to own a full school in the future.

loans.use: to renovate classrooms

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman with five children. She describes herself as patient. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is a Kiva borrower with three children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells coriander, peas, ginger and other vegetables. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 34-year-old greengrocer in Changamwe, Kenya. She is a mother of four who has been in this business for the last four years, doing very well.

This is her first loan to finance her business. She will use the money to purchase fruit and vegetables for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. She hopes to grow her greengrocery to serve more people in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.es:
Napoleón con 44 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Aramango, provincia de Bagua, departamento de Amazonas, país Perú.Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Napoleón se dedica al cultivo de café . El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en mantenimiento y compra de abonos para el cultivo. Esta inversión le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.

Napoleón es socio recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa sus ganancias van dirigidas para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Napoleón is 44 years old and single. He lives in his own home made of rustic material in the district of Aramango, the province of Bagua, the department of Amazonas, in Peru. 

He has very good personal and work-related references through the inhabitants of his area. The inhabitants of this locality work mainly in agriculture, business, and ranching.

Napoleón works by producing coffee. He will use the loan to invest in maintenance and the purchase of manure for farming. This investment will allow him to gain greater profit to improve his economic condition and therefore invest in better life conditions.

Napoleón is a recurring member in Edpyme Alternativa. Their profits go towards improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance and the purchase of manure for farming.

loans.name: Delcy Paola

texts.es:
Ella es Delcy es una mujer de 25 años de edad que está a punto de dar un enorme paso en su vida y quiere que la acompañes a recorrer su primer aventura como independiente. Desea iniciar un negocio como confeccionista a terceros y en parte confeccionara su línea de ropa propia, y aunque junto un capital aun le resta un monto para comprar una máquina fileteadora, telas, agujas, hilos y demás insumos para iniciar su profesión.
Por ello solicita un apoyo económico para completar el dinero que necesita para comprar estos insumos y herramientas.
Ella tiene un enorme propósito para volverse independiente el cual es generar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia en especial para su hijo que tan solo tiene 8 años de edad y lograr una independencia económica.
texts.en:
Delcy is a 25 year-old woman who is about to take a huge step in life, and she wants you to join her in her first adventure as an independent person.  She wants to start a business as a dressmaker, making garments for third parties and starting her own clothing line. Although she has saved some money for this, she needs some additional funds to buy an overlock sewing machine, thread, needles, and other supplies to start her business.  

This is why Delcy is requesting financial support so that she can have the funds she needs to buy these supplies and tools.  Delcy intends to become independent, generating a better quality of life for her family, especially for her son, who is only 8 years old.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking equipment and supplies

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es:
Pedro  es un hombre de 19 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia de una hija de dos meses, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Pedro con el gran amor que le guarda a su familia, trabaja de sol a sol para darles lo mejor, el desde hace tres años trabaja como piloto de su carro que presta servicios de fletes, gracias a esta actividad a su familia a saco adelante. Pedro por ser su carro su mayor fuente de ingresos ahora le preocupa pues las llantas están en muy mal estado y ya no le permite trabajar, a raíz de esta necesidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de llantas para poder seguir trabajando y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Su mayor sueño es mejorar sus ingresos y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 19 year old man. He is single, with a nice family including a 2-month old daughter. This nice family lives in a community in Sololá. Pedro, with a great love to care for his family, works from sun up until sun down to give the best he can. 

For the past three years, he has been working as a driver in his far. He offers rides. Thanks to this activity, his family has gotten by. Because his car is his main source of income, Pedro is concerned because the tires are in bad shape and he is unable to work. Because of this, he needs to request a loan to purchase tires, to be able to continue working and satisfy his customer's needs.

His greatest dream is to increase his income and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his car

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is 56 years old and a father of four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development and financial management.

His economic activity is mixed farming; poultry and vegetable farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more chicken and chicken feeds. This will increase his income, assist him in building a modern poultry structure, and help him pay school fees for his children, as well as provide better food and clothing.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more chicken and chicken feeds to boost production and earn more income. He will use the income to build a modern poultry structure and pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a boutique where she sells dresses, skirts and other types of clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have two more business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and expand her business.  She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: Don Jacinto se dedica a la cría y engorde de pollos para la venta. Solicita un préstamo de doscientos cincuenta dólares ($250), para la compra de pollos, alimentos y bebederos necesarios para el desarrollo de dicha actividad. Esto le permitirá aumentar los ingresos provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en: Jacinto breeds and raises chickens to sell. He is requesting a loan for two hundred fifty dollars ($250) to purchase chickens, feed, and water dispensers, which are needed to develop his business. This will allow him to increase the earnings he makes from this activity.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells hand bags and clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of hand bags and clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hand bags and clothes.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a married man and has two children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a farm where he grows maize, cabbage, potatoes, and peas. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza con 32 años de edad,de estado civil soltera, vive en casa alquilada de material rústico, en el distrito de La Peca, provincia de Bagua, departamento de Amazonas. país Perú, en una zona rural. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Maritza se dedica a la actividad del cultivo de café. El préstamo solicitado lo utilizará para invertir en el mantenimiento y compra de abonos del cultivo. Esta inversión le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias, de esta manera mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.

Maritza es socio nuevo en Edpyme Alternativa, sus ganancias van dirigidas para mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Maritza, 32, is single and lives in a rented house constructed from rustic materials in the district of La Peca in Bagua Province in the rural part of the Department of Amazonas, Peru. She has good personal work references from inhabitants of her community.

Maritza earns her living growing coffee. The loan she is requesting will go to invest in crop fertilizer and to maintain her crops. This investment will allow higher profits and improve her economic condition toward better living conditions.

Maritza is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa. Her profits will be directed toward improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase crop fertilizers and invest in her crop's maintenance.

loans.name: Norelvys

texts.es: Norelvys es una emprendedora de 28 años que proviene de una familia de comerciantes y que posee una  sagacidad para  identificar las oportunidades de negocio que se le presenten, de este modo inició su sueño de prosperidad inició cuando se cambió de residencia y percibió que no existía un establecimiento dedicado a la venta de medicamentos en las cercanías del lugar y sin dudarlo decidió iniciar una droguería, la cual atiende todos los días a partir de las 9:00 a.m. hasta las 8:00 p.m.  Sus clientes son vecinos y transeúntes del sector, y en su establecimiento encuentran medicamentos de uso común y  artículos de aseo personal a excelentes precios.  Norelvys está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que proyecta invertir en un mayor volumen de medicamentos y artículos de aseo personal que le permitan una mayor oferta. Su visión es seguir ampliando la cobertura del negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norelvys is a 28-year-old entrepreneur who comes from a family of traders and has a sagacity to identify the business opportunities presented to her. She thus began her dream of prosperity, when she changed residence and perceived that there was no establishment in drugs sales near the place. Without hesitation, she decided to open a drugstore which she runs every day from 9:00 am to 8:00 pm. Her customers are neighbors and passersby from the sector; in her establishment, they find commonly used medicines and personal care items at excellent prices.

Norelvys is negotiating her first Kiva loan with the "Fundación Mario Santo Domingo" [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation], a loan that she plans to invest in a greater volume of medicines and personal care items that allow her a greater supply. Her vision is to keep expanding the coverage of the business and provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to invest in a greater volume of medicines and personal care items.

loans.name: Melbin Adilmar

texts.es: Melbin de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus grupo familiar, el se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, gracias a su trabajo es como puede salir adelante, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas fertilizantes, abonos controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos ya que le ha ido muy bien en las siembras y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Melbin, 39, lives in his own home with his family group. He earns his living in agriculture and breeding cattle. He has more than 20 years experience in his activity. He sells his products in various markets near his home. Thanks to his work, he has been able to move forwards. He is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizer again plus manure, pest-control, and herbicides to continue with his crops that have been sown well. Therefore, he will have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, pest-control, and herbicides

loans.name: Camino Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CAMINO AL PROGRESO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Manuela ella es soltera y tiene 64 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These clients are members of the community bank "Camino al Progreso" [Path to Progress]. This bank is located in the district of Santa Ana, located in the province of La Convención in the Department of Cusco. Manuela is a single, 64-year-old woman with three children. She works in her grocery store business selling staples like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8 am to 7 pm and already has five years of experience in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her business into a larger grocery store. Manuela is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The member who is in the attached photo was unable to make it to the group meeting because of his work. The other members are in the businesses of selling animals, farming, selling groceries, and selling food. Manuela is grateful for those who are part of this dream through this platform and agrees to comply with the repayment of her loan on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loans.name: Ingris Yulieth

texts.es: Ingris de 25 años es ama de casa y madre de 4 niños de 10, 8, 6 y 3 años, motivada por aportar a la economía de su hogar decidió seguir con el negocio que un familiar había abandonado por una oportunidad laboral con una empresa privada y gracias a ello las utilidades que obtiene de su actividad comercial las destina al beneficio de su familia; ella vende cervezas a los vecinos que se reúnen los fines de semana (viernes, sábado y domingo) para escuchar música, departir y tomar cervezas una bebida  popular en este sector de Barranquilla. Ella tramita actualmente su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual invertirá en la compra de cervezas y bebidas gaseosas pues su capital de trabajo actual no le permite atender la totalidad de la demanda que se genera en el sector donde reside. Su sueño de prosperidad es fortalecer su negocio, generar mayores utilidades y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Ingris, 25 years old, is a housewife and mother of four children ages 10, 8, 6, and 3. Motivated by contributing to the household income, she decided to pick up the business that a relative had abandoned for a work opportunity with a private company. 

Thanks to that, the utilities she obtains through her commercial activity are directed towards the benefit of her family. She sells beer to her neighbors who meet on weekends (Friday, Saturday, and Sunday) to listen to music, converse, and drink beer—a popular drink in this area of Barranquilla.

She currently seeks her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she would invest into buying beer and soda drinks, since the current capital she gains from work does not allow her to cover the entirety of the demand that comes from the area where she lives.

Her dream of prosperity is to strengthen her business, generate greater income, and have her own home.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of beers and soda drinks.

loans.name: Hacia El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HACIA EL TRIUNFO.
La socia Iliana tiene 48 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es convívetela socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros a todos sus clientes que le solictan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceité entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en: These are the members of the community bank group "Hacia el Triunfo" [To Victory]. The member Iliana is 48 years old and has two children who live with her. She alternates her daily activities for her grocery store business, where she sells staples like rice, sugar, milk, and others to her customers who buy from her. She has experience and does well with her business thanks to the effort she puts forth each day. She wants to continue working in her business to support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, cooking oil, and other items. The group in general appreciates their loan being granted and are committed to meeting their repayments. The members attached to the group photo asked permission to be late to the meeting because of their work.

loans.use: purchase rice, cooking oil, and more

loans.name: Usbeika

texts.es: Doña Usbeika se dedica a la compra de limones a los productores de la comunidad para posteriormente comercializarlos. Solicita un préstamo de mil dólares ($1,000), para incrementar la cantidad de compra de limones, con esto podrá ampliar su participación en el mercado y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Usbeika earns her living buying lemons from producers to sell in her community. She has applied for a loan of $1,000 to increase the amount of lemons she can buy so that she can increase her market share and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase lemons to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel es un hombre casado de 32 años de edad, él con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, pues con el apoyo del crédito logro instalar su servicio de energía eléctrica, y ahora su hogar ya cuenta con una mejor estabilidad pues sus hijos ya tienen energía para realizar mejor sus tareas de la escuela, con este vence está muy contento pero lamentablemente su casa aún no cuenta con agua potable por lo que ahora su prioridad es la instalación del servicio de agua potable, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo , para que muy pronto en su casa cuente con agua y su familia no tenga que sufrir cargado agua. Su gran sueño es ser reconocido como un buen albañil en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 32-year-old married man. With a lot of effort, he's been able to bring up his family. With help from a loan, he was able to install electricity and now his house has better stability and his children have energy to do their homework better.

He's very happy with this achievement, but unfortunately his house still lacks potable water. Installing potable water service is now his priority. He's seeking a loan so his family will soon have water and won't have to suffer carrying water. His great dream is to be recognized as a good builder in his community.

loans.use: to install potable water in his house.

loans.name: Walter Humberto

texts.es: Walter de 36 años de edad, es una persona quien vive de manera humilde junto a sus padres en vivienda propia en la cual tienen 20 años de residir. Walter es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, él ofrece sus servicios de mecánico automotriz en un pequeño taller que se encuentra en su comunidad en el cual lleva ya varios años laborando y de esta manera puede satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. La casa en la que habita es humilde pero se encuentra al lado de un área en donde el terreno es ladera y esto lo hace ser peligroso por las lluvias, ya que poco a poco se va desgastando el suelo y es por ello que Walter solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro y pagar mano de obra, para la elaboración de un muro de contención y de esta manera evitar que el suelo se siga desgastando y así pueda vivir con más tranquilidad y sin miedo a alguna tragedia por las constantes lluvias.
texts.en: Walter is 36 years old and lives a humble life with his parents in a home they've own for the last 20 years. Walter is a very responsible and hard-working man. He works as a automobile mechanic in a little garage located in his community. He has worked there for several years and earns money to meet his family's basic needs. The house where he lives is humble and it's located in an area where the land is a slope and it is dangerous because of the rains, which, little by little, erode the terrain. This is why Walter is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, and steel, and hire workers to build a retaining wall to avoid further erosion. That way he will live with peace of mind and will not be afraid of a tragedy due to the constant rain.

loans.use: buy bricks, cement, sand, and steel, and hire workers to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Jaime Salvador

texts.es: Jaime de 23 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia en la cual ha vivido desde que nació junto a su madre, hermanas y Abuela a la que apoya en su vejez. Jaime es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, labora como mecánico automotriz en un pequeño taller que está cerca de su casa, en la cual tiene varios años laborando y así también en busca de obtener más ingresos para la economía del hogar, Jaime se dedica a hacer viajes con un bus y de esta manera ayudar a su familia. Jaime habita en una humilde vivienda, la cual en busca de mejorar y así también su estilo de vida, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, hierro, clavos y pago de mano de obra para instalar el techo en su vivienda, la cual con esfuerzo Jaime  empezó a construir gracias a un crédito que solicito anteriormente y que con este nuevo espera poder finalizar la construcción y de esta forma tener un hogar para así vivir de una forma más tranquila y segura.
texts.en:
Jaime, 23, lives in his own home. He's lived there since he was born together with his mother, sisters and grandmother who he supports in her old age.

Jaime is a very responsible and hardworking man. He works as a car mechanic in a small workshop near his house. He's been working there for several years. In search of more income for the household, he's also been making trips with a bus and thus helping his family.

Jaime lives in a humble house. In search of improving it, and also his lifestyle, he's seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheet metal, iron, nails and payment for labor to add a roof to his house. Jaime began building this with his own effort thanks to a loan he asked for earlier. With this new loan he hopes to be able to finish the construction and thus have a house to live more calmly and securely.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, iron, nails and payment for table to add a roof on his home.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es un hombre de 46 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 4 y 25 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Santa Lucia Utatlán Sololá.
Ramiro para sacar adelante a su querida familia, desde hace 18 años se dedica a la agricultura cultivando una variedad de verduras de su región, con esta actividad a su familia ha sacado adelante. Ramiro desde hace algún tiempo se ha visto a la necesidad de construir un muro para asegurar su casa, pues presenta peligro por una de los lados de su casa, pero su gran dificultad es que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para la compra de lo necesario para la construcción por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena, piedrín. Con este préstamo el espera construir el muro lo más pronto posible para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a 46-year-old man who's married with a beautiful family of seven children between four and 25 years old. This family lives in the Santa Lucia Utatlán Sololá community.

To help his dear family get ahead, he's worked in agriculture for 18 years, growing a variety of vegetables from the region. With this work, he's brought his family up. For a while, Ramiro has seen the need for building a wall to secure his house, as one of the sides is dangerous. His greatest difficulty is not having enough money to buy what he needs for the construction.
