As a result, he's seeking a loan to buy cement, sand and gravel. With this loan, he hopes to build the wall as soon as possible to give his family more stability.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel for building a wall.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a God-fearing married man. For the past ten years he has sold fruit such as oranges and watermelons to his community to earn a living.

Henry took out and successfully repaid two prior loans through Kiva's field partner SMEP Microfinance Bank. He has now applied for a 55,000 KES loan to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Jose Carloman

texts.es:
Carloman con 26 años de edad,de estado civil soltero ,no tiene hijos, vive junto a sus padres en casa de material rústico, en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú,en una zona rural.Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Carloman se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café variedad catimor,cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente cria animales menores, cultiva productos de pan llevar para su consumo (yuca, vituca, menestras, plátanos y otros productos); cuenta con amplia experiencia en estos rubros. Solicita préstamo para mantenimiento de su cultivos de 1 hectárea ; asegurando campaña 2016 con una mejor producción.

Carloman es socio recurrente en Nuestra Institución. Firma solo.
texts.en:
Carloman, 26, is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in a rustic house in the Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department in Peru, in a rural area. He has many good personal references for his labor from the residents of the area. The residents in this area mostly work in agriculture and livestock.

Carloman earns a living through agriculture, especially growing catimor variety coffee. He has four years of experience with this work. In addition, he cares for older animals, grows grain products for his consumption (cassava, vituca, beans, bananas and other products). He has a lot of experience with this work.

He's seeking a loan to maintain his one hectare of crops, securing a better production for the 2016 season. Carloman is a recurring member in our institution and signs by himself.

loans.use: to maintain his one hectare of crops.

loans.name: Annisa

texts.en:
Annisa is an honest married woman who has five children. For the past three years she has run a small store where she sells flour, bread, soap, milk and other items to people in her area. She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

Annisa has taken out and successfully repaid three prior loans through Kiva's field partner SMEP Microfinance Bank. She has now applied for a 100,000 KES loan to buy more flour, sugar, bread, milk and other items for her store.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar, bread, milk and other items for her store.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Virgen de Fatima, las integrantes se unieron para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo unido y sacrificado, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por elevar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cipriana quien es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, a través de las capacitaciones que les ofrece la fundación paraguaya y sumado a eso su trabajo en carpintería. Comenta que gracias a su negocio da a su familia una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de materiales para su carpintería, como ser maderas, herramientas, e insumos varios, agradece  por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The members of the Virgen de Fatima group joined together to be able to help their loved ones through their united work and sacrifice. They are in a program for poverty elimination, striving to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Cipriana, who is a very hardworking and striving person. She can be found improving her situation of poverty through the trainings Fundación Paraguaya offers, and adding this to her carpentry work.

She says that thanks to her business, she gives her family a dignified life. She's seeking this loan to buy materials for her carpentry like wood, tools and various inputs. She's grateful for the opportunity she's receiving to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood, tools and inputs for carpentry.

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es: Rosa de 39 años de edad, vive felizmente junto a su esposo y su hijo de 18 años de edad. Rosa para poder sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia presta sus servicios en una empresa que se dedica a la creación de ropa y que se encuentra en las cercanías de su vivienda, labor que viene realizando desde varios años para poder cubrir las necesidades del hogar y así también su compañero de vida ayuda con la economía del hogar. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, Rosa, decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: láminas, madera, clavos, cables eléctricos y otros para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y también cambiar la instalación de la energía eléctrica ya que se encuentra en mal estado y debido a que el techo está deteriorado y hay filtraciones de agua nace el temor que una tragedia pueda pasar si se deja pasar por alto y es por lo que Rosa ha decidido solicitar este crédito.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39, lives happily with her husband and their 18-year-old son. To be able to survive and bring up her family, Rosa offers her services in a business near her home where she makes clothing. She's been doing this work for several years to cover the household's needs. Her life partner also helps with the household economy.

In search of a better quality of life, Rosa decided to seek a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheet metal, wood, nails and electric cables to change the roof and repair her electric installation which is now in bad shape. The roof is deteriorating and there are water leaks, leading to fear that a tragedy could happen if she leaves it alone. Thus, Rosa has decided to seek this loan.

loans.use: to invest in sheet metal, wood, nails and electric cables to change the roof and repair her electric installation to avoid danger of an accident.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a female Kiva borrower. She has five children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, bread, soap, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt, flour, and other items.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, salt, flour, and other items.

loans.name: Liliam Nohemy

texts.es:
Liliam, de 41 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora, está acompañada, vive con su pareja y su única hija que estudia cuarto grado, su pareja trabaja como ayudante de ganadero. 

Lilian, tiene una pequeña pupuseria y comedor en su casa, ella vende pupusas de arroz y almuerzos, fue hace unos meses que decidió colocar su propio negocio y de esa manera le ayuda a su pareja con los gastos de la casa. 

Liliam, necesita el préstamo para comprar sillas, mesas e insumos para tener más variedad de comidas. 

Ella, sueña con que su negocio crezca y poder ampliarlo y remodelarlo para darle un aspecto más bonito.
texts.en:
Liliam, 41, is a very hardworking woman. She's partnered and lives with his partner and their only daughter, who's in fourth grade. Her partner works as a livestock assistant.

Liliam has a small pupusa shop and restaurant in her home. She sells pupusas made of rice and lunch foods. She decided to start her own business a few months ago and thus helps her partner with household expenses.

Liliam needs the loan to buy chairs, tables and inputs to have a greater variety of food. She dreams of her business growing, and of being able to expand and remodel it to give it a better appearance.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables and inputs to have a greater variety of food.

loans.name: Daysi Verónica

texts.es:
Daysi, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer joven, luchadora y muy responsable, es madre soltera y ha sabido llevar esa responsabilidad sola, ya que hace unos años se separo de su esposo, vive con su madre y sus dos hijos. 

Daysi, se dedica a la venta de aparatos electrónicos como celulares, reproductores de música, accesorios, entre otras cosas, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 8 años y asegura que ha sido su trabajo el que la a ayudado a salir adelante. 

Daysi, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio, porque necesita actualizar su inventario y comprar modelos nuevos de accesorios. 

Daysi, seuña con que sus hijos tengan un futuro más prometedor y desea que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Daysi is 37 years old. She is a young woman, a fighter, and very responsible. She is a single mother and has known that this is her responsibility alone, since it has been years that she separated from her husband. She lives with her mother and two children.

Daysi is dedicated to selling electronic devices, such as cell phones, music players, and accessories among other things. She has had this business for 8 years, and it has been her work that has helped her go forward.

Days needs the loan to buy more merchandise for her business, because she needs to refresh her inventory and buy new models of accessories.

Daysi dreams that her children will have a more promising future, and she hopes that her business grows.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business because she needs to refresh her inventory and buy new models of accessories.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 45, has three wives and fifteen children, ten of whom attend school. With the help of his wives he farms around three hectares of bananas on his plantation. He also has a dairy and raises cows to sell. He has managed to look after his family including and especially paying school fees for his children.

Stephen’s major challenge is the number of family members he has, which means more school fees and medical bills to pay. His income sources, however, are limited.

Stephen is applying for a 3,500,000 UGX loan to buy more cows to raise and sell. His dream is to own one of the largest farms in the region.

loans.use: to buy more cows to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es: Ligia de 65 años es una microempresaria muy dinámica, ella consideraba que con su conocimiento y talento podía crear microempresa y generar ingresos para el beneficio de su familia, de tal manera que cuando llegó hace dos años al municipio de Galapa, incursionó en el negocio de la cocina, pues era algo que le gustaba en el que podía involucrar a su familia.  Actividad que hasta el día de hoy la mantiene ocupada y ofreciéndole calidad de vida, ella empieza a trabajar a las 8:00 a.m. y termina a las 3:00 p.m. Ligia elabora almuerzos y los distribuye a domicilio a vecinos y empleados de las empresas cercanas a su residencia. En la actualidad  está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que planea invertir en la compra de víveres al por mayor, para evitar realizar compras fraccionadas y obtener un costo más bajo. Su meta es seguir incrementando el número de clientes, adecuar un restaurante para atender público y generar ingresos suficientes para comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ligia, 65 years old, is a very dynamic small business entrepreneur. She thinks that with her knowledge and talent, that she can create a small business and generate revenue for her family’s benefit. Hence, when she arrived two years ago to the city of Galapa, she ventured into the cooking industry since it was something that she liked and in which she could involve her family. To this day, this business has kept her busy and offers her quality in her life.

She starts working at 8 a.m. and finishes at 3 p.m. Ligia makes lunches and delivers them to the homes of neighbors and the employees of businesses close to her home. She is currently submitting her first credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. She plans to invest this loan in buying groceries wholesale, in order to avoid making small purchases and to obtain lower costs. Her goals are to continue increasing her number of customers, upgrade her restaurant to tend to groups and to generate an income sufficient to buy her own home.

loans.use: to invest in buying groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a married man. He has four children. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy garage tools for motor vehicle repair. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy garage tools for motor vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Doralice

texts.es:
La Sra. Doralice tiene 59 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos todos mayores e dependientes, que ella y su marido criaron con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, es dueña de una Despensa desde el 2004.
Su negocio se halla ubicado en una zona muy transitada, lo que le permite tener muchas ventas y de esa forma ir mejorando poco a poco su negocio.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de productos varios para poder surtir su negocio tales como: bebidas, productos lácteos, de limpieza, frutas, verduras, panificados, embutidos y otros, esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Doralice is 59 years old, is married, and has three children, all of whom are older and independent. She and her husband raised them with a lot of effort and sacrifice. She has been the owner of a store since 2004.

Her business is located in a very busy area, which means she has many sales. In this way, she continues improving her business little by little.

She asks for this loan to buy various products so that she can supply her business. The products include drinks, dairy products, cleaning products, fruit, vegetables, bread, cold cuts, and other things. She is thankful for this opportunity to continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, cleaning products, fruits, vegetables, bread, cold cuts, and other things.

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente, de 24 años de edad, es albañil, está acompañado y aún no tiene hijos.

Vicente, se dedica a la albañilería, trabaja con proyectos de construcción, pero también es agricultor, dice que es la manera que tiene de ganarse la vida y de la cual obtiene sus ingresos.  

Vicente, ha sembrado casi 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y necesita comprar más abono para que su milpa sea más productiva este año y también para su cultivo de frijol. 

Los sueños de Vicente, es construir su propia casa para mudarse con su esposa, porque actualmente vive junto a sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Vicente, 24 years of age, is a bricklayer. He is in a relationship and does not yet have children.

Vicente works in bricklaying and on construction projects, but he is also a farmer. He says it is the way he makes a living and earns an income.

He has sowed almost 14,000 square meters of corn and needs to buy more fertilizer so that his cornfield and bean crop are more productive this year.

Vicente dreams of constructing his own house so he can move there with is wife, because he currently lives with his siblings.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer so his cornfield, as well as his bean crop, are more productive this year.

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik is farmer from Jajur village. He is the father of three grown-up children and is a former policeman. After leaving his job as a policeman, Rubik started more intensive work on his farm.

Rubik currently keeps two calves, piglets, and 90 hens. He also cultivates wheat and potatoes. Rubik asks for this loan to purchase three sows and forage for feeding the livestock.

Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make for a number of difficulties for people developing their businesses in the Shirak region. Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Rubik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region to help them access the market and earn a living.

Rubik hopes for lenders' support to develop his farm.

loans.use: to pay for three sows and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “San Miguel” es un grupo nuevo formado en Ciudad del Este, por medio del trabjo unido ellas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida, es por ello que también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Filomena, quien entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, aunque es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que lo hace de manera ambulante, ella eta contenta, ya que a través de su emprendimiento ayuda a su familia, dándoles una vida sin privaciones. Quiere seguir mejorando, es por ello que siempre es muy activa en las capacitaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo,  y a través de su trabajo seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group called "San Miguel" is a new group, formed in the city of Este. By working together, they want to improve the conditions of their lives. As a result, they are also part of the program to eliminate poverty.

One of the members is Mrs. Filomena, who is dedicated to selling fruits and vegetables. Although the work is difficult, since she works as a street vendor, she is content. Through her business, she helps her family, giving them a life without want. She wants to continue improving, so she is always very active in the trainings.

She asks for this loan to buy fresh fruits and vegetables, so that she can continue with her sales. Through her work, she can continue to help her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Chinar

texts.en:
Chinar is from Kamo village of Shirak region. She lives with her two children and husband; together they run their family farm. Chinar keeps 12 calves, 5 cows, sheep, and 10 hens. Chinar also cultivates wheat and cabbage on the land near their house.

Chinar asks for this loan to pay for wheat seeds, four piglets, and forage for feeding the cattle.

Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make for a number of difficulties for people developing their businesses in the Shirak region. Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Chinar's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region to help them access the market and earn a living.

Chinar and her family would be very grateful for the loan, as it is very important for them to develop the farm and gather income for living costs.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, four piglets, and forage for feeding the cattle.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee, de 56 años de edad, es un ejemplo de mujer luchadora, es viuda y ella sola ha tenido que hacerse responsable de sus 5 hijos que viven con ella.  

Aydee, se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, pasteles de carne y toda clase de platos típico, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años y en el transcurso de los años ha fidelizado a muchos clientes que siempre consumen sus productos y gracias a eso ha logrado salir adelante y darle alimentación a sus hijos.  Esa es la principal fuente de ingresos que ella tiene. 

Aydee, solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como papas, aceite, cacerolas, condimentos, entre otros para su negocio. 

Ella sueña con sacar adelante a sus hijos hasta que pueden ser independientes.
texts.en:
Aydee is 56 years old, and she is an example of a persevering woman. She is widowing, and she alone is responsible for the 5 children who live with her.

Aydee is dedicated to selling fried potatoes, meat pastries, and all types of traditional dishes. She has had this business for 10 years. Over the course of those years, she has gotten many loyal clients, who always eat her products. Thanks to this, she has succeeded in going forward and in feeding her children. This is the main source of income she has.

Aydee requests the loan to buy supplies, such as potatoes, oil, pans, and condiments, among other things, for her business.

She dreams of taking her children forward so that they can be independent.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as potatoes, oil, pans, and condiments, among other things, for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Ella es una joven madre jefa de familia cuenta actualmente con 34 años, labora en lo mercados sobre ruedas vendiendo ropa para el sustento de familia. 
Sus piezas molares se encuentran empalmadas por lo que padece de fuertes dolores, necesita urgentemente  una cirugía de extracción. Lamentablemente sus ingresos no le alcanzan para solventar el gasto ya que ella es el único sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
She's 34 years old and a young mother, the head of her family. She sells clothing in open-air markets to support her family.

Her molars are pushed together so she suffers a lot of pain. She urgently needs surgery to have them removed. Unfortunately her income isn't enough to cover the expense, because she's the only person to support her family.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Adenilson Vladimir

texts.es: Adenilson es un hombre de 26 años de edad quien vive al lado de su compañera de vida y de una hermosa hija de 10 meses de edad por quienes se esfuerza día con día en su trabajo. Adenilson desempeña la función de albañil independiente, trabajo que lleva algunos años desempeñando y de esta manera mejorar su vivienda y a la vez ofrecer una mejor forma de vida a su esposa y a su hija, Adenilson y su familia viven de una forma muy humilde y su casa necesita algunas reparaciones. Es por lo que Adenilson solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento y arena para encementar piso y paredes, de esta manera mejorar su vivienda. Gracias a que Adenilson labora como albañil, no habrá necesidad de pagar mano de obra, ya que él mismo haría el trabajo.
texts.en: Adenilson is a 26-year-old man who lives with his partner and a beautiful 10-month-old daughter, for whom he works very hard every day. Adenilson works as an independent builder. He has been doing this work for several years, which has helped him to make improvements to his home and offer a better quality of life to his wife and daughter. Adenilson and his family live very humbly and their house needs some repairs; for this reason, Adenilson is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement and sand for cementing the floor and walls, thereby improving his home. Thanks to his work as a builder, Adenilson will not need to pay labourers as he will be doing the work himself.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand for cementing the floor and walls

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, de 36 años de edad, es un señor responsable y trabajador, está acompañado, vive con su esposa y tienen un hijo que asiste a la escuela y es su más grande orgullo. 

José, se dedica a la albañilería y también es agricultor, cultiva maíz, frijoles y arroz, camina 30 minutos para llegar a su trabajo y gracias a la agricultura ha logrado sostener a su familia y poder salir adelante. 

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos de frijol, ya que necesita pesticidas, fertilizantes y semilla para la siembra de este producto.

José, sueña con que este año sus cultivos sean mejores que los del año pasado, porque de esa manera podra obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
José is a responsible and hardworking 36-year-old man. He is in a relationship, lives with his wife, and has a son who attends school and is his greatest pride.


He is a bricklayer and farmer. He grows corn, beans, and rice. He walks 30 minutes to arrive at his job. Thanks to agriculture, he has managed to support his family and get ahead.


José needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies for his bean crops. He needs pesticides, fertilizers and seeds for the sowing of this product.


He hopes that this year his crops will be better than last year, because that way he will be able to have better profits.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his bean crops.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, todas las integrantes trabajan en variadas actividades, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Fulbia forma parte de este grupo, es una mujer muy activa, que pese a los inconvenientes del día a día se esfuerza por salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de carteras, jeans sábanas, y otros productos variados, tiene buena venta ya que siempre tiene buena variedad que ofrece a sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, sabanas y otros productos para poder seguir con sus ventas, esforzándose por mejorar cada día.
En la foto aparece una persona de más, ya que la misma forma parte del grupo, pero en esta ciclo no solicita el préstamo, pero firma como codeudora.
texts.en:
Renacer Group is in its first loan cycle in the women's bank program. The members all work in various businesses. They're in the Poverty Stoplight program so they can improve their living conditions.

Fulbia is part of this group. She's a very active woman who makes an effort to get ahead every day despite her problems. She earns a living selling wallets, jeans, sheets, and a variety of other products. She has good sales because she always has a wide variety for her customers.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, sheets, and other products to keep making sales and force herself to improve every day.

There's an extra person in the photo who is part of the group but is not requesting a loan in this cycle, although she is signing as a co-debtor.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, sheets, and other products

loans.name: Vimbanai Group

texts.en:
Tandiwe keeps poultry, and it has become her main activity to earn a living. The process of cleaning, feeding and taking care of poultry is turning into the chapters of a book. At the crack of dawn, she wakes up and starts picking fresh eggs from her fowl-run. She then starts cleaning and changes water bowls for her chickens. To start a new day, she gives them fresh water and adds more feed to enhance their ability to lay more eggs and to add more nutrition to the broilers.

Currently she has 350 layers that give her an average of 10 crates a day. In addition, she keeps batches of 150 broilers. She restocks broiler chicks from a local supplier and also restocks the total bags of feed that will sustain them for the period up to the slaughtering stage.

Tandiwe is 57 years of age, married, and has four dependents. The first child is a graduate in marketing, followed by an architect based in South Africa. The third born is a graduate in business studies and the youngest finished his advanced levels and is about to start his degree in software engineering. She has been able to pay for their fees with the earnings from raising poultry with the help of her husband.

Her business has been going fairly well but she wanted to meet excess demand and keep two batches of broilers uninterruptedly. She teamed up with her business partners and joined Thrive Microfinance to enhance her business. They've increased their record-keeping skills through the training they get from Thrive. They have also increased their savings skills and have made it their key to financial security.

After the training, they received a group loan totalling $1,880 USD.

loans.use: to increase her flock of broilers.

loans.name: Hector Eduardo

texts.es:
Héctor, de 54 años de edad, es un señor muy simpático y reconocido en todo su pueblo, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, su esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar, sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. 

Héctor, es muy conocido en su pueblo, ya que se dedica a la venta de sorbetes artesanales y a la venta de papas fritas en las ferias del pueblo, cuando se realizan las fiestas patronales, él no puede faltar con su carretón de sorbetes y su puesto móvil de venta de papas fritas. 

Héctor, necesita el préstamo para comprar quintales de papas y los ingredientes para elaborar los sorbetes, a parte de eso necesita hacer una reparaciones a sus carritos ambulantes. 

Los sueños de Héctor son, poder hacer crecer su negocio y poder ir a otras fiestas patronales a vender sus fantásticos productos.
texts.en:
Hector, 54 years old, is a very kind man and known throughout his community. He lives with his wife and their two children. His wife tends to the home and helps out with the household chores. His children work and help him out financially.

Hector is well known in his community since he works selling handmade ice cream and also sells French fries at the village festivals. When they celebrate the patron saints, he does not miss them with his big cart of ice cream and his mobile stand for selling French fries.

Hector needs the loan to buy hundredweights of potatoes and the ingredients for making ice cream. Additionally, he needs to make some repairs to his carts.

Hector’s dreams are to grow his business and be able to go to other patron saint festivals to sell his fantastic products.

loans.use: to buy hundredweights of potatoes and the ingredients for making ice cream. Additionally, he needs to make some repairs to his carts.

loans.name: Gerson Alexander

texts.es:
Gérson, de 32 años de edad, está casado, tiene un hijo que está estudiando, su esposa es ama de casa.

Gérson, es albañil, se dedica a hacer trabajos de construcción y a montar estructuras metálicas, la principal fuente de ingresos es un taller de estructuras metálicas que tiene y es de ahí que obtiene la mayoría de sus ingresos.

Gérson, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para su trabajo y para renovar y dar mantenimiento a sus maquinas de soldadura. 

Gerson, desea que su hijo pueda estudiar en la universidad y ser un profesional.
texts.en: Gérson, 32, is married, and has one son who is a student.  His wife is a housewife.  Gérson is a builder, and he is engaged in doing construction work as well as assembling metal structures.  His main source of income is his metal workshop, and he obtains most of his income from this work.  He needs the loan to purchase materials for his work, and to upgrade and maintain his soldering machines.  Gérson wants his son to study at the university, and become a professional.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his work, and to upgrade and maintain his soldering machines.

loans.name: Tendekai Group

texts.en:
The four ladies shown in the above picture are members of the Tendekai group. Tendekai is a Shona word which means ‘committed.’ True to their name, the members of the group are dedicated, loyal and willing to give their time and energy into growing their businesses. One of the group’s members is Patience. She is a 30-year-old vibrant business woman. 

Patience is a cross-border trader to South Africa. She started her business in 2014. Her motivation to start cross-border trading came out of the need to help her husband fend for their three children. Her husband is a jeweller, but due to the harsh economic environment his business is not bringing in the expected profit. Her situation was further worsened when her child was involved in a tragic accident and they needed funds for health care. In the midst of all this, Patience refused to give up. In order to get back on her feet, Patience and her friends sought help at Thrive Microfinance. The group came to Thrive in August 2015. The ladies are committed to growing their businesses and to be able to change their lifestyle. 

With a loan from Thrive, Patience hopes to resume her cross-border trading. She also hopes to open a flea market business where she can cater to a larger customer base. Patience is very grateful for the business training she has received at Thrive.

loans.use: to restart her cross-border business selling clothes and footwear.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora De La Asuncion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuestra Señora de la Asuncion está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde a través del trabajo continuo logran salir adelante, ellas son mujeres muy unidas que pese a ser un grupo relativamente nuevo se ayudan mucho para poder mejorar sus pequeños emprendimientos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Carmelita, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo que ella realiza lograra concretar sus metas. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas de todo tipo, comenta que se hizo de muy buena clientela debido a que siempre tiene muy buenas comidas, y son muy ricas.
La Sra. Carmelita pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos que necesita para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, panificados, condimentos y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
texts.en:
The Nuestra Señora de la Asuncion Group is in its second cycle of the women's committee program, where they succeed in getting by through their hard work. They are very united women; despite being a relatively new group they help each other a lot to be able to improve their small businesses. 

One of the members is Miss Carmelita, who, through her constant hard work, has been able to get closer to her goals.  She makes a living through the sale and production of all kinds of food. She comments that has made very good customers because she always has good, delicious food.

Miss Carmelita is requesting this loan to be able to buy the necessary supplies to make her food, such as meat, condiments, bread, and other things. This way she can continue to delight her customers with the delicious food she makes.

loans.use: to buy the supplies to make food, such as meat, condiments, bread, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in purchasing beer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, iron, sheet metal, bricks and pay for labor to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta, de 55 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos de 21 y 24 años de edad, no estudian pero le ayudan a trabajar en la milpa, actualmente cultivan granos básicos y ellos son el único apoyo que ella ha tenido desde el fallecimiento de su esposo.

Marta, es una señora trabajadora y dedicada totalmente a su familia y a la agricultura.- Pero además de cultivar granos básicos, también cultiva caña de azúcar de donde extrae el jugo luego, luego pasa por el proceso de cocción, se pasa al molde y después de 30 minutos se obtiene el producto final llamado “atado de dulce”, que es un sustituto de los azucares empacados de las compañías azucareras. Ella se ha esforzado mucho para lograr salir adelante con este trabajo tan arduo. 

Marta, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar frijoles, con el préstamo podrá tener los insumos para aplicarlos en el tiempo indicado y estos podrá rendir más y obtener una mejor producción.

Marta, sueña con dejarles a sus hijos un buen patrimonio y tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta, 55 years old, lives with her two children who are 21 and 24 years old. Neither studies but they help her work in the cornfield and currently they are growing basic grains. They are the only means of support she has had since her husband died.

Marta is a hardworking woman, completely dedicated to her family and agriculture. But besides growing basic grains, she also grows sugarcane - extracting the juice later during the cooking process and moving it to molds and after thirty minutes she obtains the final product called “atado de dulce” [a whole unrefined cane sugar made from boiling and evaporation of sugarcane juice, a product also known as panela], which is a substitute for packaged sugars. She has worked very hard to get by doing such an arduous job.  

Marta needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies for growing beans. With the loan she can get the supplies in order to use them at the correct time and this will result in more yields and better production. 

Marta dreams of leaving her children her assets and giving them a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing beans.

loans.name: Damaris De Jesús

texts.es: Damaris es una microempresaria de 45 años  que reside junto a su familia en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla y ante la necesidad de apoyar a su cónyuge con la economía del hogar, se decidió a tomar el camino del emprendimiento hace 5 años; ella se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, calzado, cosméticos, bolsos, entre otros productos solicitados por su clientela compuesta principalmente de amigos, vecinos y referidos y que visita para propiciar sus ventas. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que planea invertir en de ropa, calzado, cosméticos y bolsos para atender la demanda que genera la temporada de fin de año. Su meta es fidelizar a su clientela con calidad, precios y buen servicio, organizar un local comercial donde exhibir sus productos y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Damaris is a 45 year old small business owner. She lives with her family in a neighborhood in the town of Barranquilla. Because she needed to help her partner with household expenses, five years ago she decided to turn in the direction of entrepreneurship. She makes a living selling clothes, footwear, cosmetics and bags, among other things to her customers which are mainly friends, neighbors, and referred customers. She visits them in order to promote her sales. 

She is in the process of applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she plans to invest in clothing, footwear, cosmetics and bags to meet the demand generated by the end of the year season.  Her goal is to gain the loyalty of her customers through good quality, prices, and service, and to have a local store where she can display her products. She also wants to remodel her home.

loans.use: to invest in clothing, footwear, cosmetics and bags.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos, ellos ya son adolescentes y estudian, su esposa es ama de casa, pero también tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa. 

Carlos, trabaja como empleado en una tejera, trabaja en ese lugar desde hace varios años y el cargo que desempeña es de transportista de carga, su función es llevar los pedidos de teja a los clientes que lo solicitan, siempre le ha gustado su trabajo y gracias a eso ha podido salir adelante con su familia. 

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para surtir su tienda con productos como: azúcar, arroz, frijoles, pan, café, detergentes, cloro, papel higiénico, etc. 

Los sueños de Carlos, son poder ver a sus hijos estudiar en la universidad y que sean profesionales; y que su tienda crezca más.
texts.en:
Carlos is 53 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children. His children are teenagers and students and his wife is a homemaker, but also has a small store at the house. 

Carlos works as an employee at a tile store, where he has been working for several years as a cargo driver. His job is to take tile orders to the customers purchasing them. He has always liked his work and thanks to it he can get by with his family.  

Carlos needs the loan to stock his store with products such as sugar, rice, beans, bread, coffee, detergent, bleach, toilet paper, etc. 

Carlos's dreams are to be able to see his children study at university and work as professionals. He also wants to see his store grow more.

loans.use: to stock his store with products such as sugar, rice, beans, bread, coffee, detergent, bleach, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is a well-known farmer mainly dealing in pineapple farming in the Kyamuhunga Subcounty, Bushenyi District. She started this project in 1999 and has managed to sustain her family of four children. She is married. Her side income comes from rearing goats and farming coffee, and this has helped her earn some good money to support her family. She was born in 1969 and all of her kids are in school. This is her second loan cycle from UGAFODE MDI and she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 UGX (two million shillings only) to buy fertilizers for manuring her pineapple shamba in order to increase the yields and sustain her family.

Allen is an honest lady in her business and she works 10 hours a day. She sells to all categories of people around Bushenyi District. She is faced with the challenge of weather changes that affect the harvest. Her vision is to educate all of her children.

She says that UGAFODE MDI staff has a good customer care.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es: Martin es uno de las muchas personas que sus vidas sean visto muy beneficiadas con los créditos de ADICLA, él ya tiene varios años de trabajar con préstamos, Martin cuenta que gracias a este crédito él pudo  comprar sus semillas de zanahoria y fertilizantes y su cultivo logro realizar, a Dios gracias logro venderlo en su mercado regional y sus ingresos mejoraron que hasta le fue posible comprar cuerda y media de terreno donde ahora piensa cultivar, pero no tiene los recursos necesarios y a raíz de esta necesidad él solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de semillas de zanahorias y papa. Con esta inversión Martin espera obtener buenos resultados y terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Martin is one of many people whose lives have been improved with loans from ADICLA. He's already been working with loans for several years. Martin says thanks to this loan, he was able to buy his carrot seeds and fertilizers to achieve his crop.

Thanks to God, he was able to sell it in his regional market and his income improved enough that he was able to buy rope and land where he's now planning to grow crops. However, he doesn't have the necessary resources and is thus seeking a new loan to buy carrot and potato seeds. With this investment, Martin hopes to get good results and finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy carrot and potato seeds.

loans.name: Uganda Martrys Centenary School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Gratin. He is the Director of Uganda Martyr’s Centenary Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kakumiro in Kibaala with 750 students. Uganda Martyr’s School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Uganda Martyr’s School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Gratin ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as determined. She owns rental houses. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her business is located in a busy area. 

Riziki will use the KES 55,000 loan to renovate her rental houses. Her business goal is to build more rental houses within five years. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Estrella Joselin

texts.es:
Estrella es una joven mujer de 26 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia trabajo social en la universidad.
Ella es inteligente, constante y muy responsable. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla es pañol. Su vida la realiza en casa de su madre junto a sus hermanos que estudian, viven en una casa construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Ella estudia trabajo social; le interesa los principios de la justicia social, los derechos humanos, la responsabilidad colectiva y el respeto a la diversidad cultural e ideológica, “mi carrera es una pasión que nos sostiene y da sentido a nuestra existencia..." comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios ella trabaja en sus ratos libres vendiendo regalos en su puesto de venta fijo. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar material de escritorio y proyector audiovisual. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios y extender su negocio, ella desea comprar material de escritorio par sus estudios y un proyector de imágenes para sus exposiciones. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que estudia y trabaja.
Es por esos motivos que Estrella solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de escritorio y un proyector de imágenes para terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Estrella is a young 26 year old woman with no children, and she is studying social work at the university. She is intelligent, persevering, and very responsible. Her native language is Aymará, and she also speaks Spanish. She lives in her mother’s home along with her siblings, who are students. They live in a brick house that has all of the basic services.
She is studying social work, and she is interested in the principles of social justice, human rights, collective responsibility, and respect for cultural and ideological diversity. “My degree is a passion that sustains us, and gives meaning to our existence” she says.
In conjunction with her studies, she works selling gifts at her permanent sales stand in her free time. The advantage of her activities is that her schedules don’t conflict with each other; the disadvantage is that she doesn’t have money to purchase stationery and an audiovisual projector. Her dreams are to complete her studies, and to expand her business.
She wishes to purchase stationery for her studies, and an audiovisual projector for her exhibitions. Although she has been studying and working for six years, this is her first loan cycle with the institution. For these reasons, Estrella is requesting a loan to purchase stationery and an audiovisual projector to complete her studies.

loans.use: to purchase stationery and an audiovisual projector to complete her studies.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a 37-year-old electronic accessories dealer at Mariakani Kenya. He is a married father of two children.

This is his third loan term and he has been repaid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to purchase phone accessories such as chargers, batteries, phone covers and earphones for resale in order to make more income to support his family. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business by becoming a phone accessories supplier.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories such as chargers, batteries, phone covers and earphones for resale.

loans.name: 13 De Junio Group

texts.es:
El grupo está trabajando de manera conjunta dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando poco a poco. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Reina quien en su  encuesta mostró que está mejorando su situación de pobreza gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio que viene haciendo por medio de sus ventas de frutas. Ella es una persona muy optimista que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas de estación para poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando de esta manera por su familia.
texts.en:
The group is working together in the poverty elimination program. Each one gives their best effort to be able to improve a little. 

One of the members is Mrs. Reina, who showed in her questionnaire that she is improving her economic situation thanks to her work and sacrifice selling fruit. She is a very optimistic person who gives her all to improve.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy seasonal fruit to continue her sales. This is how she fights for her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: Don Timoteo se desempeña en actividades de agricultura y ganadería. Solicita un préstamo de dos mil cien dólares ($2,100), para la compra de un terreno en el cual espera sembrar árboles frutales. De esta manera Timoteo planea diversificar sus actividades y aumentar su ingresos.
texts.en: Don Timoteo makes a living working in agriculture and cattle. He is asking for a loan of $2,100 to buy a piece of land where he hopes to plant fruit trees. By doing this, Timoteo plans to diversify his activities and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural land.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga es una empresaria independiente de 54 años residente en un barrio de Cartagena de Indias y durante años estuvo radicada en San Jacinto un municipio de Bolívar en donde elaboran hermosas artesanías.  Como se desempeñaba como empleada doméstica, con frecuencia viajaba a Cartagena de Indias, sus amigos y conocidos le hacían encargos de artesanías, de esta manera Dominga descubrió la gran oportunidad de negocio que existía y decidió dedicarse exclusivamente a comercializar estos productos.  Ella ofrece una amplia gama de artículos para el hogar y de uso personal entre ellos hamacas, bolsos, sombreros, mecedoras y  demás, los cuales son entregados para cancelar a cómodas cuotas a sus clientes.  En la actualidad y está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en nuevo surtido de hamacas, mecedores, y adornos.  Esta inversión permitirá que Dominga continúe ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.  Su meta a futuro es crecer en su negocio y que cada día sea más próspero.
texts.en:
Dominga, 54 years old, is an independent business owner. She lives in Cartegena de Indias and has lived for several years in San Jacinto, a town in Bolivar where she makes beautiful handicrafts.  Because she worked as a domestic employee, she often travelled to Cartegend de Indias. Her friends and acquaintances asked her to bring handicrafts. This is how Dominga discovered the great business opportunities that existed and began to work exclusively in selling these products.  She offers a wide selection of items for home and personal use, such as hammocks, bags, hats, rocking chairs and more. Her customers pay her in comfortable payments. 

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan. This is the first loan that she is applying for from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She wants to invest in a new stock of hammocks, rocking chairs, and decorations. This investment will allow Dominga to continue offering wellbeing to her family.  Her future goal is to see her business grow and be more prosperous every day.

loans.use: invest in a new stock of hammocks, rocking chairs, and decorations.

loans.name: Jose Adalberto

texts.es:
José, de 72 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa que es maestra y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores. 

José, ha dedicado toda su vida a la enseñanza de educación básica, junto a su esposa se jubilaron y ahora a pesar de su avanzada edad, continúan dando clases a niños de manera particular en su casa, ellos atiende niños desde primero a y tercer grado.- Pero hoy en día José, tiene una nueva visión de comercio, junto a su esposa han pensado en colocar un negocio de venta de ropa, para mejorar sus ingresos. 

José, necesita el préstamo para iniciar con el nuevo negocio de venta de ropa, ellos comprarán fardos de ropa nueva y los pondrán a la venta en su casa; ya apartaron un espacio a la vista de las personas para poder vender la ropa y así mejorar su condición económica. 

Los planes de José, son que su negocio sea un éxito y asi poder sostenerse y mejorar las condiciones del lugar en donde imparten clases a sus alumnos.
texts.en:
Jose is 72 years old and lives with his wife who is a teacher and has three children, all of them grown. 

Jose has dedicated his entire life to teaching basic education. He and his wife retired and despite their older age, continue giving private classes to children in their home. They teach children from first to third grade. But now Jose has a new vision of business. He and his wife have planned to open a clothing sales business in order to improve their income. 

Jose needs the loan to start his new clothing sales business. They will buy bundles of new clothing and sell it from their home. They already set aside a space in view of people to be able to sell the clothing and improve their economic situation. 

Jose's plans are to make a successful business and be able to maintain and improve the conditions of the place where he gives classes to students.

loans.use: to start a new clothing sales business, they will buy bundles of new clothing to sell in their home.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, de 36 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad y su esposa es ama de casa.

Juan, se dedica a la compra y venta de granos básicos, tiene muchos años dedicándose a este negocio, pero hoy en día ha comenzado con un nuevo tipo de negocio, ella ha puesto un molino industrial para generar más ganancias. 

Juan, necesita el préstamo para comprar granos básicos para continuar con su negocio, porque invirtió en su molino y ha surgido un negocio de granos bastante bueno.

Los planes de Juan, son poder ahorrar una buena parte de dinero para poder construir su propia casa y darle a su esposa y sus hijos una vida tranquila llena de éxitos y de cosas buenas.
texts.en:
Juan, 36 years old, is married and has 2 children ages 4 and 6. His wife is a homemaker.

Juan works in the purchase and sale of basic grains, in which he has many years’ experience. Now he is beginning a new kind of business: an industrial mill to generate more income. 

Juan needs this loan to buy basic grains to continue his business, because he invested in his mill and has boosted his grain business substantially. 

Juan's plans for now are to save a large part of his money to build his own home and be able to give his wife and children a relaxed life full of success and good things.

loans.use: to buy basic grains to continue his business.

loans.name: Aiden

texts.en: Aiden is a well known, 39-year-old businessman dealing mainly in farming, especially a banana plantation in Rwamugunguru Village, Kyamuhunga, Bushenyi District. He started this project in 2005. He has managed to sustain his family of two children, who are 10 and 6 years old and in school, and one wife. He also deals in brick making as another source of income to support his family. He has borrowed a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy firewood for brick burning and fertilizers and mulches for manuring his banana plantation to increase yields and family sustainability. He is an honest man at work on his business and he works for eight hours a day. He sells to builders around Bushenyi District. He is faced with the challenge of a rainy season, which affects his business so much. His vision is to build a house for his family. Pictured is Aiden with his wife at their banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy firewood for burning bricks and fertilizers and mulches for manuring his banana plantation

loans.name: Justo Rolando

texts.es: Justo es un hombre muy trabajador, dese hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando una variedad de verduras como papa, cebolla y entre otras, gracias a esta actividad a su familia ha sacado adelante. Justo cuenta que gracias al préstamo logro comprar sus semillas de papa y abono químico por lo que su cosecha fue de mucho éxito. Justo nuevamente tiene la necesidad de un préstamo para sembrar en esta temporada unas cuerdas más de papa, el comprara semillas de papa y bono químico, orgánico. Con esta inversión el espera incrementar su cultivo y comprar más terrenos.
texts.en:
Justo is a hard-working man. For a number of years he has worked farming, growing a variety of vegetables like potatoes and onions amongst others. Thanks to this activity he has gotten his family ahead. Justo says that thanks to the loan he managed to buy potato seeds and chemical fertilizer and his harvest was very successful.

Justo once again needs a loan to plant a few cuerdas (a local land measure) more potatoes for this season. He will buy seeds and chemical and organic fertilizer. With his investment he hopes to increase his crops and buy more land.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Lilian

texts.es: Rosa de 35 años de edad, habita en casa propia en donde ha vivido toda su vida, ahí habita felizmente junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas de 4, 11 y 14 años de edad. Rosa para poder sobrevivir y sacar adelante a su familia vende pan dulce que ella con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado aprender a hornear, labor que viene realizando desde hace varios años atrás y así también con el aporte que realiza su esposo con su trabajo, de esta manera logran cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar. Él techo de la vivienda de Rosa esta deteriorado y es de vital importancia repararlo para poder estar más tranquilos y seguros por los cambios climáticos que hoy en día se están mostrando. Es por ello que Rosa solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, clavos y pago de mano de obra para mejorar el techo de su vivienda y también repuestos para vehículo con el cual realiza viajes y el cual le permite tener un ingreso más para la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa, 35 years old, lives in a house of her own where she has lived all her life. There, she lives happily with her husband and her three daughters of 4, 11, and 14 years of age. To be able to survive and get her family ahead, Rosa sells sweet bread that, with lots of effort and dedication, she has learned to bake, a task she has been carrying out for several years now. Also, with the contribution made by her husband with his work, they are thus able to cover the basic household needs.

The roof of Rosa's home is deteriorated and is of vital importance to repair it so they are able to be more relaxed and safe due to the climate changes that are appearing nowadays. That is why Rosa is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in metal sheets, wood, nails, and labor payment to improve the roof of her home, and also in spare parts for the vehicle with which she travels and which allows her to have an additional income for the household economy.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, wood, nails, and labor payment to improve the roof of her home, and also in spare parts for the vehicle with which she travels.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
The group named Biakoye is on its fifth loan cycle. It is based in the city of Accra, Teshie. Each member is striving to improve the living conditions of their families. They are into porridge, doughnuts, beans, rice and sewing services.

Hannah is one of the members. She has a small business selling porridge and doughnuts. She says that, with sacrifice, she is improving it and that her small business helps her to support her family.

She is requesting this loan so she can buy millet flour, sugar, firewood, and cooking oil to prepare porridge and doughnuts, which she will sell to her customers. She will use her profit for reinvestment, taking care of her home and improving her saving position.

loans.use: to buy millet flour, sugar, firewood, and cooking oil to prepare porridge and doughnuts, which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Pattayee And Group

texts.en:
28-year-old Pattayee works as a daily wage labourer in the construction sector as a means of earning a living. She lives with her husband and three children in the Tiruchirappalli district of Tamil Nadu. She toils to provide for her family. Her work does not pay her adequately and to add to that, it is seasonal in nature. From this she realized the need to switch to a more steady source of income. This is why she underwent training in making wire bags. Now she is confident enough to start her own business, but lacks the funds. She thus seeks a loan to kick start her business. The loan will help her start her own business, which will generate income to sustain her family. She expects to earn an additional 1,600 Rs every month.

Pattayee leads a group of five women. These women came together to apply for a group loan to start their respective wire bag making business. A loan will give these women the financial support they need and will help them contribute more to their household income. 

They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to start her wire bag making business.

loans.name: Kampala City School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Patson. He is the Director of Kampala City School, a mixed school in the urban area of Kampala with 650 students. Kampala City School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 450 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kampala City School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Patson ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Abahujumugambi-Mbugangali Group

texts.en:
Colette is 45 years old and married with six children between the ages of 9 and 18. She runs a local drink shop. Colette is the president of the ABAHUJUMUGAMBI-MBUGANGALI group, and she is the one in the photo who has papers in her hands. She has been in this business for four years and sells local drinks. She requested this loan through the Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make local drinks to sell.

Colette says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family's status. She will be able to pay school fees for her children and buy medical insurance for her family. 

In the future, she will be an wholesaler of local drinks in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of sorghum to make local drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jose Gerardo

texts.en:
Jose is 49 years old and lives in the municipality of Amaga. He has been running his business for more than 15 years since 1997, something that has allowed him to provide for his family. He raises birds and sells them later, something he learned to do thanks to his father.

There´s a lot of competition in his location so in order to overcome that he wants to invest in his business so his business can do better and can last in time. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy more chickens and food for them so his business can grow.

Jose has many dreams, but right now needs to fix some damage that his house has, so he wants to accomplish that. You can help him with his business and house with just a loan.

loans.use: buy more chickens and food for them so his business can grow.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is one of the consistent and resilient customers at Ugafode Microfinance.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,100,000 to pay tuition for her children in secondary school. Agnes' income comes from rentals and they pay monthly yet the school usually needs a block payment to avoid disrupting the students. She has educated two of her daughters and seen them out of secondary school using the Ugafode School fees loan that she acquires every term.

She is hard working, honest and repays her loans on time. She appreciates Kiva funders for being part of her children's education.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her children.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Running a business is like riding a roller coaster. Although it is fun and exciting, there will be times when you feel scared and powerless. During the bad times, there isn’t much you can do other than to keep pushing forward. This is the kind of attitude that has kept Patience’s business afloat. After her husband retired, he became unable to provide for his family as he used to do. Patience, who is 47 years old, was forced to rise to the occasion and help support her family. She started her poultry business in 2013 and does batches of 100 broilers at a time.

Patience sought to gain as much knowledge about her business as possible. To that end, she enrolled in poultry courses and went for workshops. She became so good at rearing chickens that everyone in the community preferred buying from her. Her birds were always the biggest compared to others. However, that was when her problems started as she was unable to constantly supply her customers. 

Patience approached Thrive in August 2015 after she realised that she needed help in increasing her stock. Given the burden of taking care of her family’s needs, her business was faced with the challenge of lack of capital. With a loan from Thrive, Patience hopes to increase the stock and have batches of 200 chickens every two weeks. She hopes that one day she will be able to supply at a larger scale to butcheries and grocery stores.

loans.use: to increase her flock of broilers.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is a 41-year-old woman. She lives with her husband and two children in the Martvili district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow fruits and vegetables. In addition they also have a pig.

Iamze decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 800 USD.

With the received credit Iamze will purchase a stock of clothes and start a trading business. This will give her a chance to increase her family's income and improve their living conditions.

Iamze awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes.

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX and is aged 57, this is his third loan cycle from UGAFODE MDI. He is married with four children aged 22, 28, 26 and 20. They are all in school and he has no dependents.

He engages in agriculture, mainly growing pineapples and bananas. He works for nine hours a day. He also earns salary as a priest. Lauben started this business in 2010 in Mityatzo village, Bushenyi District. He started these businesses in order to raise money to improve his lifestyle. He says he will use this loan to buy mulch and agricultural inputs and that he sells mostly to people in the Bushenyi district. His dream is to have a large banana plantation. The main challenges are pests and diseases (banana bacterial wilt) that affects his project. He is hard working.

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is farmer living in Verishen village. She lives with her husband and their three children. While being involved mostly in breeding livestock, Marine also cultivates wheat and barley. The livestock includes 25 cows, 40 calves and 245 sheep. For this huge number, Marine asks for loan to purchase forage to feed them in winter.

This is Marine's second loan. Because of financial hardships, she wasn't able to pay her first loan on time and created a bad credit history. But after years of tireless work, she has been able to find a good job and owns a farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Now, Marine has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed the livestock in winter.

loans.name: Luis Martin

texts.en:
Luis is 52 years old and lives in the municipality of San Rafael. He has two sons; one is 12 and the other is 8 years of age. They are the most important thing for this father, and the reason why he decided to start his business eight years ago. He makes food products which he sells to many people.

The cost of some of the inputs he needs to make his products are really expensive so in order to improve his sales and increase his clients, he needs to invest an important amount of money in his business. That’s why he’s asking for a loan--so he can buy some pots and tents and pay for some maintenance.

Francisco dreams of paying for his sons' education so they cangrow as good people. He’s a devoted father that wants the best for his family, and you can help him with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy some pots and tents and to pay for some maintenance.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 50 years old and lives in the municipality of Montería. He is married to a woman that he calls the love of his life, and with her has seven children, five male and two female between 22 and 13 years of age. This big family lives happily and loves each other very much. He owns a pig-raising business and wants to start making cheese so he has more profits.

He wants to improve his sales and create a new business, because he has a big family and sometimes they pass through rough times because of the lack of money. That’s why he wants to invest in his business. The reason why he’s asking for a loan is so that he can buy some pigs and buy milk to start his cheese production.

Francisco’s biggest dream is to give to his family stability and happiness, so he works hard and loves them hard. You can help Francisco and his family with just a loan.

loans.use: buy some pigs and buy milk to start his cheese production.

loans.name: Dilia Jaideith

texts.en:
Dilia is 35 years old and lives in the municipality of Montería. Ten years ago she decided to start her own business, as a consequence of some economic trouble that she and her family had. She owns a clothing-making business, something that she learned thanks to a friend who helped her.

She wants to increase her sales so she can have more profits and can give her family a better life. She expects that her business can last a long time and she works really hard to accomplish that. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some fabric, thread, and a sewing machine.

Dilia dreams of improving the conditions of her house, something that she’s been wanting for a long time. You can be part of the story of this woman's life. Help her with a loan and watch her success.

loans.use: buy some fabric, thread, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Natalie

texts.en:
Sturdy houses and buildings are made primarily of concrete blocks, also called hollow blocks. The raw materials needed in making concrete blocks are cement, sand, gravel, and water.

Natalie’s residence in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental has a wide yard that serves as manufacturing place for concrete blocks. She pays three workers to do the mixing, molding, curing or hardening, and cubing.

Since many of the residents in Natalie’s community are concretizing their houses nowadays, she is expecting a higher demand for her product. However she has no means to increase her production due to lack of capital.

She prays for PHP 40,000 additional capital to buy more bags of cement and loads of sand and gravel. Gradually, she wants to improve her business, put up a more competent manufacturing place, and help her neighbors by employing them as workers. A more stable business will ensure the college education of her four children with Glenn, her husband and business partner.

Natalie meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more bags of cement and loads of sand and gravel

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Doña Felicia tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la cual ofrece diversos productos a sus clientes. Frente a la demanda de carne de pollo en la comunidad, planea comprar pollos para la venta en su tienda de abarrotes. De esta manera podrá ampliar su negocio y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Doña Felicia has a grocery store where she offers different products to her customers.  In order to fulfill the demand for meat in her community, she plans to buy chickens to sell in her grocery store.  This will allow her to expand her business and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Ana Suzzette

texts.en:
Ana Suzzette professes that she’s a Born-Again Christian. She wants to live a peaceful life and see herself worthy in the sight of God. She tries to be honest in all undertakings including management of her business.

She runs a variety store in Talisay City, Cebu. Just like other business owners, she also experiences stiff competition and lack of capital. Besides, she has many debtors who just fled and left behind their debts. Sometimes her honesty and consideration for others doesn’t always come back to her. This faith-testing situation hampers the continuous operation of her business and consequently affects her income.

Now she is the one who needs additional capital of PHP 50,000 which she can use to buy added items for sale in her variety store such as groceries, toiletries, cases of beverages, and sacks of rice. She will also buy a water-purifying machine so she can sell purified drinking water within her community. Her profit can supplement her husband’s income and sustain their daily expenditures. They were able to support their children with the aid of her business, and now they want to continue extending help to their grandchildren.

She regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more groceries, toiletries, cases of beverages, and sacks of rice and to buy a water-purifying machine.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is a 38-year-old man. A father to three children, he lives with his family. Although he is physically challenged, that has not kept him from living his normal life although in a very difficult way since he was born in a very poor family.

He works as a manual worker at the mill and use his earnings to support his family. His wife is a petty trader at the local market dealing in fresh vegetables. United, both partners work hard to take care of their family responsibility.

He is very excited to have been among those to benefit from the Nke-Anyi Ndu-Oma loan product. A portion of this loan will help him store his products this season and also make more income to support his wife in caring for their children, especially paying their school fees.
He thanks all the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo lives at his own house. He is a married man but right now his wife is traveling and selling stuff. Cirilo is the father of one son and he works as a mason's assistant.

Little by little Cirilo is working at the construction of his house. He finished the front part, as you can see in the picture, and now he requests another loan to build a room to rent. In that way Cirilo will have more money. He hopes you can help him again.

loans.use: to build a room to rent.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 38 years old. He works as a cashier but he also wants to have his own business.

In his free time he wants to put up a photocopy business. That means he will rent a place to offer photocopy services in his neighborhood.

Cesar needs a loan to buy a photocopy machine. Cesar is single, and he doesn't have children, but he lives with his parents and he helps them with the expenses. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 47 years old and lives in the municipality of Turbo. She is a strong woman who has fought for her dreams since she was a little girl. She started her own business in 2010, a miscellaneous shop where she sells different kinds of products.

She desires to improve her sales, and she’s aware that to accomplish that she has to increase her clients with good selling strategies. She’s a very smart woman who works really hard. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy inputs like clothes, personal use products and other items.

Leonor dreams of improving the conditions of her house so it can be more beautiful and comfortable. You can support this woman with her business, so loan now.

loans.use: to buy inputs like clothes, personal use products and other items.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.
