She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.en:
Luz is 53 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. She has four children (three women and one man) who are the most important thing in her life. She joined with her partner and the father of her children. Last year she decided to start her own business. She raises chickens, something that she learned by herself.

In her location, there’s a lot of competition so it hasn’t been easy to position her business. But she works hard so she can offer the best products with the best quality so her business can be more competitive and can also last in time. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more chickens, food for them and some vaccines they need.

Luz dreams of leaving the business to her children someday so they have something that provides money for them and helps them to go further in life. You can help this devoted mother to accomplish her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy more chickens, food for them and some vaccines they need.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a well-known farmer mainly dealing in coffee farming in Rwampanga village, Kyamuhunga, Bushenyi District. He started this project in 2009 and has managed to sustain his family of four children. He has one wife. His side income is in timber trading. John was born in 1979 and his children are aged 12, 10, 7, and 5. All of them are in school. He is borrowing a loan of 2,000,000 UGX (two million shillings only) to buy trees for planting and fertilizers for manuring his coffee shamba. This will help him to increase the yields and sustain his family.

John is an honest man in his business and he works for 10 hours a day. He is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations. His vision is to build a good and big house.

loans.use: to buy trees.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is an experienced farmer who specializes in raising and selling sheep. He also cultivates corn on a field close to his farm. He traveled to Costa Rica a few years ago, where he found out about the power of biodigesters for smallholder farmers and heard from other farmers how the system has allowed them to save money while reducing their environmental footprint. Martin decided to make the same investment for his farm and purchased a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

He is looking forward to treating his sheep's manure in order to reduce bad smells, eliminate flies, and avoid contaminating water sources and the atmosphere. Further, Martin will progressively displace costly LP gas and chemical fertilizers and will become his own supplier of biogas to cook and heat water, as well as produce organic fertilizer for his field! His farm will become a cleaner, more comfortable place to live and Martin will be able to operate in a more cost-effective manner.

This loan represents 40% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to invest in a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Asención

texts.en:
Asención lives on his farm together with several generations of his family. He owns cows and sheep and cultivates tomatoes and corn on a large field close to his farm, which he then sells at the local market.

He is a busy and experienced farmer, and decided to invest in a waste-to-energy biodigester in order to reduce his operating expenses and improve his revenue. The biodigester will allow his wife to cook with biogas instead of wood, thereby eliminating the toxic smoke she and her family were inhaling on a daily basis, putting their health at risk.

The nutrient-rich organic fertilizer produced by the bacteria inside the biodigester will allow Asención to increase the yield of his tomato and corn field in a sustainable and natural way, and to sell organic and nutritious products.

This loan represents 50% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to acquire a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Parasidi

texts.en:
Parasidi is a well-known farmer mainly dealing in banana farming in the rural area of Rushoroza village, Bushenyi District. He started this project in 1999 and has managed to sustain his family of six children. He has one wife. His earns side income from being a teacher. He is 45 years old. His children are aged 19, 17, 14, 12, 10, and 4.  All of them are in school. 

Parasidi has borrowed a loan of 1,200,000 UGX (one million two hundred thousand shillings only) to buy mulch and fertilizers for manuring his banana plantation in order to increase yields and help sustain his family. He is a hard working man, working for eight hours a day. He sells to all categories of people around Bushenyi District. He is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations. His vision is to supply a lot of matooke (starchy bananas) in the Bushenyi District.

loans.use: to buy mulch and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Mujeres Kaqchiqueles Paley Group

texts.en:
In the countryside outside of the Western Highland town of Tecpan, Guatemala, eleven women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trusts Bank, Las Mujeres Kaqchiqueles de Paley. The women are married and have children, some of whom are in school. Many of the ladies have agricultural businesses and farm corn, broccoli, beans, and green beans. Others raise animals like cattle or have traditional textile businesses and embroider.

Estela, who is 28 years old and was only able to study until the ninth grade , is a member of the Trust Bank. She has two children who are 4 years old and 5 months respectively. Her husband works in the fields. Estela weaves traditional blouses called “huipiles” (pronounced “wee-pee-lays”) that are colorful and beautiful. She is requesting a loan to buy top quality thread for her textiles. She sells her “huipiles” from her home and in the local market. Her dream is to have her own weaving shop one day. Estela is very excited to be involved with Friendship Bridge and KIVA.

The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge combines microcredit with basic education on everyday topics like budgeting, marketing and sales, as well as nutrition, women’s rights and self-esteem. On average, a client of the organization has had approximately three years of formal education and cannot read nor write.

Each year, the number of clients of Friendship Bridge increases and this year, the organization serves over 22,000. There is such a great need for micro-loans and education. Kiva investors are greatly valued by these women who are eager to improve their own lives as well as those of their families. Gracias, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy top quality thread for her textiles.

loans.name: Yesmin Berena

texts.en:
Yesmin is 28 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. She is a single mother who has two little girls who she loves very much and who are her reason to live. Her life hasn’t been easy, being a single mother, but she always has found a way to provide for her family. She has owned a business selling products since 2013.

She started that business for her economic needs, but there’s a lot of competition in the market, so in order to improve her business and make it last over time, she wants to invest in it. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy a showcase and inputs like fragrances, clothes, underwear and other items.

Yesmin dreams of giving to her daughters a good quality of life so they grow up healthy and well. She also dreams of improving her house conditions. You can help Yasmin with a loan and get her so much closer to her goals.

loans.use: to buy a showcase and inputs like fragrances, clothes, underwear and other items.

loans.name: Mirta Maria

texts.en:
Mirta is 41 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. She has two daughters who she loves very much. She’s a single mother who has had to fight hard so she can provide for them, and thanks to her efforts, they have a good life. She has owned a business raising pigs since 2013, a job that has allowed her to live well.

There’s a lot of competition in her location, and that is the reason why it is hard sometimes, but she always keeps positive so she can work hard to make her business sustainable and with differential value. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy pigs, food for them and some vaccines they need.

Mirta has some damage in her house, and that is the reason why she wishes to fix it so her family can have a better quality of life. You can help Mirta to accomplish all her dreams; a loan will do a lot for her.

loans.use: to buy pigs, food for them and some vaccines they need.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina is a woman in her late 40's. She is happily married and has been blessed with three kids: the oldest is 18 years old, then comes a 13-year-old boy, and the youngest is 11 years old. All of her children attend school and rely on her.

Miguelina makes a living by working on a food truck which is owned by her and her husband. She works happily every day because this business has been providing the income that moved her family ahead.

This is a very interesting project because it is not a conventional food truck. Miguelina and her husband are pictured on the bus, which once was a public transportation bus that was driven by Miguelina's husband. It stopped being profitable because of the petrol consumption, so they both decided to take all the seats off and install some kitchen items. This way they drive to a selling destination and park the bus at the right spot and start cooking and selling food.

This idea has been providing economical support for her family for more than ten years, and today they want to invest in their business so they are looking for a 15,000 MXN loan that will allow them to refurbish the truck and buy or renew some of the kitchen items.

loans.use: to fix her food truck.

loans.name: Chmol Group

texts.en:
In the Western Highlands of Guatemala, among rivers and mountains covered with vegetation, the village of San Sebastián is located. It is part of the department of Huehuetenango with a very agreeable climate. The population here is mainly “Mam” and the ladies take great pride wearing their beautiful traditional outfits or “trajes” (pronounced “tra-hays”).

Such is the case of seven women who have joined together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chmol” which means “United”. The ladies have various businesses, including the fabrication of “huipiles” (traditional blouses) and “cortes” (traditional woven skirts), as well as the purchase and sales of vegetables and fruit. The women keep in touch with what attracts their clientele.

Glendy, at 38 years of age, is a member of the Trust Bank who was only able to go to school until the third grade. She is most pleased to be able to generate income and support her family. Glendy has a goal of a better future and educating her two children. She leaves her home on a daily basis to sell vegetables, fruit, and all kinds of beans to customers in her area. She is requesting a loan to buy various kinds of beans in bulk and various kind of vegetables to sell and increase her income. Glendy is determined to increase sales and generate more income. She wants to see her children excel in their education.

Gratitude to Kiva investors for believing that Glendy and the women in this Trust Bank can blaze a path to empower themselves and eliminate poverty. We look forward to reporting their progress on this quest!

loans.use: to buy various kinds of beans in bulk and various kind of vegetables to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: La Fe Group

texts.en:
Eight women have joined together to form the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, La Fe, meaning “The Faith," about 30 minutes by car outside the busy town of Chichicastenango, Quiche, in Guatemala.

The ladies were able to receive formal education for three to six years. They have between two and six children. The women have various small businesses, including the fabrication of traditional textiles, fruit and vegetable sales, and yet others have small convenience stores. They are really happy to be participating in the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge that combines small loans and educational training.

Eva is the 34-year-old Treasurer of the Trust Bank. She is married with four children who are in primary and high school. Eva was only able to study until the third grade. She has a convenience store where she sells all the basic necessities as well as fruit and vegetables. Seasonally, she sells avocados, apples, and plums at the wholesale level. Eva is requesting a loan, her very first one, to buy inventory for the store including sugar, rice, pasta and beans and she has budgeted additional funds to buy apples, avocados, and peaches.

As the ladies of La Fe empower themselves more and more, they move farther away from their impoverished lives where they may have made $1 or $2 each day. Being able to sustain and expand their small businesses and acquiring skills and knowledge takes these women into a whole new world. Kiva investors are important partners in this effort. Thanks to each of you!

loans.use: to buy inventory for the store including sugar, rice, pasta, and beans, and she has budgeted additional funds to buy apples, avocados, and peaches.

loans.name: Nerly Luz

texts.en:
Nerly is 41 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. She is married to a husband she loves and who supports her. They have three children - two girls and one boy. She loves her beautiful family and works hard to give them a good quality of life. She has owned a clothing business since 2010.

Nerly took classes so she can learn and be more professional in her job since the quality of the clothes she makes is very important. She expects that her business can last over time to keep providing for her family. She asked for a loan to buy some fabric, buttons, thread and a sewing machine.

Nerly has big dreams, but her biggest one is to have a successful business that she can leave to her children one day, and for them to keep improving it and make it a family tradition. You can help Nerly to achieve all her goals with just a loan.

loans.use: buy some fabric, buttons, thread and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Francisco Jeronimo

texts.en:
Francisco is 67 years old and lives in the municipality of Monteria. He inherited a business from his family a long time ago; he has owned a cabinetmaking business since 1985. That means he’s been working for around 30 years, so he’s an expert in his job.

He wants to improve his sales but he lacks capital to invest in his business so he can accomplish that, and for him it is very important to make his business sustainable. He found out about Kiva and Interactuar and decided to apply for a loan so he can buy wood, paint, and inputs.

He dreams of improving his house because its conditions aren´t the best. You can help Francisco to achieve all his goals, and a loan will get him so much closer.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, and inputs.

loans.name: Gloria Estela

texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old and lives in Medellín. Some years ago, she became a widow, so now she’s raising her three children alone. Although it was a hard time and hasn’t been easy for her, she’s a strong woman, determined to triumph and to give to her children the best life she can.

She´s a great cook, but has never done anything professionally with that talent, and now she’s thinking of starting her own business, but first she wants to study so she has more knowledge about it. She´s asking for a loan so she can start studying traditional baking.

Gloria needs a little help to start making her dreams come true. You can loan and let her be closer to accomplishing all her goals.

loans.use: to start studying traditional baking.

loans.name: Samuel Orlando

texts.en:
Samuel is a 30-year-old married man who lives in the municipality of Bello. With his wife, he has a daughter who is 10 years old, and she’s the motor of his life. Since 2012, he inherited a farm from his family where he grows different kinds of products. He also raises cattle, which is something that he learned from his father.

In order to give to his family a good quality of life and provide better for them, Samuel wants to increase his clients so his profits can also increase. He’s aware that if he wants to accomplish that, he has to invest in his business. This is the reason why he’s asking for a loan, so he can buy fertilizers for the land, and a cow.

Samuel has big dreams, and it’s to give to his family a house to live in, where they can feel protected. You can help Samuel to accomplish all his dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: buy fertilizers for the land, and a cow.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank comes from Buhanda. He is 25 years old and married with two kids.

He owns a retail shop and is also a coffee trader. He is taking a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy produce since it is the season and this acts as his source of income.

The challenge is that he has to travel a long distance for shopping, thus using a lot of transport

loans.use: to purchase more coffee beans to process and sell.

loans.name: Grupo Suqun No.2 Group

texts.es:
Lucia es una mujer de 43 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 8 y 17 años. Esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Lucia (la que se ubica de primero en el lado izquierdo de la foto) con el deseo de obtener sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, este negocio se ubica  en el mercado de su comunidad, lleva ocho años de realizarlo, su esposo se dedica a la venta de frutas por la calles de san adres.
Lucia por ser una mujer muy positiva y con grandes propósitos en la vida, es la representante del grupo denominado grupo Suqun No.2, con afán de ofrecerles a sus clientes mejores productos de ropa típica solicita un préstamo para la compra de fajas, cortes y güipiles para su respectiva venta.
Su gran sueño es conseguir este crédito pero también realizar la remodelación de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucia is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family of six children between the ages of 8 and 17. This dear family lives in a community of San Andrés Semetabaj.

Lucia (located first on the left in the photo), with the desire to obtain income and improve her living conditions, works buying and selling traditional clothing. This business is located in the market in her community. She has done it for eight years. Her husband works selling fruit on the streets of San Andrés.

Lucia, being a very positive woman with big goals in life, is the representative of the group named group Suqun No. 2. With eagerness to offer her customers the best products of traditional clothing, she requests a loan to buy belts, skirts, and blouses for their respective sale.

Her great dream is to get this loan, but also to carry out a home remodel.

loans.use: to buy belts, skirts, and blouses for their respective sale.

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor lives in Hartashen village in the Syunik region. He lives with his wife and two kids. Gor runs a farm, focusing mainly in cattle breeding. He currently keeps four cows, 12 calves and two sows. 

Gor would greatly like to receive the opportunity to sustain his farm. The reason he has applied for this loan is to purchase forage to feed the cattle in the winter. 

This is Gor's second loan. Because of financial hardships, he wasn't able to pay his first loan on time and created a bad credit history. But after years of tireless work, he has been able to find a good job and owns a farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Now Gor has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed the cattle in the winter.

loans.name: Virginia Isabel

texts.en:
Virginia is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in the municipality of Bello. She has two children whom she loves very much and helps her dream big, so she wants to give them the best life she can. She loves cooking and has a great talent doing it, but now wants to go further.

She wants to study traditional baking in order to start her own business, so can provide for her family. The issue she has is that she doesn’t have the money to start studying so she’s asking for a loan.

You can be part of this story and help Virginia accomplish all of her dreams. Support her with this loan and see how she starts her successful career.

loans.use: to start her studies in traditional baking in order to start her own business.

loans.name: Jairo Alberto

texts.en:
Jairo is 25 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello. He has a little daughter who is only four years old. Jairo considers her the best gift that life has given to him, so he feels very happy. Since last year, he has owned a business raising animals, which he inherited from his family and that he learned about from his mother.

In order to improve his business, Jairo wants to invest in it so his sales can improve, and so he can make it bigger and more successful. Right now, he doesn’t have the money to do that, so he’s asking for a loan to buy steer, make the barn adequate, and buy food for the animals.

Jairo has had a big dream for many years, and it’s to buy a house where he can live with his family comfortably and safely, and where they can have a good quality of life. You can be part of this story, and a loan will help him a lot.

loans.use: to buy steer, make the barn adequate, and buy food for the animals.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Having been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since 1995, Mamerta now has learned and developed a lot from her entrepreneurial skills. In fact, she has already entered into different kinds of businesses since then and is now operating a sari-sari store, which was previously improved through a granted loan from Kiva. With this, she is very thankful. 

To further enhance her inventory, she wants to again request a loan that would be used to increase the volume of her merchandise. This would really help to increase her profits, which will help a lot in providing for their basic necessities at home. 

She needs a $450 loan to realize this and she trusts that you’ll reach your helping hands to her. Someday, Mamerta aspires to get a better housea for their family where they can live peacefully and harmoniously. 

She regularly meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to increase the volume of her merchandise.

loans.name: Aida Patricia

texts.en:
Aida is 38 years old and lives in the municipality of Momil. She has three children - two sons and one daughter. They are the reason she wakes up every day to work and provide for her family. Since 2007, Aida has owned a store, and it was something she started because she loves the job and sharing it with people.

The most important thing for Aida is to make her business last over time. It is the best way to have insurance for her family, so in the future, they have something that will allow them to survive. She wants to improve her business, so she’s asking for a loan to buy a shelf and a refrigerator to keep some products.

Aida is building a successful business not only to provide for her family, but to teach her children how to manage a business and work hard for their dreams. She wants to leave the business to them some day. Help Aida to accomplish all her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy a shelf and a refrigerator to keep some products.

loans.name: Noris Inelsa

texts.es: Noris es una ama de casa que reside en Arjona un municipio de Bolívar y durante varios años, sus vecinos y transeúntes han degustado de deliciosos bolis de frutas y postres que esta entusiasta mujer elabora.  Ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio en su vivienda es por ello que aprovecho la capacidad de su refrigerador e incluso también vende hielo para que sus vecinas puedan enfriar sus bebidas, con esta actividad sus ingresos familiares se han incrementado y ha podido ofrecer bienestar a su familia; ella es madre de cinco hijos y su cónyuge la apoya en sus ideas.  En la actualidad cuenta con cinco años de funcionamiento y está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en materias primas para la elaboración de postres y bolis, así mismo incluirá nuevas golosinas para la demanda de estudiantes en el sector. Con esta inversión sus ventas serán mucho más altas y su meta de tener un negocio de repostería estaría más cerca de convertirse en realidad.
texts.en:
Noris is a housewife who lives in Arjona, a municipality of Bolivar. For several years, her neighbors and the passersby have enjoyed the delicious fruit ice cream treats and desserts that this woman elaborates. She decided to start her own business in her house. This is why she took advantage of the capacity of her refrigerator and also sells ice so that her neighbors can chill their drinks.
With this occupation her family income has increased, and she has been able to offer well-being to her family. She is the mother of five children, and her partner supports her with her ideas. She has had the business working for five years, and she is applying for a credikiva, the first loan that she makes with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will invest in raw materials for the elaboration of desserts and ice cream treats, and she will also sell new candies to meet the demand of students in the area.
With this investment, her sales will be much higher, and her goal of having a confectionery is closer to becoming a reality.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials for the elaboration of desserts and ice cream treats, and she will also sell new candies.

loans.name: Rosa Leticia

texts.es: Rosa de 56 años de edad vive con su hija el esposo de esta y sus tres nietos los cuales ninguno depende de ella. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que a pesar de las circunstancias siempre ha mostrado un espíritu emprendedor para tener lo necesario para comer y vivir establemente ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frijoles, maíz, aceite, chicharrón, quesillo, tomate, repollo, vinagre, loroco para la elaboración de pupusas y antojitos en su negocio pues es con esta actividad que ella se gana la vida honradamente por la calidad de sus productos las personas la prefieren ella espera una pronta respuesta a su crédito para invertir en su negocio de inmediato.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 56, lives with her daughter, her daughter’s husband, and her three grandchildren, none of whom are her dependents. She is a very hard working woman who, despite her circumstances, has always demonstrated an enterprising spirit in order to have what she needs to eat and live stably.

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in beans, corn, oil, pork rinds, soft cheese, tomato, cabbage, vinegar, and loroco (a vine with edible flowers) for making pupusas and other small plates in her business, for it is through this activity that she honorably earns a living. Due to the quality of her products, people prefer her. She is hoping for a prompt response to her loan, in order to invest in her business immediately.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, oil, pork rinds, soft cheese, tomato, cabbage, vinegar, and loroco, for making pupusas in her business.

loans.name: Debora Rosalia

texts.es: Debora de 38 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 21, 14 y 10 años de edad su vivienda es propia sus hijos el motivo por el cual ella y su esposo día con día trabajan duro por darles el alimento diario y darles educación. Ella se dedica a la venta de pan francés por las mañanas y por la tardes ella coloca su venta ella compra el pan y lo revende afuera de su casa es ahí donde ella coloca su venta ella ya tiene clientes específicos quienes la prefieren y a veces no logra abastecer sus ventas por que su producto no le alcanza es por eso que ella solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pan francés  y así vender más, con esto generar más ganancias y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Debora, age 38, lives with her husband and her three children, ages 21, 14, and 10. She owns her house. Her children are the reason why she and her husband work hard day after day, in order to give them their daily food, and to give them education.

She works selling French bread. Morning and afternoon, she sets up her sales stall. She buys bread and resells it. She sets up her sales stall outside her home. She already has specific clients who prefer her, and sometimes she is unable to provide sales because she doesn’t have enough product. It is for this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, to buy French bread and thereby sell more. This way, she will generate more profits and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy French bread for her business.

loans.name: Vilma Arcadia

texts.es:
Vilma, de 62 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, esos oficios se los enseñaron sus padres.- 

Vilma, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura durante la mañana en las parcelas que alquila y en la tarde cuida las vacas y las ordeña para ir a vender la leche a sus vecinos y en los alrededores.

Vilma, necesita el préstamo para comprar otra vaca, que le vende un hermano, esto le ayudara a incrementar la producción de leche y a incrementar sus ingresos.

Vilma, sueña con comprar más animales y empezar a elaborar lácteos que venderá en su lugar de residencia y en los alrededores.
texts.en:
Vilma, age 62, went to school up to sixth grade. She works in agriculture and cattle raising. Her parents taught her these trades.

Vilma works in agriculture in the morning on the parcels of land that she rents. In the afternoon, she cares for her cows and milks them to go sell milk to her neighbors and in the surrounding area.

Vilma needs the loan to buy another cow, which her brother is selling her. This will help her increase her milk production and increase her income.

Vilma dreams of buying more animals and starting to prepare dairy products, which she will sell in her place of residence and in surrounding areas.

loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre “Mujeres Luchadoras”, ya que eso es lo que ellas son, mujeres luchadoras que quieren mejorar sus vidas y la de sus seres queridos. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ponen su mayor predisposición para poder crecer y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, ella vende comidas, las prepara todos los días desde muy temprano, después las vende por su barrio. Ha ido adquiriendo cada vez más clientela ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y gustan mucho a sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser: carne, verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y otros. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder mejorar su emprendimiento para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is named “Mujeres Luchadoras” (Determined Women) because that is exactly what they are. The members are women who are determined to improve their lives and those of their loved ones. They are participating in the poverty elimination program and have a great willingness to grow and improve.

One of the members is Sra. Maria, who is striving to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. She sells food that she prepares herself. Every day she begins her work in the early morning hours and then goes out into her neighborhood to sell. Each day she acquires more customers because her food is quite delicious and her customers greatly enjoy it.

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of supplies for preparing her dishes such as meat, greens, condiments, vegetables, and other items. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can improve her business and be able to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, greens, condiments, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells soda, sweets, toothpaste and other items. Her primary customers are loyal.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of soda, sweets, toothpaste and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soda, sweets, toothpaste and other items.

loans.name: Dionafe

texts.en:
Because of your heartfelt support, lenders, Dionafe’s business now is gradually paving its way to expansion, as she was given a chance previously to have a loan. This helped her buy additional stock of merchandise products for her sari-sari (variety) store, and thus, enabled her to increase her profit and customers as well.

She wants to continue this good track, so she is requesting again your help. She would like to borrow 50,000 PHP and utilize this to purchase more products to sell for her inventory like condiments, toiletries, beverages and the like.

Soon, she is hoping to expand her business so she could earn enough and establish a better life for her family. She has always wanted to make her children finish their schooling. But as of now, this dream relies on whatever her business career will come up to. So help now Dionafe actualize her dreams. Your small amount of help could mean a greater cause.

She regularly meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to resell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
For the last two years, Divina has raised hogs to support the daily needs of her family. She is married with six children. Her oldest child is 10 and still attending school.

Her husband is a fisherman. She lives in Tolosa, Leyte.

She needs additional funds to finance her current livelihood. Divina would like to expand her hog raising by first increasing the number of pigs she is about to raise. Second, she should have adequate supply of feeds and supplements to have high quality pigs.

She has requested a loan to purchase feeds and piglets. With these, she could be able to improve her source of income and slowly settle her obligations.

In the future, she is determined to give her best to continue to handle the piggery business to continue support the education of her children in preparation for what tomorrow may bring.

loans.use: to  purchase feeds and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy peanuts, sugar and more items from Tupperware.

loans.name: Javier Erick

texts.es:
Javier es un joven hombre de 21 años, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia ingeniería de sistemas. 
Él es inteligente, perseverante y muy estudioso. Sus estudios los realiza en una universidad en la zona central, caracterizada por acoger a la mayoría de oficinas públicas como privadas. 
Javier es moreno de cabello corto y baja estatura. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la comparte con su tío que trabaja, viven en una casa familiar construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Él estudia ingeniería en sistemas y se encuentra en 2 año de 5 que dura toda la carrera, “me gusta mucho la programación y sueño con desarrollar software…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios él administra un coche que trabaja como transporte público. La ventaja de sus actividades es que ambas son independientes, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para el pago de las cuotas de su universidad. Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y desarrollar software, el desea pagar las cuotas de su universidad por adelantado para obtener un descuento, esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que estudia y trabaja.
Es por esos motivos que Javier solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su universidad y obtener un descuento.
texts.en:
Javier is a young man of 21 years of age, single, has no children and studies systems engineering.

He is intelligent, persevering, and very studious. He studies at a university in the central area, known for hosting the majority of public and private offices.

Javier is dark skinned and short in stature with short hair. His mother tongue is Aymará and he speaks Spanish. He lives with his uncle who also works. They live in the home of a family member built out of bricks and have all of the basic services. He studies systems engineering and is in his 2nd of a 5 year long degree. He notes “I really like programming and dream of developing software.”

Along with his studies, he administers a car that works as public transport. The advantage to his activities is that both are independent. The disadvantage is the lack of money to pay his university costs. His dream is to finish his education and to develop software. He wishes to pay his university tuition in advance in order to obtain a discount. This is his first sequence of loans with the institution in the 2 years that he has been studying and working.

It is for these reasons that Javier is requesting a loan to pay university costs and to obtain a discount.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition and to obtain a discount.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
From Guimbal Iloilo, Jesus has been an active member of CCT for years now, and he was able to acquire several loans to make good profit from his business. He solely provides for himself so he works hard each day to support his daily needs and business expenses.

Jesus owns a variety store, and drives his tricycle once in a while to add to his income. He believes that managing his own business will help him focus on improving his life rather than thinking about the challenges he is currently facing. Jesus has some health issues like arthritis and kidney problems, but his circumstance haven't broken the strong-willed man in him. He is determined to make good use of his time as he wants to serve his neighbors by supplying more items needed in his shop. He also plans to start up his projects for fishing and farming businesses. He knows this will make a great impact not only on his life but likewise on the community where he lives.

Jesus lacks enough capital to make this happen so he is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan which he will use for the said purpose. He is positive that he will become a successful businessman in the future and he looks forward to seeing his businesses prosper.

Jesus meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and products needed in his variety store, and to start his fishing and farming projects.

loans.name: Sunday's Group

texts.en:
Sunday is 37 years old and a father of 3.

He is a commercial motorcycle rider, which is a very risky means of livelihood, and he has a big extended family to care for.

He is very excited about this project, considering the fact that many farmers in his village, including him, will be lifted out of poverty by this lending initiative.

With this loan, Sunday hopes to store more palm oil this season in order to increase his income. This will help him to meet his family responsibilities, especially that of paying school fees and feeding his family.

Sunday and his group members thank all those who lovingly contribute to their loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products

loans.name: Rukmani

texts.en:
Rukmani is a 45-year-old lady from Sainbu Bhaisepati, Nepal. She has 3 daughters.

She works hard in different fields, but this loan will be used for poultry farming, and especially for buying chickens. She works out in the field also. She works 8 hours a day and 7 days a week to support her family and to maintain a good financial situation for them.

She sends thanks for the support provided by Kiva and to those who lend to her.

loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 35 years old and he lives with his big family in Ijevan city of the Tavush region. He lives with his wife, two school-aged children and his mother.

Samvel works at one of the military units in the Tavush region as a cook, and simultaneously he does farming and agriculture. He is specialized in swine breeding, and he has a lot of pigs and piglets. He also cultivates a lot potatoes and beans on his plot of land. Samvel’s young wife greatly helps him in all his farming activities. They sell their farm products of meat, piglet, potatoes, beans and apples to re-sellers and also to butchers.

Samvel would like to develop his swine breeding more, and that is why he is asking for this loan. He wants to buy several piglets and also a lot of fodder for all his pigs.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and also a lot of fodder for all his pigs

loans.name: Adishetu

texts.en: Adishetu is 20 years old and lives with her father and siblings in the Yendi district. She sells dried fish and cultivates soya beans in her village 31km from the district capital. She is requesting a loan in order to buy dried fish in bulk to reduce the time spent traveling on a borrowed bicycle to replace her dried fish stock. She plans to use the profit she earns to buy her own bicycle and save for her school fees. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, helping local high-school students find their own strengths and leads discussion groups about how they can create a better world. Adishetu's dream is to become a teacher in her community and serve as a role model as she is the only female high school graduate in her community.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish in bulk

loans.name: Warihanatu

texts.en: Warihanatu is 22 years old and lives with her father and siblings in the Yendi district. She sells adult and baby’s clothing and is requesting a loan in order to revive her business after her capital was stolen on her way to buy more goods to sell. She plans to use the profit she earns to pay her school fees when she secures admission into the teacher training college. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students at her local high school. She covers topics such as active citizenship and personal confidence. Warihanatu's dream is to become a professional teacher to build on the passion and skills she acquired as a Learner Guide.

loans.use: To purchase Adult and Baby's clothing

loans.name: Jemilatu

texts.en: Jemilatu is 20 years old and lives with her uncle and siblings in the Chereponi District. She sells men’s and women’s  footwear and is requesting a loan in order to buy her products in bulk from the southern part of the country where they are a lot cheaper, allowing her to increase her profits. She plans to use the profit she earns to expand her business to include cosmetics and other products. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students in the nearby high school. She focuses on effective communication and on building her students’ confidence.  Jemilatu's dream is to become a midwife to help reduce maternal and infant mortality rate in her district.

loans.use: to buy more footwear in the southern part of Ghana where it is a lot cheaper

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 23 years old and lives with her aunt and siblings in the Yendi district. She sells a variety of shoes and clothing and is requesting a loan in order to buy her products in bulk which will increase her profit margin. She plans to use the profit she earns to support her family's daily needs. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions for students at her local high school. She covers topics such as active citizenship and personal confidence. Amina's dream is to become a nurse in order to save lives in her community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing and shoes in bulk

loans.name: Zuleatu

texts.en: Zuleatu is 20 years old and lives in the Chereponi district. She sells a variety of cosmetics, soaps and detergents and is requesting a loan in order to complete the construction of her new shop, allowing her to conduct business in a permanent location. She plans to use the profit she earns to increase the variety of products and stock in her shop. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, helping local high-school students find their own strengths and leads discussion groups about how they can create a better world. Zuleatu's dream is to become a professional French teacher in her district.

loans.use: To complete construction of her new shop to conduct business in a permanent location

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 48 years old and she lives with her husband, two children and father-in-law in the frontier village of Kirants in the Tavush region.

Naira has a higher pedagogical education and she has been working as a teacher for 25 years at the village school.

Simultaneously she is engaged in farming and agriculture. On her farm she has cows, pigs and chickens. On her plot of land she cultivates potatoes, beans, tomatoes, greens and onions. Her fruit garden is full of tasty harvests of apple, fig, pear, peach and persimmon. All her farm produce of milk, meat, eggs, vegetables and fruits, she sells right from her house to her regular customers.

Naira is now asking for this Kiva loan to an amount of 600,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to buy more piglets, and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is 61 years old and she lives with her husband and son in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Ruzanna’s husband is a builder and her son works as a distributor. This woman has a higher pedagogical education. Now she does not work at her profession but for 30 years  already she has worked as a librarian. Now she works at the Vanadzor State University’s library as a head of the library. Ruzanna mentions that she is happy in her work now despite having another profession. She mentions that every day being surrounded with a lot of books in different genres and periods, she never stops reading and with each book she continues to reveal something new. The same enthusiasm Ruzanna tries to pass to any student that visits the library any time emphasizing the importance of being careful and accurate with each book. This loan Ruzanna asks for as her computer has broken down. It usually helps her to find any innovation in the world of literature, so with her Kiva loan amount she wants to buy a new computer.

loans.use: to buy a new computer in order to find any new innovations in the world of literature

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 27 years old and this young lady lives with her mother and brother in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. She has a higher pedagogical education and she has a specialty as a physiologist and also is a specialist in English Language and Literature. Now Anna is employed but she does not work at her profession. At a private company, she works as an accountant. Simultaneously at her house, she gives paid private courses in English Language and Literature. Anna’s mother works as a saleswoman and her brother works at a private company. Anna greatly wants to work in her profession, as she likes it very much and she wants to get prepared for that work very properly, and learn all the innovations that are in pedagogical methodology now. With this purpose, she asks for this Kiva loan in order to buy a computer and take part in training courses (the courses are paid) in pedagogical methodology, which are organized especially for the young beginner teachers.

loans.use: to buy a computer and take part in training courses (the courses are paid) in pedagogical methodology.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is a resident of Intramuros City, Philippines. She has five loving children and has been managing a food vending business for five years now where she sells frozen foods. She’s now starting to save money earned in the business for her family. She’s grateful that there is the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) who are continually molding new entrepreneurs on how to come up with marketing strategies to make the business grow.

Melissa knows that they can survive on a daily basis as God is their greatest provider. Though in a business, there are challenges that can’t be avoided like delay of payments from customers, which affects the business’ revenue. She prays that she’ll have a revolving fund and added capital as well to buy necessities for her buy and sell business like sausages, hotdogs and bacon or tocino in Spanish. For this, Melissa applied for a loan of PHP 10,000. She believes that this will be the start of her dream to come true, as she wants her business to have visible progress someday.

Melissa believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from member’s life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy products for her buy and sell business like sausages, hotdogs and bacon or tocino in Spanish.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina owns a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. This has been her livelihood for eleven years now.

Josefina is asking for a loan to increase her inventory of coffee, shampoo, chips, candies, candles, insect repellent, detergent and seasoning. Josefina’s goal is to make her store look full so she can compete with other businesses in the area. She also aims to increase her customers by improving her store.

Her income will be for healthy meals, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, shampoo, chips, candies, candles, insect repellent, detergent and seasoning.

loans.name: Artavazd

texts.en: Artavad is 62 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He lives with his wife (she is unemployed). Their two children are already married and they live with their families. Artavazd graduated from State Polytechnic Institute in Vanadzor city with a specialty in architecture. For many years until today, this man has worked in his specialty and he is a very famous and skilled master of in his work. Artavazd greatly needs this deal and Kiva loan amount; this loan of 150,000 Armenian drams he asks in order to solve his health problems that now cause him great discomfort and disturb to work as usual.

loans.use: to solve his health problems

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Fifty-eight-year-old Amelita runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like coffee, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, vinegar, shampoo, tooth paste, biscuits, candies and assorted drinks. She lives in the town of Tolosa, Leyte. She has been running a sari-sari store for three years now.

Amelita has requested a loan to buy supplies like condiments, noodles, chips, assorted canned goods and soft drinks. These are tools that could help sustain her source of living. It could boost her earnings by attracting more buyers to come and purchase goods that are vital to the customers' needs. Thus, she could now handle her earnings wisely and start to expand to become productive.


She is hoping that someday she will become sustainable by investing in other sources of income to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy supplies like condiments, noodles, chips, assorted canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es estudiante de la carrera de  Licenciatura en Nutrición ella vive con sus padres en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, trabaja en una empresa en la parte de venta  su objetivo es trabajar  en lo que va ser su profesión y de esta manera seguir ayudando a sus padres.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de su tesis, y de esta forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a student who is working toward a degree in Nutrition. She lives with her parents in the city of San Lorenzo. Rosa also works in the sales department for a company. Her goal is to work in her desired profession and be able to continue helping her parents.

Rosa is requesting this loan so that she can pay her thesis expenses. This will allow her to continue her studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay her thesis expenses.

loans.name: Ecolastica Marta

texts.es: Ecolastica de 63 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora y con deseos de superación por tal motivo desde hace 18 años se decidió para poner el negocio de pupusería y comedor, así como una pequeña tienda de artículos de primera necesidad en su hogar el cual ha sido su fuente de ingresos para mantener la economía de su hogar. Ella habita en vivienda propia en compañía con su esposo y juntos se dedican a atender los negocios. Ecolastica desea aumentar sus ingresos por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, frijoles, queso, loroco, chicharrón y más artículos de primera necesidad para surtir la tienda y de esa manera ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ecolastica, age 63, is an enterprising woman who has the drive to succeed. Eighteen years ago, she decided to open a “pupusa” (stuffed tortilla) shop and diner. In addition, she started a small store where she sells basic household necessities. These have become her sources of income by which she is able to maintain her household finances. Ecolastica resides in her own home along with her husband. Together they are able to manage these businesses.

She wants to increase her earnings, so Ecolastica is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in corn, beans, cheese, “loroco” (edible buds and flowers), pork rinds, and other basic goods for restocking her store. This will allow her to offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cheese, “loroco”, pork rinds, and other basic goods for her store.

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
Ederlina lives in Bien Unido with her family. She is married to a fisherman and they have four children together. For twenty-four years, she has been helping him in their fishing business to earn a living.

Since most nights her husband fishes, she also prepares what he needs during daytime. She is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy a new fishing net and boat engine. A part of the loan will also be used to pay for tuition fees. These will assure her that their boat will not encounter delays in their fishing activity and the children can go to school.

Ederlina, as a mother, only wishes that her children ages 17 and 19 can finish their college education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, a boat engine and pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina is a 55-year old married woman having three grown children. For almost 10 years, she has raised and sold hogs. These serve as the family's main source of income.

She lives in Tolosa, Leyte. She would like to boost her livelihood and would like to avail herself of the funds to support her existing source of income.

She is asking for a loan to buy pigs and pig supplements. These will help improve her livelihood and enable her to produce high quality hogs. With these, her income will improve.

Silvina would be able to start to pay her obligations and start to expand her livelihood. She could also set aside some of the savings for emergency use.

In the future she is looking forward to becoming more sustainable and having better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig supplements.

loans.name: Exequila

texts.en:
Life is not easy for Exequila, a 50-year-old woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married to a carpenter. With six children, she has been struggling to meet ends for the family. Fortunately now, among her six children, only the remaining two aged 7 and 18 need her support.

She is raising hogs to help her husband. She is asking for a loan to buy feed for her piglets. She is confident of what quality feed can do to her hogs after four years.

Her income will help her pay for her children’s school fees and save for reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en: Hovhannes is 39 years old and he lives in Tsovagyugh village in the Gegharkunik region. He lives in a nice house built by him with his nice wife and three pretty daughters. Hovhannes is a farmer and with only the farming he manages to cover his family’s every day needs. On his farm, he has cows, calves, bulls, pigs and sheep. With the help of his wife, Hovhannes organizes his farm products such as milk, meat, macun (national dairy-product) and cheese. He mentions that he would like to enlarge the number of his farm cattle, which would mean more income for his family and better living conditions for his children. This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams Hovhaness wants to use for the purchase of two more calves for his farm and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves for his farm and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en: In Tsovagyugh village in the Gegharkunik region with his parents lives this young farmer. Arman is 26 years old and with great help and the precious advice of his father, runs a farm. On his farm, Arman has cows, a calf, a heifer, a pig and chickens. Arman also has a plot of land on which he cultivates potatoes and tomatoes. All his farm products (milk, meat, cheese, eggs, potatoes and tomatoes), Arman takes to the city’s wholesale market and sells there to his regular customers and to re-sellers. Now Arman, with this Kiva loan, greatly wants to make his farm richer with cattle and he plans to buy a cow and also fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy a cow and also fodder for his farm animals in order to make his farm richer with cattle

loans.name: Nenad

texts.en: Nenad is married and has four children. He is from a minority community in a small village. In order to address his family's needs, he has started to plant vegetables for his family to eat and to sell to others in the area. He also has land where he plants wheat and corn and works hard with his business in addition to his regular job as a police officer. At this time, he is in need of a loan to purchase agricultural machinery for working on the land. Until now, he has paid someone else to do this part of the workload, but has now decided to save more money and complete the work himself. He also believes he will be able to work on other's land for a fee as well. He hopes that this will help him to be able to improve the living conditions of his family. He thanks all of the Kiva lenders for the support.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural machinery for working on the land

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru: Опытная рукодельница из города Худжанд, Муаззам. Ей 34 года. Муаззам имеет двоих детей, и она в городе живет вместе с матерью и детьми. Муаззам разведена с мужем, и давно она одна воспитывает своих  детей. Муаззам занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она более 5 лет продвигает свою любимую работу. Ей нравится сидя дома зарабатывать на жизнь, и просто обожает сшить. Муаззам добрая, талантливая и честная женщина. Она решила приобрести больше ткани и швейные принадлежности для расширения бизнеса. Потому что доход от швеи обеспечить ее семью. Муаззам по той причине обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется, что ей помогут  финансам.
texts.en:
Muazzam is an experienced seamstress from Khujand. She has 2 children, and she lives in the city with her mother and children. Muazzam is divorced from her husband, and she has been raising her children alone for a long time.

Muazzam sews women's clothing. She has been advancing in her chosen work for more than 5 years. She likes to earn her living at home, and simply adores sewing.

Muazzam is a kind, talented, and honest woman. She has decided to get more fabric and sewing supplies to expand her business because her income from sewing supports her family. For this reason, Muazzam has applied for a loan. She hopes to be helped with her finances.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Fuente De Vida Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal FUENTE DE VIDA.
La socia Maruja tiene 59 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the Communal Bank “Fuente de Vida” (Source of Life). She is 59 years old, separated from her spouse, and has three children. Maruja divides her time between her daily activities and managing her grocery store. She has been in this business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Maruja is a responsible and diligent individual who wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, milk, and other products.

The members of the Communal Bank appreciate the loan that has been issued and promise to complete their payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Her name is Jocelyn, a hardworking woman from Buhangin, Davao City who raises two children with her husband Archie, a taxi driver. Since her husband’s income is unstable and it usually cannot suffice for their everyday expenses and children’s education, Jocelyn decided to embark on direct selling of home and personal care products. She chose this business because it typically requires low capital to begin with. Then she enhances it by expanding her network of target consumers. Not only this, she started to build a pigpen just recently because she has a plan to buy piglets that she can raise very soon. She tries her best to enhance her family’s financial resources in order to support the needs of her children and push through their college education until its completion.

Now Jocelyn aspires to improve her business with the aid of additional capital amounting to PHP 18,000. She will use it to buy more personal and home care products that she can sell to her friends, neighbors and other network. She will also start her hog-raising venture with one to two piglets and a few sacks of feed. She’s positive that this additional capital will boost her income and savings.

Her dream is to have a stable business so she can buy a four-wheel vehicle someday. She also desires a good future for her children and harmonious relationship among her family. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more personal and home care products

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
For more than 20 years, Evangeline runs an eatery. She sold home meals like  stewed vegetables, soup (fish or pork), and adobo(meat is often marinated in a seasoning mixture known as adobo, which is made from lemon, garlic, pepper, salt, and other spices).
She is a married  with three children. Her youngest child is 19, and still attending school.

She would like to expand her livelihood by providing quality food and service to the neighbors and the dwellers in her community.  
With the loan of 20,000 PHP she could buy  variety of ingredients like fish, chicken, vegetables, spices and meat. 

She is determined that she could make it successful in the years to come to continue support the needs of her family and having a stable source of income as well.

loans.use: to buy variety of ingredients like fish, chicken, vegetables, spices and meat

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is a hard-working woman. She is from San Miguel, Bohol. She is 48 years old with three grown children.

Dorotea has been selling vegetables for twenty years now. She sells onions, peanuts, squash, string beans,. She also sells sachets of vinegar, soy sauce and seasoning.

Dorotea is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of squash, peanuts, onions and garlic. She is excited because it will contribute to better sales, thus enable her to buy healthy food for herself and her husband.

In the future, she hope to buy a car that she can also use for business.

loans.use: to buy squash, peanuts, onions and garlic.

loans.name: Rosinah

texts.en:
Rosinah is 57 years old married with seven children. She lives in a rural community outside Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She buys and sells fish in her community or at the market to earn living and has been doing this for one year.

Rosinah needs a loan to buy more fresh fish and large cooler to help assist her run the fish business. She plan to use her profit improve her business and also help cover's for her family's weekly expenses.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: A loan of $8100 helps Rosinah buy fresh fish and a large cooler for her fishing business.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace 38 years old and a mother of 4 children, a single parent. She works as a teacher in the village primary school, she has a very busy week but to compliment her very poor salary she spends her weekends at the mill. As a single parent it is not easy for her to support her family, but with the palm oil business, Grace earns additional income. Her colleague recommended her to join Nke Anyi Farmer Multipurpose Cooperative Society early this year so as to access funds to support her business. She hopes that this loan will help her to purchase palm fruits this coming season so as to increase her earnings and savings. Her children future is of great concern to her and that is why Grace is working very hard to increase her savings so that she will be able to handle her children school fees especially when the get to Secondary school level.
Grace and her group members thanks all Kiva lenders that supports this loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad es una mujer soltera con 24 años de edad, los diversos factores que la han llevado al fracaso en ocasiones anteriores, no son impedimento para intentar de nuevo y salir adelante con sus proyectos, actualmente desea tener su propio negocio, quiere dedicarse a la cría y venta de ganado porcino, el problema es que no cuenta con suficiente capital para hacerlos, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el fin de comprar cerdos y alimento al por mayor para los mismos.
Espera crecer con su negocio, formalizarlo y en llegar a generar empleo a las personas que más lo necesiten.
Sueña con ver su casa bonita, ya que está actualmente no se encuentra en buen estado.

Sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Soledad is 24 years old and single. Various obstacles that have brought failure to Soledad have not stopped her from trying again and moving forward with her plans. She now wants to start her own business: she wants to raise and sell pigs. Her problem, however, is that she does not have enough capital to open this business. She is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy pigs and pig feed in bulk.

Soledad hopes to expand her business, to formalise it, and to generate jobs for those who most need them.

Soledad dreams of having a pretty house as her current home is not in good condition.

Soledad knows that, with the help of Interactuar and those at Kiva, her dreams will become a reality.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed in bulk.

loans.name: Rafayel

texts.en: Rafayel is 31 years old and he lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Rafayel works at the city’s combine in the mechanical department as a locksmith. Rafayel is married and he lives with his wife, two children, his mother and brother. Rafayel is engaged in gardening work also in the nearby village of Kavart. Here he has a nice fruit garden, which gives a sweet harvest of apples, pears and plums. He also cultivates vegetables such as potatoes, beans, cucumbers, cabbages and tomatoes. All the harvest Rafayel uses both for his family and for sale as well. Now, with his first Kiva loan, Rafayel greatly wants to buy young trees of peach and pomegranate, to buy potato and bean seedlings and to repair some of his garden’s fences.

loans.use: to buy young peach and pomegranate trees, to buy potato and bean seedlings and to repair some of his garden's fences.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es una gran madre de familia de 48 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de una hija de 21 años, ellas viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Lucia para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica  a la siembra de hongos, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde la comunidad de su hogar, ella tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este tipo de cultivo. Pero también se dedica al tejido de güipiles típicos.  Lucia afortunadamente su cultivo de hongos es muy demandante pues en su región no cualquier persona se dedica a este tipo de cultivo, por esa razón ella necesita incrementar su  siembra, pero no tiene los recursos suficientes a raíz de esta necesidad ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de más semillas. Lucia tiene el anhelo de mejorar su calidad de siembra y satisfacer mejor las necesidades  de los clientes.
texts.en:
Lucia is 48 years old and a great mother. She is married and has a lovely family, a 21-year-old daughter. The family lives in a community in Solola.

In order to earn an income and move forward with her family, Lucia works growing mushrooms. She does this work from home, and has been growing these crops for ten years. In addition, Lucia makes a living producing typical clothes.

Lucia is lucky that her mushrooms are in great demand and that not many people work in this trade in her region. As a result, Lucia needs to increase her yield but does not have enough capital. She is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy seeds.

Lucia really wants to improve the quality of her crops and better satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy mushrooms.

loans.name: Natali Patricia

texts.es: Natali es una emprendedora de 30 años que reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, ella combina su rol de ama de casa y madre de 3 niños menores de edad con su actividad comercial, a la que decidió incursionar para generar recursos y apoyar con los gastos de su hogar. Ella comercializa calzado femenino que produce su papá quien es zapatero de profesión y promueve ventas mediante visitas a familiares, amigos y vecinos de este modo garantiza una meta de ventas que le proyecta unos buenos ingresos.  Natali está tramitando su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que invertirá en la compra de un buen volumen de calzado para atender la demanda de fin de año. Su meta es poder abrir al público una miscelánea en donde vender además de calzado, diversos artículos cuya venta le proporcione un mayor ingreso y a largo plazo tener los recursos para adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Natali is a 30-year-old entrepreneur who resides in a neighborhood in the town of Barranquilla along with her husband and children. She combines her role of homemaker and mother of three children with her business that she started in order to generate income and help with the household expenses.

Natali sells women’s shoes that are produced by her father, who is a shoemaker by trade. She conducts her sales by visiting relatives, friends, and neighbors. This provides her a sales goal by which she is able to generate a good income. Natali is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest these resources in the purchase of a large volume of shoes so that she can meet the year-end demand. Her goal is to open a variety store to the public where she can sell shoes and other types of merchandise. This will result in more income and in the long term, she will have the resources to acquire a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy a large volume of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur from Vanadzor city in the Lori region, with his first partnership with Kiva and Nor Horizon, mentioned that he greatly hopes that his first loan will be the beginning of a continuous cooperation and today he is already asking for his third Kiva loan. He is very thankful for his previous two loans and thinks that this third one also will be profitable and successful.

Artur lives with his wife and two small daughters. Artur has a car and already, for many years, he has been doing a taxi service. He is a very careful and responsible driver and he cares for and respects all his passengers and drives with great attention. So Artur again hopes to receive Kiva support, as he needs to buy winter tires for his taxi and do some repairs on the interior of his car.

loans.use: to buy winter tires for his taxi and do some repairs on the interior of his car.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en: Hayk is very thankful and happy for his first Kiva and Nor Horizon loan, and thanks to that loan, he bought tractor tires and some spare parts for the tractor. Hayk lives in the village of Tsaghkunk in the Gegharkunik region. He still earns his family's living through giving agricultural services on his tractor in his village and being engaged in farming. On his farm, Hayk has cows, a heifer, bulls, a calf, sheep, and lambs. His farm products (milk, meat, cheese, butter) Hayk’s mother sells right from their farm to their regular customers. He would like very much to have one more Kiva loan to use for the purchase of a cultivator, which will bring more orders for Hayk to work on his village farms.

loans.use: to purchase a cultivator, which will bring more orders for him to work on the village farms.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
The photo above shows Alejandra inside her store of agricultural and veterinary supplies, which is located in front of her house in Buhangin, Davao City. She embarked on this business because she noticed the growing livestock production in their community. Many residents are raising hogs and chickens, so she decided to sell feed, vitamins and medicines for livestock. They don’t need to go downtown just to buy a few kilos of feed for their hogs or chickens. In a way, Alejandra helps them while she also earns a living.

Alejandra’s husband, Mario, is a driver with an irregular income. This is why she combines her profit with her husband’s income in order to sustain their daily needs. But they have children who are still in high school and they want to prepare early for their college expenses. Alejandra seeks additional capital worth PHP 50,000 to buy more sacks of feed for hogs and chickens plus additional medicines and vitamins. If her business will continually progress, she will put up more agri-vet stores in other rural communities to give easy access for livestock raisers.

Alejandra is an inspiration to her co-fellowship members* at CCT who regularly meet every week to reflect on God’s words and share stories about life and their businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feed for hogs and chickens plus additional medicines and vitamins.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
At her old age of 65, Erlinda doesn’t want to stop working yet. She feels productive when she earns money by herself. She doesn’t want to depend on her grown-up children because they have their own families to raise and support too. She enjoys sewing pillow cases, blankets and curtains and selling these to her neighbors and friends. Her income sustains her daily needs. She is a widow living near her grown-up children in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental.

Erlinda is also busy selling frozen foods such as hotdogs, chorizos, dressed chicken and pork meats. She saves some of her profits for emergency purposes.

Erlinda normally experiences stiff competition in business, but she focuses on her goal to be productive and continue earning a living. It fuels her to expand her business by making it more enticing to customers. She plans to buy more beautifully designed cloths and fabrics that she can make into pillow cases, blankets and curtains. She will also buy an additional volume of frozen products to sell. She needs additional capital worth PHP 10,000 to buy these items so she can gain extra profit and savings in case of emergencies.

She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.
